[Paris]1-paris hints of sacrifice . — But here [we]365-we deal with that large dusty facet known to indulgent and congruous kind . It is in [its]366-its capacity of [delicious inn]367-delicious inn and majestic [Baedeker]2-baedeker , where [western Venuses twang its responsive streets]368-western venuses twang its responsive streets and hush to soft growl before its statues , that it is seen . It is not across [its]366-its Thébaide that [the unscrupulous heroes]369-the unscrupulous heroes chase [each other]370-each other ’s shadows . [They]369-the unscrupulous heroes are largely ignorant of all but [their]369-the unscrupulous heroes restless personal lives . Inconceivably generous and naive faces haunt [the Knackfus Quarter]371-the knackfus quarter . — [We]365-we are not , however , in [a Selim or Vitagraph camp]372-a selim or vitagraph camp ( though “ guns ”[365-we] tap rhythmically the buttocks ) . — Art is being studied . — Art is the smell of oil paint , [Henri Murger]120-henri murger ’s Vie de Bohème , corduroy trousers , [the operatic Italian model]373-the operatic italian model . But the poetry , above all , of linseed oil and turpentine . [The Knackfus Quarter]371-the knackfus quarter is given up to Art . — Letters and other things are round the corner . — [Its]366-its rent is half paid by [America]3-america . [Germany]4-germany occupies [a sensible apartment on [the second floor]376-the second floor]375-a sensible apartment on the second floor . A hundred square yards at [its]4-germany centre is [a convenient space , where [the Boulevard du Paradis]378-the boulevard du paradis and [Boulevard Pfeifer]5-boulevard pfeifer]377-a convenient space , where the boulevard du paradis and boulevard pfeifer cross with [[their]379-their electric trams]380-their electric trams . — In the middle is [a pavement island]381-a pavement island , like vestige of submerged masonry . — [Italian models]382-italian models festoon it in [symmetrical human groups]383-symmetrical human groups ; it is also [[their]382-italian models club]384-their club . — The Café [Berne]9-the berne , at one side , is [the club of [the “ Grands messieurs Du Berne]2051-the “ grands messieurs du berne]2050-the club of the “ grands messieurs du berne . ”[382-italian models] So [you]385-you have [the clap - trap and amorphous Campagnia tribe]386-the clap - trap and amorphous campagnia tribe outside , in [the café twenty sluggish common - sense Germans]387-the café twenty sluggish common - sense germans , a Vitagraph group or two , drinking and playing billiards . These are the most permanent tableaux of [this place]388-this place , disheartening and admonitory as [a Tussaud ’s of The Flood]389-a tussaud ’s of the flood . [Hobson]121-hobson and [Tarr]122-tarr met in [the Boulevard du Paradis]378-the boulevard du paradis . — [They]391-they met in a gingerly , shuffling fashion . [They]391-they had so many good reasons for not slowing down when [they]391-they met : [crowds of little antecedent meetings]392-crowds of little antecedent meetings all revivifying like the bacilli of a harmless fever at the sight of [each other]370-each other : pointing to why [they]391-they should crush [their]391-they hats over [their]391-they eyes and hurry on , so that it was a defeat and insanitary to have [their]391-they bodies shuffling and gesticulating there . “ Why can [not most people , having talked and annoyed each other]2052-not most people , having talked and annoyed each other once or twice , [rebecome strangers]2053-rebecome strangers simply ? Oh , for multitudes of divorces in [[our]2054-our moeurs]2055-our moeurs , more than the old vexed sex ones ! Ah , yes : ah , yes — ! ”[122-tarr] had not [Tarr]122-tarr once put forward , and [Hobson]121-hobson agreed ? “ Have [you]121-hobson been back long ? ”[122-tarr] [Tarr]122-tarr asked with despondent slowness . “ No . [I]121-hobson got back yesterday , ”[121-hobson] said [Hobson]121-hobson , with pleasantly twisted scowl . ( “ [Heavens]123-heavens : One day here only , and lo ! [I]121-hobson meet [him]2056-him . ”[121-hobson] ) “ How is [London]7-london looking , then ? ”[121-hobson] “ Very much as usual . — [I]121-hobson was n’t [there]2057-there the whole time . — [I]121-hobson was in [Cambridge]8-cambridge last week . ”[121-hobson] ( “ [I]122-tarr wish [you]121-hobson ’d go to perdition from time to time , instead of [Cambridge]8-cambridge , as it always is , [you]121-hobson grim , grim dog ! ”[122-tarr] [Tarr]122-tarr wished behind the veil . ) [They]394-they went to [the Berne]9-the berne to have a drink . [They]394-they sat for some minutes with what appeared a stately discomfort of self - consciousness , staring in front of [them]394-they . — It was really only a dreary , boiling anger with [themselves]394-they , with the contradictions of civilized life , the immense and intricate camouflage over the hatred that personal diversities engender . “ Phew , phew ! ”[394-they] A tenuous howl , like a subterranean wind , rose from the borderland of [their]394-they consciousness . [They]394-they were there on the point of opening with tired , ashamed fingers , well - worn pages of [their]394-they souls , soon to be muttering between [their]394-they teeth the hackneyed pages to [each other]370-each other : resentful in different degrees and disproportionate ways . And so [they]394-they sat with this absurd travesty of [a Quaker]396-a quaker ’s meeting : shyness appearing to emanate masterfully from [Tarr]122-tarr . And in another case , with almost [any one]397-any one but [Hobson]121-hobson , it might have been shyness . For [Tarr]122-tarr had a gauche , Puritanical ritual of self , the result of solitary habits . Certain observances were demanded of [those approaching]398-those approaching , and quite gratuitously observed in return . The fetish within — soul - dweller that is strikingly like [wood - dweller , and who was not often enough disturbed to have had sylvan shyness mitigated]399-wood - dweller , and who was not often enough disturbed to have had sylvan shyness mitigated — would still cling to these forms . Sometimes [Tarr]122-tarr ’s cunning idol , aghast at its nakedness , would manage to borrow or purloin some shape of covering from [elegantly draped visitor]400-elegantly draped visitor . But for [Hobson]121-hobson ’s outfit [he]122-tarr had the greatest contempt . This was [Alan Hobson]121-hobson ’s outfit . — [A Cambridge cut]401-a cambridge cut disfigured [his]121-hobson originally manly and melodramatic form . [[His]121-hobson father]402-his father was [a wealthy merchant somewhere in [Egypt]10-egypt]403-a wealthy merchant somewhere in egypt . [He]402-his father was very athletic , and [his]402-his father dark and cavernous features had been constructed by Nature as a lurking - place for villainies and passions . [He]402-his father was untrue to [his]402-his father rascally , sinuous body . [He]402-his father slouched and ambled along , neglecting [his]402-his father muscles : and [his]402-his father dastardly face attempted to portray delicacies of common sense , and gossamer - like backslidings into the Inane that would have puzzled [a bile - specialist]404-a bile - specialist . [He]402-his father would occasionally exploit [his]402-his father blackguardly appearance and [blacksmith]405-blacksmith ’s muscles for a short time , however . And [his]402-his father strong , piercing laugh threw A B C waitresses into confusion . The Art - touch , [the Bloomsbury stain]406-the bloomsbury stain , was very observable . [Hobson]121-hobson ’s Harris tweeds were shabby . A hat suggesting that [[his]402-his father ancestors]407-his ancestors had been [Plainsmen]408-plainsmen or [some rough sunny folk]409-some rough sunny folk , shaded unnecessarily [his]402-his father countenance , already far from open . The material for conversation afforded by a short sea voyage , an absence , a panama hat on [[his]402-his father companion]410-his companion ’s head , had been exhausted . — [Tarr]122-tarr possessed no deft hand or economy of force . [His]402-his father muscles rose unnecessarily on [his]402-his father arm to lift a wine - glass to [his]402-his father lips . [He]402-his father had no social machinery , but [the cumbrous one of the intellect]411-the cumbrous one of the intellect . [He]402-his father danced about with this , it is true . But it was full of sinister piston - rods , organ - like shapes , heavy drills . — When [he]402-his father tried to be amiable , [he]402-his father usually only succeeded in being ominous . It was an effort to talk to [Hobson]121-hobson . For this effort a great bulk of nervous force was awoken . [It]412-it got to work and wove its large anomalous patterns . [It]412-it took the subject that was foremost in [his]402-his father existence and imposed it on [their]413-their talk . [Tarr]122-tarr turned to [Hobson]121-hobson , and seized [him]121-hobson , conversationally , by the hair . “ Well , [Walt Whitman]124-walt whitman , when are [you]121-hobson going to get [your]121-hobson hair cut ? ”[122-tarr] “ Why do [you]124-walt whitman call [me]122-tarr [Walt Whitman]124-walt whitman ? ”[122-tarr] “ Would [you]124-walt whitman prefer [Buffalo Bill]125-buffalo bill ? Or is it [Shakespeare]126-shakespeare ? ”[122-tarr] “ It is not [Shakespeare----]127-shakespeare---- ”[122-tarr] “ ‘ Roi je ne suis : [prince je ne daigne]2058-prince je ne daigne . ’ — That ’s [Hobson]121-hobson ’s choice . — But why so much hair ? [I]122-tarr do n’t wear [my]122-tarr hair long . If [you]121-hobson had as many reasons for wearing it long as [I]122-tarr have , [we]413-their should see it flowing round [your]121-hobson ankles ”[122-tarr] “ [I]122-tarr might ask [you]121-hobson under those circumstances why [you]121-hobson wear it short . But [I]122-tarr expect [you]121-hobson have good reasons for that , too . [I]122-tarr ca n’t see why [you]121-hobson should resent [my]122-tarr innocent device . However long [I]122-tarr wore it [I]122-tarr should not damage [you]121-hobson by [my]122-tarr competition---- ”[122-tarr] [Tarr]122-tarr rattled the cement match - stand on the table , and the garçon sang “ Toute suite , [toute suite]2059-toute suite ! ”[122-tarr] “ [Hobson]121-hobson , [you]121-hobson were telling [me]122-tarr about [a studio to let]2060-a studio to let before [you]121-hobson left . — [I]122-tarr forget the details---- ”[122-tarr] “ Was it one behind the Panthéon ? ”[122-tarr] “ That ’s it . — Was there electric light ? ”[122-tarr] “ No , [I]122-tarr do n’t think there was electric light . But [I]122-tarr can find out for [you]121-hobson . ”[122-tarr] “ How did [you]121-hobson come to hear of it ? ”[122-tarr] “ Through a German [I]122-tarr know — [Salle]11-salle , [Salla]12-salla , or something . ”[122-tarr] “ What was [the street]2061-the street ? ”[122-tarr] “ [The Rue Lhomond]13-the rue lhomond . [I]122-tarr forget the number . ”[122-tarr] “ [I]122-tarr ’ll go and have a look at it after lunch . — What on earth possesses [you]121-hobson to know so many [Germans]128-germans ? ”[122-tarr] [Tarr]122-tarr asked , sighing . “ Do n’t [you]121-hobson like [Germans]128-germans ? — [You]121-hobson ’ve just been too intimate with [one]2062-one : that ’s what it is . ”[122-tarr] “ Perhaps [I]122-tarr have . ”[122-tarr] “ [A female German]2063-a female german . ”[122-tarr] “ The sex weakens the ‘ German , ’ surely . ”[122-tarr] “ Does it in [Fräulein Lunken]129-fräulein lunken ’s case ? ”[122-tarr] “ Oh , [you]121-hobson know [her]2063-a female german , do [you]121-hobson ? — Of course , [you]121-hobson would know [her]2063-a female german , as [she]2063-a female german ’s [a German]2064-a german . ”[122-tarr] [Alan Hobson]121-hobson cackled morosely , like [a very sad topdog trying to imitate a rooster]414-a very sad topdog trying to imitate a rooster . [Tarr]122-tarr ’s unwieldy playfulness , might in the chequered northern shade , in conjunction with nut - brown ale , gazed at by [some Rowlandson]130-some rowlandson — [he]130-some rowlandson on the ultimate borders of the epoch — have pleased by its à propos . But when the last [Rowlandson]130-some rowlandson dies , the life , too , that [he]130-some rowlandson saw should vanish . Anything that survives [the artist]415-the artist ’s death is not life , but play - acting . This homely , thick - waisted affectation ! — [Hobson]121-hobson yawned and yawned as though [he]121-hobson wished to swallow [Tarr]122-tarr and have done with [him]122-tarr . [Tarr]122-tarr yawned more noisily , rattled [his]122-tarr chair , sat up , haggard and stiff , as though [he]122-tarr wished to frighten this crow away . “ [CarrionCrow]131-carrioncrow ”[122-tarr] was [Tarr]122-tarr ’s name for [Hobson]121-hobson : “ [The olde Crow of [Cairo]14-cairo]2065-the olde crow of cairo , ”[122-tarr] rather longer . Why was [he]121-hobson talking to [this man]416-this man ? However , [he]121-hobson shortly began to lay bare the secrets of [his]121-hobson soul . [Hobson]121-hobson opened : “ It seems to [me]121-hobson , [Tarr]122-tarr , that [you]122-tarr know more [Germans]128-germans than [I]121-hobson do . But [you]122-tarr 're ashamed of it . Hence [your]122-tarr attack . [I]121-hobson met [a Fräulein Fierspitz the other day]2066-a fräulein fierspitz the other day , [a German]2064-a german , who claimed to know [you]122-tarr . [I]121-hobson am always meeting Germans who know [you]122-tarr . [She]2064-a german also referred to [you]122-tarr as [the ‘ official fiancé ’ of [Fräulein Lunken]129-fräulein lunken]2068-the ‘ official fiancé ’ of fräulein lunken . — Are [you]122-tarr [an ‘ official fiancé ’]2069-an ‘ official fiancé ’ ? And if so , what is that , may [I]121-hobson ask ? ”[121-hobson] [Tarr]122-tarr was taken aback , it was evident . [Hobson]121-hobson laughed stridently . [The real man]417-the real man emerging , [he]121-hobson came over quickly on another wave . “ [You]122-tarr not only get to know [Germans]128-germans , [crowds of [them]128-germans]2070-crowds of them , on the sly ; [you]122-tarr make [[your]122-tarr bosom friend of [them]128-germans]2071-your bosom friend of them , engage [yourself]122-tarr to [them]128-germans in marriage and make [Heaven]113-heaven knows how many more solemn pacts , covenants , and agreements . — It ’s bound all to come out some day . What will [you]122-tarr do then ? ”[121-hobson] [Tarr]122-tarr was recovering gracefully from [his]122-tarr relapse into discomfort . If ever taken off [his]122-tarr guard , [he]122-tarr made a clever use immediately afterwards of [his]122-tarr naïveté . [He]122-tarr beamed on [his]122-tarr slip . [He]122-tarr would swallow it tranquilly , assimilating it , with ostentation , to [himself]122-tarr . When some personal weakness slipped out [he]122-tarr would pick it up unabashed , look at it smilingly , and put it back in [his]122-tarr pocket . “ As [you]122-tarr know , ”[122-tarr] [he]122-tarr soon replied , “ ‘ engagement ’ is an euphemism . And , as a matter of fact , [[my]122-tarr girl]2072-my girl publicly announced the breaking off of [our]2073-our engagement yesterday . ”[122-tarr] [He]122-tarr looked [a complete child]418-a complete child , head thrown up as though proclaiming something [he]122-tarr had reason to be particularly proud of . — [Hobson]121-hobson laughed convulsively , cracking [his]121-hobson yellow fingers . “ Yes , it is funny , if [you]122-tarr look at it in that way . — [I]121-hobson let [her]2072-my girl announce [our]2073-our engagement or the reverse just as [she]2072-my girl likes . That has been [our]2073-our arrangement from the start . [I]121-hobson never know at any given time whether [I]121-hobson am engaged or not . [I]121-hobson leave all that sort of thing entirely in [her]2072-my girl hands . After a severe quarrel [I]121-hobson am pretty certain that [I]121-hobson am temporarily unattached , the link publicly severed somewhere or other . ”[121-hobson] “ Possibly that is what is meant by ‘ official fiancé ’ ? ”[121-hobson] “ Very likely . ”[122-tarr] [He]122-tarr had been hustled — through [his]122-tarr vanity , [the Cairo Cantabian]133-the cairo cantabian thought — somewhere where the time could be passed . [He]122-tarr did not hesitate to handle [Tarr]122-tarr ’s curiosities . — It is a graceful compliment to offer the nectar of some ulcer to [[your]419-your neighbour]420-your neighbour . [The modern man]421-the modern man understands [his]421-the modern man udders and taps . — With an obscene heroism [Tarr]122-tarr displayed [his]122-tarr . [[His]122-tarr companion]410-his companion wrenched at it with malice . [Tarr]122-tarr pulled a wry face once or twice at the other ’s sans gêne . But [he]122-tarr was proud of what [he]122-tarr could stand . [He]122-tarr had a hazy image of [a shrewd old countryman]423-a shrewd old countryman in contact with the sharpness of [the town]424-the town . [He]122-tarr would not shrink . But [he]121-hobson relapsed . “ [You]121-hobson reply , ‘ What is all this fuss about ? [He]122-tarr was clean - shaven , with a shallow , square jaw and straight , thick mouth . — [His]122-tarr hands were square and usually hot . [He]122-tarr felt them deeply . [He]122-tarr was experimental and modest . A rude and hard infancy , according to [Balzac]152-balzac , is best for development of character . [A child]499-a child learns duplicity , and hardens in defence . — [An enervating childhood of molly - coddling]500-an enervating childhood of molly - coddling , on the other hand , such as [Tarr]122-tarr ’s , has its advantages . — [He]122-tarr was [an only child of [a selfish , vigorous mother]502-a selfish , vigorous mother]501-an only child of a selfish , vigorous mother . The long foundation of delicate trustfulness and childishness makes for a store of illusion to prolong youth and health beyond the usual term . [Tarr]122-tarr , with the Balzac upbringing , would have had a little too much character , like [a rather too muscular man]503-a rather too muscular man . [You]504-you would have thought [he]122-tarr had an iron - field behind [him]122-tarr . When [he]122-tarr solicited advice , it was transparently a matter of form . [The peasant - girl]2236-the peasant - girl — if such it were — would not hold [you]2235-you for ever ; even less so [the spoiled peasant]2237-the spoiled peasant . — But that ’s where the mischief lies . — That [bourgeois , spoiled , ridiculous element]2238-bourgeois , spoiled , ridiculous element was the trap . [I]122-tarr was innocently depraved enough to find it irresistible . It had the charm of a vulgar wall - paper , a gimcrack ornament . A cosy banality set in the midst of a rough life . Youthful exoticism has done it , the something different from [oneself]2239-oneself . ”[122-tarr] [Butcher]150-butcher did not roll [his]150-butcher eyes any more . They looked rather moist . [Butcher]150-butcher was like a dog , with [his]150-butcher rheumy eyes . “ [My]122-tarr romance , [you]150-butcher see , is exactly inverse to [yours]150-butcher , ”[122-tarr] [Tarr]122-tarr proceeded . “ But pure unadulterated romanticism with [me]122-tarr is in about the same rudimentary state as sex . So [they]2240-they had perhaps better keep together ? [I]122-tarr only allow [myself]122-tarr to philander with little things . [I]122-tarr have succeeded in shunting [our]2241-our noxious illusionism away from the great spaces and ambitions . [I]122-tarr have billeted it with [a bourgeoise]2227-a bourgeoise in [a villa]2243-a villa . These things are all arranged above [our]2241-our heads . They are no doubt self - protective . [Each person]2246-each person boasts some notable invention of personal application only . “[122-tarr] So there [I]0-i am fixed with [[my]0-i bourgeoise]514-my bourgeoise in [my]0-i skin , dans ma peau . What is the next step ? — The body is the main thing . — But [I]0-i think [I]0-i have made a discovery . In sex [I]0-i am romantic and arriéré . It would be healthier for all sex to be so . But that is another matter . Well , [I]0-i can not see [myself]0-i attracted by [an exceptional woman — ‘ spiritual ’ woman]515-an exceptional woman — ‘ spiritual ’ woman — ‘ noble soul , ’ or even [a particularly refined and witty animal]516-a particularly refined and witty animal . — [I]0-i do not understand attraction for [such beings]517-such beings . — [Their]517-such beings existence appears to [me]0-i quite natural and proper , but , not being as fine as [men]518-men ; not being as fine as pictures or poems ; not being as fine as [housewives]519-housewives or [classical Mothers of [Men]518-men]520-classical mothers of men ; [they]517-such beings appear to [me]0-i to occupy an unfortunate position on [this earth]522-this earth . [No man]523-no man properly demarcated as [I]0-i am will have much to do with [them]517-such beings . [They]517-such beings are very beautiful to look at . But [they]517-such beings are unfortunately alive , and usually cats . If [you]524-you married one of [them]517-such beings , out of pity , [you]524-you would have to support the eternal grin of a Gioconda fixed complacently on [you]524-you at all hours of the day , the pretensions of a piece of canvas that had sold for thirty thousand pounds . [You]524-you could not put [your]524-you foot through the canvas without being hanged . [You]524-you would not be able to sell it [yourself]524-you for that figure , and so get some little compensation . Tout au plus , if the sentimental grin would not otherwise come off , [you]524-you could break its jaw , perhaps . ” [Butcher]150-butcher flung [his]150-butcher head up , and laughed affectedly . “[524-you] Ha ha ! ” — [he]150-butcher went again . “[524-you] Very good ! — Very good ! — [I]0-i know who [you]0-i ’re thinking of , ” [he]0-i said . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i ? Oh , the ‘ Gioconda smile , ’ [you]0-i mean ? — Yes . — In that instance , [the man]2084-the man had only [his]2084-the man silly sentimental self to blame . [He]2084-the man has paid the biggest price given in [our]526-our time for a living masterpiece . Sentimentalizing about masterpieces and sentimental prices will soon have seen [their]517-such beings day , [I]0-i expect . New masterpieces in painting will then appear again , perhaps , where [the live ones leagued with the old dead ones]527-the live ones leagued with the old dead ones disappear . — Really , the more one considers it , the more creditable and excellent [my]0-i self - organization appears . [I]0-i have a great deal to congratulate [myself]0-i upon . ” [Butcher]150-butcher blinked and pulled [himself]150-butcher together with a grave dissatisfied expression . “[0-i] But will [you]0-i carry it into effect to the extent ? — Will [you]0-i ? — Would marriage be the ideal termination ? ” — [Butcher]150-butcher had a way of tearing up and beginning all over again on a new breath . “[0-i] That is what [Hobson]121-hobson asked . — No , [I]0-i do n’t think marriage has anything to do with it . That is another question altogether . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [your]0-i remarks about [the housewife]528-the housewife suggested---- ” “[0-i] No . — [My]0-i relation to the idea of [the housewife]528-the housewife Is platonic . [Butcher]150-butcher was always surly about [women]2149-women , or rather [men]518-men ’s tenderness for [them]2149-women . [I]122-tarr have treated [Bertha]177-bertha very badly . ”[122-tarr] [Butcher]150-butcher smothered a hiccup . — [He]150-butcher ordered another drink . “ Yes , [I]150-butcher owe [[my]150-butcher girl]2072-my girl anything [I]150-butcher can give [her]2072-my girl . It is hardly [my]150-butcher fault . With the training [you]2248-you get in [England]25-england , how can [you]2248-you be expected to realize anything ? [The University of Humour that prevails everywhere in [England]25-england]2249-the university of humour that prevails everywhere in england as [the national institution for developing youth]2250-the national institution for developing youth , provides [you]2248-you with nothing but a first - rate means of evading reality . The whole of English training — the great fundamental spirit of [the country]2251-the country — is a system of deadening feeling , a prescription for Stoicism . Many of the results are excellent . It saves [us]2252-our from gush in many cases ; it is an excellent armour in times of crisis or misfortune . [The English soldier]2253-the english soldier gets [his]2253-the english soldier special cachet from it . But for the sake of this wonderful panacea — English humour — [we]2252-our sacrifice much . It would be better to face [our]2252-our Imagination and [our]2252-our nerves without this soporific . Once this armature breaks down , [the man underneath]2254-the man underneath is found in many cases to have become softened by it . [He]2254-the man underneath is subject to shock , oversensitiveness , and many ailments not met with in the more frank and direct races . [Their]2254-the man underneath superficial sensitiveness allows of a harder core . — To set against this , of course , [you]2248-you have the immense reserves of delicacy , touchiness , sympathy , that this envelope of cynicism has accumulated . It has served English art marvellously . But it is probably more useful for art than for practical affairs . And [the artist]415-the artist could always look after [himself]415-the artist . Anyhow , the time seems to have arrived in [my]150-butcher life , as [I]150-butcher consider it has arrived in the life of [the country]2251-the country , to discard this husk and armour . Life must be met on other terms than those of fun and sport . ”[150-butcher] [Butcher]150-butcher guffawed provocatively . [Tarr]122-tarr joined [him]150-butcher . There are cold ones and hot ones . ” [He]154-lowndes looked up . “[547-german women] It all seems to depend what [you]154-lowndes are like ! ” “[547-german women] [I]0-i am cold ; inclined to be fat ; forte tete ; and swarthy , as [you]154-lowndes see . ” “[154-lowndes] In that case , if [you]154-lowndes took plenty of exercise , ” [Lowndes]154-lowndes undulated [himself]154-lowndes as though for the passage of the large bubbles of chuckle , “[154-lowndes] [I]0-i should think that [German women]547-german women would suit [you]154-lowndes very well ! ” [Tarr]122-tarr rose . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had n’t come to see [you]154-lowndes , [Lowndes]154-lowndes . [Your]154-lowndes answer is disappointing . ” [Lowndes]154-lowndes got up , disturbed at [Tarr]122-tarr ’s sign of departure . “[154-lowndes] [I]0-i ’m sorry . But [I]0-i ’m not [an authority]557-an authority . ” [He]154-lowndes leant against the fireplace to arrest [Tarr]122-tarr ’s withdrawal for a minute or two . “[557-an authority] Are [you]154-lowndes doing much work ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ? [I]0-i should like to come round some day---- ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m just moving into [a new studio]558-a new studio . ” [Lowndes]154-lowndes looked suddenly at [his]154-lowndes watch , with calculated , ape - like impulsiveness . “[0-i] Where are [you]154-lowndes having lunch ? [He]154-lowndes was rather wounded , or brusque , by the brevity of [Tarr]122-tarr ’s visit . [His]122-tarr “[154-lowndes] morning ” had not received enough respect . [It]2311-it had been treated , in fact , cavalierly . [His]122-tarr “[154-lowndes] work ” had not been directly mentioned . When [Tarr]122-tarr got outside , [he]122-tarr stood on [the narrow pavement]2312-the narrow pavement , looking into [a shop]2313-a shop window . [It]2313-a shop was [a florist ’s]2314-a florist ’s and contained a great variety of flowers . [He]122-tarr was surprised to find that [he]122-tarr did not know a single flower by name . [He]122-tarr hung on in front of [this shop]2315-this shop before pushing off , as [a swimmer]2316-a swimmer does to a rock , waving [his]122-tarr legs . Then [he]122-tarr got back into [the street from which [his]122-tarr visit to [Lowndes]154-lowndes had deflected [him]122-tarr]2317-the street from which his visit to lowndes had deflected him . [He]122-tarr let [himself]122-tarr drift down [it]2317-the street from which his visit to lowndes had deflected him . [He]122-tarr still had some way to go before [he]122-tarr need decide between [the Rue Martine]2318-the rue martine ( where [Bertha]177-bertha lived ) and [the Rue Lhomond]2319-the rue lhomond . [He]122-tarr had not found resolution in [his]122-tarr talks . That already existed , the fruit of various other conversations on [his]122-tarr matrimonial position — held with [the victim]2320-the victim , [Fraulein Lunken]160-fraulein lunken , [herself]177-bertha . Not to go near [Bertha]177-bertha was the negative programme for that particular day . To keep away was seldom easy . But ever since [his]122-tarr conversation at [the Berne]2321-the berne [he]122-tarr had been conscious of the absurd easiness of doing so , if [he]122-tarr wished . [He]122-tarr had not the least inclination to go to [the Rue Martine!—This]32-the rue martine!—this sensation was so grateful that its object shared in its effect . [He]122-tarr determined to go and see [her]177-bertha . [He]122-tarr wanted to enjoy [his]122-tarr present feeling of indifference . Where best to enjoy it was no doubt where [she]177-bertha was . As to [the studio]2279-the studio , [he]122-tarr hesitated . A new situation was created by this new feeling of indifference . Its duration could not be gauged.—He wished to stay in [Paris]1-paris just then to finish some paintings begun some months before . [He]122-tarr substituted for [the Impressionist]2323-the impressionist ’s necessity to remain in front of the object being represented , a sensation of the desirability of finishing a canvas in the place where it was begun . [He]122-tarr had [an Impressionist]2324-an impressionist ’s horror of change . So [Tarr]122-tarr had evolved a plan . At first sight it was wicked . It was no blacker than most of [his]122-tarr ingenuities . [Bertha]177-bertha , as [he]122-tarr had suggested to [Butcher]150-butcher , [he]122-tarr had in some lymphatic way , dans la peau . It appeared a matter of physical discomfort to leave [her]177-bertha altogether . It must be done gradually . So [he]122-tarr had thought that , instead of going away to [England]25-england - where the separation might cause [him]122-tarr restlessness , [he]122-tarr had perhaps better settle down in [[her]177-bertha neighbour]2325-her neighbour , [hood]2326-hood . Through a series of specially tended ennuis , [he]122-tarr would soon find [himself]122-tarr in a position to depart . So the extreme nearness of [the studio]2279-the studio to [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s flat]2328-bertha ’s flat was only another inducement for [him]122-tarr to take it . “[154-lowndes] If [it]562-it were next door , so much the better ! ” [he]122-tarr thought . Now for this famous feeling of indifference . Was there anything in it ? — [The studio]2279-the studio for the moment should be put aside . [He]122-tarr would go to see [Bertha]177-bertha . Let this visit solve this question . The new summer heat drew heavy pleasant ghosts out of the ground , like plants disappeared in winter ; spectres of energy , bulking the hot air with vigorous dreams . Or [they]2330-they had entered into the trees , in imitation of [Pagan gods]2331-pagan gods , and nodded [their]2330-they delicate distant intoxication to [him]122-tarr . Visions were released in the sap , with scented explosion , the spring one bustling and tremendous reminiscence . [Tarr]122-tarr felt [the street]2061-the street was a pleasant current , setting from [some immense and tropic gulf]2333-some immense and tropic gulf , neighboured by [Floridas of remote invasions]2334-floridas of remote invasions . [He]122-tarr ambled down [it]2061-the street puissantly , shoulders shaped like these waves ; a heavy - sided drunken fish . [The houses]2335-the houses , with winks of the shocked clockwork , were grazed , holding along their surface thick soft warmth . It poured weakly into [his]122-tarr veins . A big dog wandering on [its]562-it easily transposable business , inviting some delightful accident to deflect it from maudlin and massive promenade . In [his]122-tarr mind , too , as in the dog ’s , [his]122-tarr business was doubtful — a small black spot ahead in [his]122-tarr brain , half puzzling but peremptory . The mat heavy light grey of [putty - coloured houses]2336-putty - coloured houses , like thickening merely of hot summer atmosphere without sun , gave a spirituality to this deluge of animal well - being , in weighty pale sense - solidarity . Through the opaquer atmosphere sounds came lazily or tinglingly . [People]430-people had become a Balzacian species , boldly tragic and comic : like a cast of “[154-lowndes] Comédie Humaine ” humanity off for the day , [Balzac]152-balzac sleeping immensely in [the cemetery]2338-the cemetery . [Tarr]122-tarr stopped at [a dairy]2339-a dairy . [He]122-tarr bought saladed potatoes , a petit suisse . The coolness , as [he]122-tarr entered , felt eerie . [The dairyman]2340-the dairyman , in blue - striped smock and black cap , peaked and cylindrical , came out of [an inner room]2341-an inner room . Through [its]2340-the dairyman glasses [several women]2342-several women were visible , busy at a meal . [This man]416-this man ’s isolation from the heat and mood of [the world outside]2344-the world outside , impressed [[his]416-this man customer]2345-his customer as [he]416-this man came forward with a truculent “[563-monsieur] [Monsieur]563-monsieur ! ” [Tarr]122-tarr , while [his]122-tarr things were done up , watched [the women]2346-the women . The discreet voices , severe reserve of keen business preoccupations , showed the usual [Paris]1-paris commerçante . The white , black , and slate - grey of dresses , extreme neatness , silent felt over - slippers , make [their]2346-the women commercial devotions rather conventual . With this purchase — followed by one of strawberries at [a fruiterer ’s opposite]2347-a fruiterer ’s opposite — [his]122-tarr destination was no longer doubtful . [He]122-tarr was going to [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s]2348-bertha ’s to eat [his]122-tarr lunch . Hence the double quantity of saladed potatoes . [He]122-tarr skirted the railings of [the Luxembourg Gardens]33-the luxembourg gardens for fifteen yards . At [its]2351-a short avenue of trees end [Bertha]177-bertha lived in [a three - story house]2352-a three - story house . The leaden brilliant green of spring foliage hung above [him]122-tarr , ticketing innumerably the trees , sultry smoke volumes from [factories in [Fairyland]35-fairyland]2353-factories in fairyland . Its novelty , fresh yet dead , had the effectiveness of an unnecessary mirage . The charm of habit and monotony [he]122-tarr had come to affront seemed to have coloured , chemically , these approaches to [[its]177-bertha home]2354-its home . [He]122-tarr found [Bertha]177-bertha ’s eye fixed on [him]122-tarr with a sort of humorous indifferent query from the window . [He]122-tarr smiled , thinking what would be the veritable answer ! On finding [himself]122-tarr in the presence of the object of [his]122-tarr erudite discussion , [he]122-tarr felt [he]122-tarr had got the focus wrong . This familiar life , with its ironical eye , mocked at [him]122-tarr too . [It]177-bertha was aware of the subject of [his]122-tarr late conversation . The twin of the shrewd feeling embodied in the observation , “[563-monsieur] One can never escape from [oneself]564-oneself , ” appeared . This ironical unsurprised eye at the window , so vaguely apropos , offended [him]122-tarr . [It]177-bertha seemed to be making fun of the swaggering indifference [he]122-tarr was bringing to bask in the presence of its object . [He]122-tarr became slightly truculent . “[563-monsieur] Have [you]565-you had lunch yet , [[my]0-i dear]465-my dear ? ” [he]122-tarr asked , as [she]565-you opened the door to [him]122-tarr . “[565-you] [I]0-i ’ve brought [you]565-you some strawberries . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t expect [you]565-you , [Sorbet]161-sorbet . [I]0-i was just going to get it . ” ( [Sorbet]161-sorbet , or in English , [Sherbert]162-sherbert , was [his]122-tarr nom d’amour , a perversion of [his]122-tarr name , [Sorbert]270-sorbert ) . [Bertha]177-bertha ’s was the intellectually fostered Greek type of German handsomeness . It is also found in the pages of Prussian art periodicals , the arid , empty intellectualism of [Munich]30-munich . [She]177-bertha had been [a heavy baby]2358-a heavy baby . Had [his]122-tarr rich and calm feeling of bounty towards [her]177-bertha survived the encounter , [his]122-tarr “[568-you] indifference ” might also have remained intact . A long slim hinged shell , it nipped in a little cartridge of tobacco , which [it]2376-it then slipped with inside a paper tube , and slipping out again empty , the cigarette was made . [Tarr]122-tarr began manufacturing cigarettes . Reflections from the shining metal in [his]122-tarr hand scurried about amongst the bilious bric - a - brac . Like a layer of water lying on one of oil , the light heated stretch by the windows appeared distinct from the shadowed part of [the room]2366-the room . [This place]388-this place was cheap and dead , but rich with the same lifelessness as the trees without . These looked extremely near and familiar at the opened windows , breathing the same air continually as [Bertha]177-bertha . But they were dusty , rough , and real . [Bertha]177-bertha came in from [the kitchen]2365-the kitchen . [She]177-bertha went on with a trivial rearrangement of [her]177-bertha writing - table . This had been [her]177-bertha occupation as [he]122-tarr appeared at the gate beneath , drawing [her]177-bertha ironical and musing eye from [his]122-tarr image to [himself]122-tarr . A new photograph of [Tarr]122-tarr was being placed on [her]177-bertha writing - table flush with the window . Ten days previously it had been taken in [that room]2380-that room . [It]2381-it had ousted [a Klinger]168-a klinger and generally created a restlessness , to [her]177-bertha eye , in the other objects . “[0-i] Ah , [you]568-you ’ve got the photographs , have [you]568-you ? — Is that [me]0-i ? ” [She]177-bertha handed it to [him]122-tarr . “[0-i] Yes , they came yesterday ! ” “[0-i] Yesterday ” [he]122-tarr had not been [there]2057-there ! Whatever [he]122-tarr asked at the present moment would draw a softly thudding answer , heavy German reproach concealed in it with tireless ingenuity . These photographs would under other circumstances have been produced on [his]122-tarr arrival with considerable noise . [Tarr]122-tarr had looked rather askance at this portrait and [Bertha]177-bertha ’s occupation . There was [his]122-tarr photograph , calmly , with an air of permanence , taking up its position on [her]177-bertha writing - table , just as [he]122-tarr was preparing to vanish for good . “[0-i] Let ’s see [yours]569-them , ” [he]122-tarr said , still holding the photograph . What strange effects all this complicated activity inside had on the surface , [his]122-tarr face . A set sulky stagnation , every violence dropping an imperceptible shade on to it , the features overgrown with this strange stuff — that twist of the head that was [him]122-tarr , and that could only be got rid of by breaking . “[0-i] They ’re no good , ” [she]177-bertha said , closing the drawer , handing [her]177-bertha photographs , sandwiched with tissue paper , to [Sorbert]270-sorbert . “[0-i] That one ” — a sitting pose , face yearning from photograph , lighted , not with a smile , but a sort of sentimental illumination , the drapery arranged like a poster — “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t think that ’s so bad , ” [she]177-bertha said slangily , meant to be curt and “[0-i] cheeky . ” “[0-i] What [an idiot]570-an idiot ! ” [he]122-tarr thought ; “[570-an idiot] what a face ! ” A consciously pathetic ghost of a smile , a clumsy sweetness , the energetic sentimental claim of a rather rough but frank self . There was a photograph of [her]177-bertha in riding habit . This was the best of [them]569-them . [He]122-tarr softened . Then came a photograph of [them]569-them together . How strangely that twist of [his]122-tarr , or set angle of the head , fitted in with the corresponding peculiarities of [the woman]2383-the woman ’s head and bust . What abysms of idiocy [I]571-i Rubbishy hours and months formed the atmosphere around [these two futile dolls]2384-these two futile dolls ! [He]122-tarr put the photographs down and looked up . [She]177-bertha was sitting on the edge of the table . The dressing gown was open , and one large thigh , with ugly whiteness , slid half out of it . It looked dead , and connected with [her]177-bertha like [a ventriloquist ’s dummy with [its master]2386-its master]2385-a ventriloquist ’s dummy with its master . It was natural to wonder where [his]122-tarr senses had gone in looking at these decorous photographs . This exhibition appeared to be [her]177-bertha explanation of the matter . The face was not very original . But a thigh can not be stupid to the same degree . [He]122-tarr gazed surlily . [Her]177-bertha musing expression at this moment was supremely absurd . [He]122-tarr smiled and turned [his]122-tarr face to the window . [She]177-bertha pretended to become conscious suddenly of something amiss . [She]177-bertha drew the dressing - gown round [her]177-bertha . “[571-i] Have [you]571-i paid [the man]2084-the man yet ? What did [he]2084-the man charge ? [He]2084-the man ’s coming to photograph [Miss Goenthner]169-miss goenthner to - morrow . ” [They]2387-they sat without saying anything . [He]122-tarr examined [the room]2366-the room as [you]2389-you do [[a doctor]2390-a doctor ’s waiting room]2391-a doctor ’s waiting room . [He]122-tarr had just come there to see if [he]122-tarr could turn [his]122-tarr back on [it]2366-the room . That appeared at first sight a very easy matter . That is why [he]122-tarr so far had not succeeded in doing so . Never put on [his]122-tarr mettle , [his]122-tarr standing army of will was not sufficient to cope with it . But would [this little room]2392-this little room ever appear worth turning [his]122-tarr back on ? It was the purest distillation of the commonplace . [He]122-tarr had become bewitched by its strangeness . It was the height of the unreal . [Bertha]177-bertha was like [a fairy that [he]122-tarr visited , and “[2084-the man] became engaged ” to in [another world]2394-another world , not the real one]2393-a fairy that he visited , and “ became engaged ” to in another world , not the real one . It was so much [the real ordinary world]2395-the real ordinary world that for [him]122-tarr with [his]122-tarr out - of - the - way experience it was a phantasmagoria . Then what [he]122-tarr had described as [his]122-tarr disease of sport was perpetually fed . Sex even with [him]122-tarr , according to [his]122-tarr analysis , being a sort of ghost , was at [home]2396-home in this gross and buffonic illusion . Something had filled up a blank and become saturated with the blankness . How much would [Bertha]177-bertha mind a separation ? [Tarr]122-tarr saw in [her]177-bertha one of those clear , humorous , superficial natures , [a Venetian]2397-a venetian or [a Viennese]2398-a viennese , the easy product of a cynical and abundant life . [He]122-tarr underrated the potency of [his]122-tarr fascination . Secondly , [he]122-tarr miscalculated the depths of obedient attachment [he]122-tarr had wakened . [They]2399-they sat impatiently waiting . A certain formality had to be observed . Then the business of the day could be proceeded with . [They]2399-they were both bored with the part imposed by [the punctilious and ridiculous god of love]2400-the punctilious and ridiculous god of love . [Bertha]177-bertha , into the bargain , wanted to get on with [her]177-bertha cooking . [She]177-bertha would have cut considerably the reconciliation scene . All [her]177-bertha side of the programme had been conscientiously done . “[571-i] Berthe , tu es une brave fille ! ” “[571-i] Tu trouves ? ” “[571-i] Oui . ” More inaction followed on [Tarr]122-tarr ’s part . [She]177-bertha sometimes thought [he]122-tarr enjoyed these ceremonies . Through girlhood [her]177-bertha strong senses had churned away at [her]177-bertha , and claimed an image from [her]177-bertha gentle and dreamy mind . In its turn the mind had accumulated its impressions of [men]518-men , fancies from books and conversations , and made its hive . So [her]177-bertha senses were presented with the image that was to satisfy and rule [them]2399-they . [They]2399-they flung [themselves]2399-they upon it as [she]177-bertha had flung [herself]177-bertha upon [Tarr]122-tarr . This image left considerable latitude . [Tarr]122-tarr had been the first to fit — rather paradoxically , but all the faster for that . This “[571-i] high standard Aryan female , ” as [Tarr]122-tarr described [her]177-bertha , had arrived , with [him]122-tarr , at the full and headlong condition [we]2402-we agree to name “[571-i] love . ” The image , or type , was thrown away . [The individual]438-the individual took its place . [Bertha]177-bertha had had several sweethearts before [Tarr]122-tarr . [They]2404-they had all left the type - image intact . At most it had been a little blurred by [them]2404-they . It had almost been smashed for [one man]2405-one man , physically resembling [Tarr]122-tarr . But [he]122-tarr had never got quite near enough to do that . [Tarr]122-tarr had characteristically supposed this image to have little sharpness of outline left . [He]122-tarr thought it would not be a very difficult matter for [any one]397-any one to extort its recognition . “[571-i] Vous êtes mon goût , Sorbet . Du bist mein gesmack , ” [she]177-bertha would say . [Tarr]122-tarr was not demonstrative when [she]177-bertha said this . [He]122-tarr could not reciprocate . And [he]122-tarr could not help reflecting whether to be “[573-her] [her]573-her taste ” was very flattering . There must be something the matter with [him]122-tarr . All [her]177-bertha hope centred in [his]122-tarr laziness . [She]177-bertha watched [his]122-tarr weaknesses with a loving eye . [He]122-tarr had much to say about [his]122-tarr under - nature . [She]177-bertha listened attentively . “[571-i] It is the most dangerous quality of all to possess , ” and [he]122-tarr would sententiously add — “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] only [the best people]574-the best people possess it , in common with [the obscure and humble]575-the obscure and humble . It is like a great caravanserai in which [scores of [people]430-people]576-scores of people congregate . It is a disguise in which [such a one , otherwise Pasha]578-such a one , otherwise pasha , circulates among [unembarrassed men]579-unembarrassed men . [He]578-such a one , otherwise pasha brings away stores of wisdom , with much diversion by the way . ” [He]122-tarr saw , however , the danger of [these facilities]2407-these facilities . [The Pasha]170-the pasha had been given a magic mask of humbleness . But the inner nature seemed flowing equally to the mask and the unmasked magnificence . [He]122-tarr was as yet unformed , but wished to form wholly [Pasha]170-the pasha . This under - nature ’s chief use was as a precious viliegiature for [his]122-tarr energy . [Bertha]177-bertha was [the country wench [the more exalted incarnation]2409-the more exalted incarnation had met while on its holidays]2408-the country wench the more exalted incarnation had met while on its holidays , or , wandering [idle Khalife]171-idle khalife , in some concourse of [his]122-tarr surreptitious life . [His]122-tarr three days ’ unannounced and uncommented “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] leave ” had made [Bertha]177-bertha very nervous . [She]177-bertha suffered from the incomplete , unsymmetrical appearance [her]177-bertha life now presented . Everything spread out palpably before [her]177-bertha , that [she]177-bertha could arrange like a roomful of furniture , was how [she]177-bertha liked it . Even in [her]177-bertha present shakedown of a life , [Tarr]122-tarr had noticed the way [he]122-tarr was treated as material for “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] arrangement . ” But [she]177-bertha had never been able to indulge this idiosyncrasy much in the past . This was not the first time that [she]177-bertha had found [herself]177-bertha in a similar position . Hence [her]177-bertha certain air of being at [home]2396-home in [these casual quarters]2411-these casual quarters , which belied [her]177-bertha . [The detested temporary dwelling]2412-the detested temporary dwelling in the last few days had been given a new coat of sombre thought . Found in [accidental quarters]2413-accidental quarters , had [she]177-bertha not been over - delicate in not suggesting an immediate move into something more homelike and permanent . [People]430-people would leave [her]177-bertha there for the rest of [her]177-bertha natural life unless [she]177-bertha were a little brutal and got [herself]177-bertha out somehow . No shadow of un - nice feeling ever tainted [her]177-bertha abject genuineness . Cunning efforts to retain [him]122-tarr abounded . But [she]177-bertha never blamed or turned on [him]122-tarr . [She]177-bertha had given [herself]177-bertha long ago , at once , without ceremony . [She]177-bertha awaited [his]122-tarr thanks or no thanks simply . But the itch of action was on [her]177-bertha . [Tarr]122-tarr ’s absences were like light . [His]122-tarr presence was a shadow . [They]2415-they were both stormy . The last absence had illuminated the undiscipline of [her]177-bertha life . During the revealing luridness , [she]177-bertha got to work . Reconstruction was begun . [She]177-bertha had trusted too much in [Fate]172-fate and obedient waiting [Hymen]173-hymen . [So Bertha]177-bertha had a similar ferment to [[Tarr]122-tarr ’s]2416-tarr ’s . Anger with [herself]177-bertha , dreary appetite for action , would help [her]177-bertha over farewells . [She]177-bertha was familiar enough with them , too , in thought . [She]177-bertha would not stir a hand to change things . [He]122-tarr must do that . [She]177-bertha would only facilitate things in all directions for [him]122-tarr . The new energy delivered attack after attack upon [her]177-bertha hope . [She]177-bertha saw nothing beyond [Tarr]122-tarr but measures of utility . The “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] heart ” had always been [her]177-bertha most cherished ornament . That [Tarr]122-tarr would take with [him]122-tarr , as [she]177-bertha would keep [his]122-tarr ring and the books [he]122-tarr had given [her]177-bertha . [She]177-bertha could not now get it back for the asking . [She]177-bertha did not want it ! [She]177-bertha must indulge [her]177-bertha mania for tasteful arrangement in future without this . Or rather what heart [she]177-bertha had left would be rather like one of those salmon - coloured , corrugated gas office - stoves , compared to a hearth with a fire of pine . [Tarr]122-tarr had not brought [his]122-tarr indifference [there]2057-there to make [it]2057-there play tricks , perform little feats . Nor did [he]122-tarr wish to press it into inhuman actions . It was a humane “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] indifference , ” essentially . So with reluctance [he]122-tarr got up , and went over to [her]580-her . “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] [You]580-her have n’t kissed [me]0-i yet , ” [he]122-tarr said , in imitation of [her]580-her . “[580-her] Why kiss [you]0-i , [Sorbet]161-sorbet ? ” [she]580-her managed to say before [her]580-her lips were closed . [He]122-tarr drew [her]580-her ungraciously and roughly into [his]122-tarr arms , and started kissing [her]580-her on the mouth . [She]580-her covered [him]122-tarr , docilely , with [her]580-her inertia . [He]122-tarr was supposed to be performing a miracle of bringing the dead to life . Gone about too crudely , [the willing mountebank]2418-the willing mountebank , [Death]174-death , had been offended . It is not thus that great spirits are prevailed upon to flee . [Her]580-her “[161-sorbet] indifference ” — [the great , simulated , and traditional]2419-the great , simulated , and traditional — would not be ousted by [an upstart and younger relative]2420-an upstart and younger relative . By [Tarr]122-tarr [himself]122-tarr , grown repentant , yes . But not by another “[578-such a one , otherwise pasha] indifference . ” Then [his]122-tarr brutality stung [her]580-her offended spirit , that had been pursing itself up for so many hours . Tears began rolling tranquilly out of [her]580-her eyes in large dignified drops . They had not been very far back in the wings . [He]122-tarr received them frigidly . [She]580-her was sure , thought [he]122-tarr , to detect something unusual during this scene . Then with [the woman]2383-the woman ’s bustling , desperate , possessive fury , [she]580-her suddenly woke up . [She]580-her disengaged [her]580-her arms wildly and threw them round [his]122-tarr neck , tears becoming torrential . Underneath [the poor comedian that played such antics with such phlegmatic and exasperating persistence]2422-the poor comedian that played such antics with such phlegmatic and exasperating persistence , this distressed being thrust up its trembling mask , like a drowning rat . Dis que tu m’aime ! ” A blurting , hurrying personality rushed right up into [his]122-tarr face . It was like the sightless clammy charging of a bat . [More eloquent regions]2423-more eloquent regions had ambushed [him]122-tarr . [Humbug]175-humbug had mysteriously departed . It was a blast of knife like air in the middle of [[their]2424-their hot - house]2425-their hot - house . [He]122-tarr stared at [her]580-her face groping up as though it scented troubles in [his]122-tarr face . [It]175-humbug pushed to right and then to left and rocked itself . Intelligent and aware , it lost this intensity . A complicated image developed in [his]122-tarr mind as [he]122-tarr stood with [her]580-her . [He]122-tarr was remembering [Schopenhauer]176-schopenhauer . It was of a Chinese puzzle of boxes within boxes , or of insects ’ discarded envelopes . [A woman]2139-a woman had in the middle of [her]580-her a kernel , [a sort of very substantial astral baby]2427-a sort of very substantial astral baby . [This baby]2428-this baby was apt to swell . [She]2139-a woman then became [all baby]2429-all baby . The husk [he]122-tarr held was a painted mummy - case . [He]122-tarr was a mummy - case too . Only [he]122-tarr contained nothing but innumerable other painted cases inside , smaller and smaller ones . The smallest was not a substantial astral baby , however , or live core , but a painting like the rest . [His]122-tarr kernel was a painting . That was as it should be ! [He]122-tarr was half sitting on the table . [He]122-tarr found [himself]122-tarr patting [her]580-her back . [He]122-tarr stopped doing this . [His]122-tarr face looked heavy and fatigued . A dull , intense infection of [her]580-her despair had filled it . [He]122-tarr held [her]580-her head gently against [his]122-tarr neck . Or [he]122-tarr held [her]580-her skull against [his]122-tarr neck . [She]580-her shook and sniffed softly . “[177-bertha] [Bertha]177-bertha , stop crying . And when [women]2149-women flooded [[their]2149-women country]2432-their country [he]122-tarr always sat down and waited . Often as this had happened to [him]122-tarr , [he]122-tarr had never attempted to circumvent it . [He]122-tarr felt like [a person who is taking a little dog for a walk at the end of a string]2433-a person who is taking a little dog for a walk at the end of a string . [His]122-tarr voice appeared husky and artificial near [her]580-her ear . Turned towards the window , [he]122-tarr looked at the green stain of the foliage outside . Something was explained . Nature was not friendly to [him]122-tarr ; its metallic tints jarred . Or anyhow , it was the same for [all men]2434-all men . The sunlight seen like [an adventurous stranger]2435-an adventurous stranger in [the streets]2436-the streets was intimate with [Bertha]177-bertha . The scrap of [crude forest]2437-crude forest had made [him]122-tarr want to be away unaccompanied . But it was tainted with [her]177-bertha . If [he]122-tarr went away now [he]122-tarr would only be playing at liberty . [He]122-tarr had been right in not accepting the invitations of the spring . The settlement of this question stood between [him]122-tarr and pleasure . A momentary well - being had been accepted . The larger spiritual invitation [he]122-tarr had rejected . [He]122-tarr would only take that when [he]122-tarr was free . In its annual expansion Nature sent [its]2438-its large unstinting invitations . But [Nature]177-bertha loved the genius and liberty in [him]122-tarr . [Tarr]122-tarr felt the invitation would not have been so cordial had [he]122-tarr proposed taking [a wife]2095-a wife and [family]2440-family ! [He]122-tarr led [her]177-bertha passively protesting to the sofa . Like [a sick person]2441-a sick person , [she]177-bertha was half indignant at being moved . [He]122-tarr should have remained , a perpendicular bed for [her]177-bertha , till the fever had passed . Revolted at the hypocrisy required , [he]122-tarr left [her]177-bertha standing at the edge of the sofa . [She]177-bertha stood crouching a little , [her]177-bertha face buried in [her]177-bertha hands , in indignant absurdity . The only moderately clean thing to do would be to walk out of the door at once and never come back . With [his]122-tarr background of months of different behaviour this could not be done . [She]177-bertha sank down on the sofa , head buried in the bilious cushions . [She]177-bertha lay there like an animal , [he]122-tarr thought , or [some one mad , a lump of half - humanity]2442-some one mad , a lump of half - humanity . On one side of [him]122-tarr [Bertha]177-bertha lay quite motionless and silent , and on the other [the little avenue]2443-the little avenue was equally still . The false stillness within , however , now gave back to the scene without its habitual character . It still seemed strange to [him]122-tarr . But all its strangeness now lay in its everyday and natural appearance . The quiet inside , in [the room]2366-the room , was what did not seem strange to [him]122-tarr . [He]122-tarr had become imbued with that . [Bertha]177-bertha ’s numb silence and abandon was a stupid tableau vivant of [his]122-tarr own mood . In this impasse of arrested life [he]122-tarr stood sick and useless . [They]2445-they progressed from stage to stage of this weary farce . Confusion increased . It resembled a combat between [two wrestlers of mathematically equal strength]2446-two wrestlers of mathematically equal strength . [Neither could win]2447-neither could win . [One or other of [them]2446-two wrestlers of mathematically equal strength]2448-one or other of them was usually wallowing warily or lifelessly on [his]122-tarr stomach , [the other]2449-the other tugging at [him]122-tarr or examining and prodding [his]122-tarr carcass . There [she]177-bertha lay a deadweight . [He]122-tarr could take [his]122-tarr hat and go . But once gone in this manner [he]122-tarr could not stay . [He]122-tarr turned round , and sitting on the window - sill began again staring at [Bertha]177-bertha . [Women]2149-women ’s stormy weakness , psychic discharges , always affected [him]122-tarr as the sight of [a person]2451-a person being seasick . [They]2446-two wrestlers of mathematically equal strength could only live on the retching seas of [their]2446-two wrestlers of mathematically equal strength troubles on the condition of being quite empty . The lack of art or illusion in actual life enables [the sensitive man]2452-the sensitive man to exist . Likewise the phenomenal lack of nature in [the average man]2453-the average man ’s existence is lucky and necessary for [him]122-tarr . [Tarr]122-tarr in some way gathered strength from contemplation of [Bertha]177-bertha . [His]122-tarr contradictory and dislocated feelings were brought into a new synthesis . Launching [himself]122-tarr off the window - sill , [he]122-tarr stood still as though suspended in thought . [He]122-tarr then sat down provisionally at the writing - table , within a few feet of the sofa . [He]122-tarr took up a book of [Goethe]178-goethe ’s poems that [she]177-bertha had given [him]122-tarr . [He]122-tarr had left it [there]2057-there on a former visit . [He]122-tarr came to the ode named “[179-ganymed] [Ganymed]179-ganymed , ” [He]122-tarr put it in [his]122-tarr breast - pocket . [Men]518-men ’s lives have been known to have been saved through a lesser devoutness . [He]122-tarr was engaging battle again with the most chivalrous sentiments . [The reserves]2459-the reserves had been called up , [his]122-tarr nature mobilized . As [his]122-tarr will gathered force and volume ( in its determination to “[179-ganymed] fling ” [her]2460-her ) [he]122-tarr unhypocritically keyed up its attitude . It resembled extreme cunning . [He]122-tarr had felt , while [he]122-tarr had been holding [her]2460-her , at a disadvantage because of [his]122-tarr listless emotion . With emotion equal to [hers]2460-her , [he]122-tarr could accomplish anything . Leaving [her]2460-her would be [child]2461-child ’s play . [He]122-tarr appeared to be projecting the manufacture of a more adequate sentiment . Any indirectness was out of the question . A “[584-her] letting [her]584-her down softly , ” kissing and leaving in an hour or two , as though things had not changed , that must now be eschewed — oh , yes . The genuine section of [her]2460-her , of which [he]122-tarr had a troubled glimpse , mattered , nothing else . [He]122-tarr must appeal obstinately to that . [Their]2462-their coming together had been prosecuted on [his]122-tarr side with a stupid levity . [He]122-tarr would retrieve this in the parting . [He]122-tarr wished to do everything most opposite to [his]122-tarr previous lazy conduct . [He]122-tarr frowned on [Humour]180-humour . The first skirmish of [his]122-tarr comic Armageddon had opened with the advance of [his]122-tarr mysterious and goguenard “[584-her] indifference . ” This dwindled away at the first onset . A new and more powerful thing had taken its place . This was , in [Bertha]177-bertha ’s eyes , a difference in [Tarr]122-tarr . “[584-her] Something has happened ; [he]585-he is different , ” [she]177-bertha said to [herself]177-bertha . “[585-he] [He]585-he has met [somebody else]586-somebody else , ” had been [her]177-bertha rapid provisional conclusion . [She]177-bertha suddenly got up without speaking . Rather spectrally , [she]177-bertha went over to the writing - table for [her]177-bertha handkerchief . [She]177-bertha had not moved an inch or a muscle until quite [herself]177-bertha again , dropping steadily down all the scale of feeling to normal . With matter - of - factness [she]177-bertha got up , easily and quietly , making [Sorbert]270-sorbert a little dizzy . [Her]177-bertha face had all the drama wrung out of it . It was hard , clear , and garishly white , like [her]177-bertha body . If [he]122-tarr were to have a chance of talking [he]122-tarr must clear the air of electricity completely . Else at [his]122-tarr first few words storm might return . Once lunch had swept through [the room]2366-the room , things would be better . [He]122-tarr would send the strawberries ahead to prepare [his]122-tarr way . It was like fattening a lamb for the slaughter . This idea pleased [him]122-tarr . Now that [he]122-tarr had accepted the existence of a possible higher plane of feeling as between [Bertha]177-bertha and [himself]122-tarr , [he]122-tarr was anxious to avoid display . So [he]122-tarr ran the risk of outdoing [his]122-tarr former callousness . [Tarr]122-tarr was saturated with morbid English shyness , that can not tolerate passion and its nakedness . This shyness , as [he]122-tarr contended , in its need to show its heart , discovers subtleties and refinements of expression , opposites and between shades , unknown to [less gauche and delicate people]2464-less gauche and delicate people . But if [he]122-tarr were hustled out of [his]122-tarr shell the anger that co - existed with [his]122-tarr modesty was the most spontaneous thing [he]122-tarr possessed . [Bertha]177-bertha had always left [him]122-tarr alone . [He]122-tarr got up , obsequiously reproducing in [his]122-tarr own movements and expression [her]177-bertha new normality . “[585-he] Well , how about lunch ? For [her]177-bertha to be so perfectly natural offended [him]122-tarr . The intensity of [her]177-bertha past feeling carried [her]177-bertha on for about five minutes into ordinary life . [Her]177-bertha seriousness was tactful for so long . Then [her]177-bertha nature began to give way . It broke up again into fits and starts of self - consciousness . The mind was called in , did its work clumsily as usual . [She]177-bertha became [her]177-bertha usual self . [She]177-bertha resented the immediate introduction of lunch in this way . The resentment increased [her]177-bertha artificiality . [She]2139-a woman would immediately call a halt , pitch tents preliminary to turning back . A pause was necessary before beginning the return journey . Next day [they]609-their would be jogging on again in [the same disputed direction]2481-the same disputed direction . [Tarr]122-tarr now saw at once what had happened . [His]122-tarr good words had been lost , all except [his]122-tarr confession to a weakness for the matronly blandishments of Matrimony . [He]122-tarr had an access of stupid , brief , and blatant laughter . As [people]430-people have wondered what was at the core of [the world]2089-the world , basing [their]430-people speculations on what deepest things occasionally emerge , with violence , at its holes , so [Bertha]177-bertha often conjectured what might be at the heart of [Tarr]122-tarr . Laughter was the most apparently central substance that , to [her]2139-a woman knowledge , had incontrollably appeared . [She]2139-a woman had often heard grondements , grumblings , quite literally , and seen unpleasant lights , belonging , [she]2139-a woman knew , to other categories of matter . But [they]609-their never broke cover . At present this gaiety was interpreted as proof that [she]2139-a woman had been right . There was nothing in what [he]161-sorbet had said . It had been only one of [his]161-sorbet bad fits of rebellion . But laughter [Tarr]122-tarr felt was retrogression . Laughter must be given up . [He]122-tarr must in some way , for both [their]609-their sakes , lay at once the foundations of an ending . Perhaps it was not only impossible to overcome , but even to approach , or to be said to be on the same field with , [this peculiar amazon]2484-this peculiar amazon , without such uniformity of engines of attack or defence . Should not [he]122-tarr get [himself]122-tarr a mask like [hers]2139-a woman at once , and follow suit with some emphatic sentence ? [He]122-tarr stared uncertainly at [her]2139-a woman . Then [he]122-tarr sprang to [his]122-tarr feet . But [his]122-tarr violence jerked out of [him]122-tarr a shout of laughter . [He]122-tarr went stamping about the floor roaring with reluctant mirth . It would not come out properly , too , except the first outburst . “[161-sorbet] Ay . That ’s right ! Go on ! Go on ! ” [Bertha]177-bertha ’s patient irony seemed to gibe . This laughter left [him]122-tarr vexed with [himself]122-tarr , like a fit of tears . “[161-sorbet] Humour and pathos are such near twins , that Humour may be exactly described as the most feminine attribute of [man]610-man , and the only one of which [women]2149-women show hardly any trace ! [He]150-butcher thought of [his]150-butcher resources , and remembered [his]150-butcher inclination to tears . * * * * [Tarr]122-tarr ’s disgust at this electric rush of sound made [him]122-tarr turn it on [her]177-bertha . [He]122-tarr was now put at a fresh disadvantage . Under the shadow of this laugh all [his]122-tarr ensuing acts or words must toil , discredited in advance . Desperately ignoring accidents , [he]122-tarr went back beyond [his]122-tarr first explosion , and attacked its cause — indicting [Bertha]177-bertha , more or less , as responsible for the disturbance . [He]122-tarr sat down squarely in front of [her]177-bertha , hardly breathed from [his]122-tarr paroxysm , getting launched without transition . It should be left towering , spectral , but becalmed , behind . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know from which side to approach [you]614-you , [Bertha]177-bertha . The strawberries were devoured mechanically , with unhungry itch to clear the plate . [He]0-i had become just a devouring - machine , restless if any of the little red balls still remained in front of it . [Bertha]177-bertha ’s eyes sought to carry [her]177-bertha out of this Present . But [they]2488-they had broken down , depositing [her]177-bertha , so to speak , somewhere half - way down [the avenue]2489-the avenue . [Tarr]122-tarr got up , [a released automaton]2490-a released automaton , and walked to the cloth - covered box where [he]122-tarr had left [his]122-tarr hat and stick . Then [he]122-tarr returned in some way dutifully and obediently to the same seat , sat there for a minute , hat on knee . [He]122-tarr had gone over and taken it up without thinking . [He]122-tarr only realized , once back , what it meant . Nothing was settled , [he]122-tarr had so far done more harm than good . The presence of the hat and stick on [his]122-tarr knees , however , was like the holding open of the front door already . Anything said with [them]2488-they there could only be like words said as an afterthought , on the threshold . It was as though , hat on head , [he]122-tarr were standing with [his]122-tarr hand on the door - knob , about to add some trifle to a thing already fixed . [He]122-tarr got up , walked back to where [he]122-tarr had picked up the hat and stick , placed them as they were before , then returned to the window . What should be done now ? [He]122-tarr seemed to have played all [his]122-tarr fifty - two cards . Everything to “[586-somebody else] be done ” looked behind [him]122-tarr , not awaiting [him]122-tarr at all . That passive pose of [Bertha]177-bertha ’s was not encouraging . [It]2491-it had lately withstood stoically a good deal , was quite ready to absorb still more . There was something almost pugnacious in so much resignation . But when [she]177-bertha looked up at [him]122-tarr there was no sign of combat . [She]177-bertha appeared stilled to something simple again , by some fluke of a word . For the second time that day [she]177-bertha had jumped out of [her]177-bertha skin . There was something more unusual than [her]177-bertha fiancé The circular storm , in [her]177-bertha case , was returning . “[161-sorbet] Well , [Sorbet]161-sorbet ? ” “[161-sorbet] Well . [Her]177-bertha mouth felt some distance from [her]177-bertha brain . [Her]177-bertha voice stood on tiptoe like [a dwarf to speak]2492-a dwarf to speak . [She]177-bertha became very much impressed by [her]177-bertha voice , and was rather afraid to say anything more . Had [she]177-bertha fainted ? [Sorbert]270-sorbert was [a stranger]509-a stranger . [She]177-bertha noticed something criminal and quick in [his]270-sorbert eyes . [She]177-bertha became nervous , as though [she]177-bertha had admitted [somebody]2494-somebody too trustingly to [[her]177-bertha rooms]2360-her rooms . This fancy played on [her]177-bertha hysteria , and [she]177-bertha really wanted [him]270-sorbert to go . “[161-sorbet] Why do n’t [you]627-you go ? ” [she]177-bertha repeated , in a pleasant voice . [Tarr]122-tarr remained silent , seemingly determined not to answer . [Meantime]181-meantime [he]122-tarr looked at [her]177-bertha with a doubtful dislike . What is love ? [he]122-tarr began reasoning . It is either possession or a possessive madness . In the case of [men]518-men and [women]2149-women , it is the obsession of a personality . [He]122-tarr had presumably been endowed with the power of awaking love in [her]177-bertha . [He]122-tarr had something to accuse [himself]122-tarr of . [He]122-tarr had been afraid of giving up or repudiating this particular madness . To give up [another person]2498-another person ’s love is a mild suicide ; like a very bad inoculation as compared to the full disease . [His]122-tarr tenderness for [Bertha]177-bertha was due to [her]177-bertha having purloined some part of [himself]122-tarr , and covered [herself]177-bertha superficially with it as a shield . [Her]177-bertha skin at least was [Tarr]122-tarr . [She]177-bertha had captured a bit of [him]122-tarr , and held [it]122-tarr as a hostage . [She]177-bertha was rapidly transforming [herself]177-bertha , too , into [a slavish dependency]2499-a slavish dependency . [She]177-bertha worked with all the hypocrisy of a great instinct . [People]430-people can wound by loving ; the sympathy of this affection is interpenetrative . Love performs its natural miracle , and [they]430-people become part of [us]2501-us ; it is a dismemberment to cast [them]430-people off . [Our]2501-us own blood flows out after [them]430-people when [they]430-people go . Or love was a malady ; it was dangerous to live with [those consumed by it]2502-those consumed by it . [He]122-tarr felt an uneasiness . Might not a wasting and restlessness ensue ? It would not , if [he]122-tarr caught it , be recognizable as love . Perhaps [he]122-tarr had already got it slightly . That might account for [his]122-tarr hanging about [her]177-bertha . [He]122-tarr evidently was suffering from something that came from [Bertha]177-bertha . [Everybody]182-everybody , however , all personality , was catching . [We]2501-us all are sicknesses for each other . Such contact as [he]122-tarr had with [Bertha]177-bertha was particularly risky . [Their]2503-their photographs [he]122-tarr had just been looking at displayed an unpleasant solidarity . Was it necessary to allege “[627-you] love ” at all ? The word was superfluous in [his]122-tarr case . The fact was before [him]122-tarr . [He]122-tarr felt suddenly despondent and afraid of the Future . [He]122-tarr had fallen beneath a more immediate infection . [He]122-tarr looked attentively round [the room]2366-the room . [His]122-tarr memory already ached . [She]177-bertha had loved [him]122-tarr with all this . [She]177-bertha had loved [him]122-tarr with the plaster cast of [Beethoven]166-beethoven , attacked [him]122-tarr with [the Klingers]183-the klingers , ambushed [him]122-tarr from the Breton jars , in a funny , superficial , absorbing way . [Her]177-bertha madness had muddled everything with [his]122-tarr ideal existence . It was n’t like leaving [an ordinary room [you]2506-you had spent pleasant hours in and would regret]2505-an ordinary room you had spent pleasant hours in and would regret . [You]2506-you would owe nothing to that , and it could not pursue [you]2506-you with images of wrong . [This room]2507-this room [he]122-tarr was wronging , and left [it]2507-this room in a different way . [She]177-bertha seemed , too , so humble in it , or through it . The appeal of the little again . If [he]122-tarr could only escape from scale . The price of preoccupation with the large was this perpetual danger from [the little]2508-the little . [He]122-tarr wished [he]122-tarr could look coldly on mere littleness , and not want to caress and protect it when it was human . Brutality was no doubt necessary for [people like [him]122-tarr]2509-people like him . Love was too new to [him]122-tarr . [He]122-tarr was not inoculated enough with love . [He]122-tarr had callously been signing [his]122-tarr name to a series of brutalities , then , as though [he]122-tarr were sure that when the time came [he]122-tarr would have a quite sufficient stock of coldness to meet these debts . Yet [he]122-tarr had known from the first that [he]122-tarr had not . Eventually [he]122-tarr would have to evade [them]2510-them or succumb . The flourishes of the hand and mind had caused [Bertha]177-bertha ’s mute and mournful attitude . [She]177-bertha thought [she]177-bertha knew [him]122-tarr , but was amazed at [his]122-tarr ignorance or pretence . So [he]122-tarr had now brought this new element into relief . For the last hour [he]122-tarr had been accumulating difficulties , or rather unearthing some new one at every step . Impossible to tackle en masse , [they]2510-them were all there before [him]122-tarr . The thought of “[628-he] settling everything before [he]628-he went , ” now appeared monstrous . [He]122-tarr had , anyhow , started these local monsters and demons , fishing [them]2510-them to the light . Each had a different vocal explosiveness or murmur , inveighing unintelligibly against each other . The only thing to be done was to herd [them]2510-them all together and march [them]2510-them away for inspection at leisure . [Sudden herdsman]2511-sudden herdsman , with the care of [a delicate and antediluvian flock]2512-a delicate and antediluvian flock ; well ! — But what was [Bertha]177-bertha to be told ? Nothing . [He]122-tarr would file out silently with [[his]122-tarr flock]2513-his flock , without any hornblasts or windings such as [he]122-tarr customarily affected . “[628-he] [I]0-i am going now , ” [he]0-i said at last , getting up . [He]0-i did not wish to escape this feeling . It would be better to enhance it . For a moment it occurred to [him]0-i to go back and offer marriage . It was about all [he]0-i had to offer . [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s room]2528-kreisler ’s room looked like [some funeral vault]2529-some funeral vault . A bed like an overturned cupboard , dark , and with a red billow of cloth and feathers covering it entirely ; a tesselated floor of dark red tile ; a little rug , made with paint , carpet , cardboard , and horsehair , to represent a leopard — these , with chair , washstand , easel , and several weeks ’ of slowly drifting and shifting garbage , completed its contents . [Kreisler]190-kreisler flicked the lather on to a crumpled newspaper , with an irresponsible gesture . Each time [his]190-kreisler razor was raised [he]190-kreisler looked at [himself]190-kreisler with a peering vacancy . [His]190-kreisler face had long become a piece of troublesome meat . [Life]184-life did not each day deposit an untidiness that could be whisked off by a Gillette blade , as Nature did its stubble . [His]190-kreisler face , it is true , wore like a uniform the frowning fixity of [the Prussian warrior]2539-the prussian warrior . Just then a church clock began striking . [He]190-kreisler foreboded it was already ten , but not later . It struck ten and then eleven . [He]190-kreisler leapt the hour — the clock seemed rushing with [him]190-kreisler , in a second , to the more advanced hour — without any flurry , quite calmly . Then it struck twelve . [He]190-kreisler at once absorbed that further hour as [he]190-kreisler had the former . [He]190-kreisler lived an hour as easily and carelessly as [he]190-kreisler would have lived a second . Could it have gone on striking [he]190-kreisler would have swallowed , without turning a hair , twenty , thirty strokes !
