[She]1022-the widow liked [Kreisler]190-kreisler , however . “[0-i] Shall [we]1025-they dance ? ” [he]190-kreisler said , getting up quickly . [He]190-kreisler clasped [her]1022-the widow firmly in the small of the back and [they]1025-they got ponderously in motion , [he]190-kreisler stamping a little bit , as though [he]190-kreisler mistook the waltz for a more primitive music . [He]190-kreisler took [her]1022-the widow twice , with ever - increasing velocity , round [the large hall]3099-the large hall , and at the third round , at breakneck speed , spun with [her]1022-the widow in the direction of the front door . The impetus was so great that [she]1022-the widow , although seeing [her]1022-the widow peril , could not act sufficiently as a break on [[her]1022-the widow impetuous companion]3100-her impetuous companion to avert the disaster . Another moment and [they]1025-they would have been in [the street]2061-the street , amongst the traffic , a disturbing meteor , whizzing out of sight , had [they]1025-they not met the alarmed resistance of [a considerable English family entering the front door]3102-a considerable english family entering the front door as [Kreisler]190-kreisler bore down upon [it]3102-a considerable english family entering the front door . It was one of those large , featureless , human groups built up by [a frigid and melancholy pair]3103-a frigid and melancholy pair , uncannily fecund , during interminable years of blankness . [They]1025-they received [this violent couple]3104-this violent couple in [their]1025-they midst . The rush took [Kreisler]190-kreisler and [[his]190-kreisler partner]3105-his partner half - way through , and there [they]1025-they stood embedded and unconscious for many seconds . [The English family]3106-the english family then , with great dignity , disgorged [them]1025-they and moved on . [The widow]1022-the widow had come somewhat under the fascination of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s mood . [She]1022-the widow was really [[his]190-kreisler woman]3108-his woman , had [he]190-kreisler known it . [She]1022-the widow felt wrapt in the midst of a simoon — [she]1022-the widow had not two connected thoughts . All [her]1022-the widow worldliness and measured management of [her]1022-the widow fat had vanished . [Her]1022-the widow face had become coarsened in a few minutes . But [she]1022-the widow buzzed back again into the dance and began a second , mad , but this time merely circular career . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was very careful , whatever [he]190-kreisler did , to find a reason for it . “[1026-he] [He]1026-he was abominably short - sighted ; [he]1026-he had mistaken the front door for one leading into [the third room]1027-the third room , merely . ” [His]1026-he burden , not in the best condition , was becoming more and more puffed , and heavier every moment . When satisfied with this part of [his]1026-he work [he]1026-he led [Mrs. Bevelage]244-mrs. bevelage into [a sort of improvised conservatory]3109-a sort of improvised conservatory and talked about pawnshops for ten minutes or so — in a mixture of French , English , and German . [He]1026-he then reconducted [her]1022-the widow , more dead than alive , to [her]1022-the widow seat , and strode off from [her]1022-the widow with great sweeps of [his]1026-he tall figure . [He]1026-he had during this incident regained complete impassivity . [He]1026-he stalked away to [the conservatory]3110-the conservatory . [Bertha]177-bertha had soon been called on to dance vigorously . without much intermission . In the convolutions of [the valse]3111-the valse , however , [she]177-bertha matured a bold and new plan . [She]177-bertha whirled and trotted with a preoccupied air . Would [Tarr]122-tarr hear of all this ? [She]177-bertha was alarmed , now it was done . Also [she]177-bertha was cowed and sorry for [her]177-bertha action at the thought of [Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann and [Van Bencke]241-fraulein van bencke ’s attitude towards the Kreisler kissing . [She]177-bertha undoubtedly must secure [herself]177-bertha . The plan [she]177-bertha hit on offered a “[1026-he] noble ” rôle that [she]177-bertha could not , in any circumstances , have resisted . [Her]177-bertha scheme was plain and clever . [She]177-bertha would simply “[1026-he] tell the truth . ” “[1028-her] [She]1028-her had recognized something distracting in [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s life , the presence of crisis . On an impulse , [she]1028-her had offered [him]190-kreisler [her]1028-her sympathy . [He]190-kreisler had taken up [her]1028-her offer immediately in an astonishing and brutal manner . ( One against [him]190-kreisler : two for [her]1028-her ! ) Such direct and lurid sympathy [he]190-kreisler claimed . ” So [she]177-bertha jogged out [her]177-bertha strategies in exhilaration of the waltzes . At this point of [her]177-bertha story [she]177-bertha would hint , by ambiguous hesitation , that [she]177-bertha , in truth , had been ready even for this sacrifice : had made it , if [[her]177-bertha hearers]3112-her hearers wished ! [She]177-bertha would imply rather that from modesty — not wanting to appear too “[190-kreisler] noble ” — [she]177-bertha refrained from telling [them]3112-her hearers . It is true that for such a confession [she]177-bertha had many precedents . [She]177-bertha came across [him]190-kreisler occasionally , and keyed [her]177-bertha solid face into an intimate flush and such mask as results from any sickly physical straining . “[1031-poor mensch] [Poor mensch]1031-poor mensch ! ” [Soltyk]206-soltyk surprised [one Anglo - Saxon partner]3118-one anglo - saxon partner after another with [his]206-soltyk wonderful English — unnecessarily like the real thing . [He]206-soltyk went about surprising [people]430-people in a cold , tireless way , exhibiting no signs of pleasure , except as much as was testified to by [his]206-soltyk action , merely . [Kreisler]190-kreisler saw [him]206-soltyk with [Anastasya]216-anastasya only twice . Yet [he]206-soltyk was thirsting for conventional figures . [His]206-soltyk endless dissatisfaction and depression could only be satisfied by active things , unlike itself . [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s self - possessed and masterly signs of distinguished camaraderie depressed [Kreisler]190-kreisler very much . [The Russian]207-the russian had been there once at the critical moment , and was , more distantly , an attribute of [Volker]191-volker . [He]190-kreisler did not like [him]207-the russian . How it would satisfy [him]190-kreisler to dig [his]190-kreisler fingers into that flesh , and tear it like thick cloth ! [He]190-kreisler was “[1031-poor mensch] for it ” ; [he]190-kreisler was going out . [He]190-kreisler was being helped off by things . Why did [he]190-kreisler not shout ? [He]190-kreisler longed to act : [the rusty machine]3121-the rusty machine had a thirst for action . [His]190-kreisler energies were repudiating [[their]3121-the rusty machine master]3122-their master . [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s analogies with [Kreisler]190-kreisler worked in the dark to some end of mutual destruction . The nuance of possibility [Soltyk]206-soltyk liked [his]206-soltyk friendships with [women]2149-women to have , was a different affair to [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s heady and thorough - going intrigues . But [he]206-soltyk liked [his]206-soltyk soul to be marked with little delicate wounds and wistfulnesses . [He]206-soltyk liked an understanding , a little melancholy , with [a woman]2139-a woman . [They]3125-they would just divine in each other possibilities of passion , that was yet too lasse and sad to rise to the winding of Love ’s horns that were heard , nevertheless , in a décor Versaillesque and [Polonais]68-polonais . [They]3125-they were [people who looked forward]3126-people who looked forward as [others look back]3127-others look back . [They]3125-they would say farewell to the future as [most men]3128-most men gaze at the past . At the most [they]3125-they played the slight dawning and disappearing of passion , cutting , fastidiously , all the rest of the piece . So [he]206-soltyk was often found with [women]2149-women . Life had no lethargic intervals as with [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [It]3130-it at all times needed “[1031-poor mensch] expression ” of such sort . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was in the wrong company . But [he]190-kreisler conformed for the sake of the Invisible Audience haunting life . [He]190-kreisler might have been enjoying [himself]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler got up from [his]190-kreisler chair , and walked deliberately and quickly into [the central room]3153-the central room . But [Soltyk]206-soltyk was nowhere to be seen . [Their]3154-the dancers intelligences floated and flew above the waves of the valse , but with frequent drenchings , as it were , and cessations . A hole was cut out of the general noise , as it were opening a passage into it . Each new face was a hallucination of separate energy , seeming very distant , laughs , words , movements . [They]3154-the dancers were like trunk - less , living heads rolling and bobbing past , a sea of [them]3154-the dancers . [The two or three instruments behind the screen of palms]3162-the two or three instruments behind the screen of palms produced the necessary measures to keep [this throng of people]3163-this throng of people careering , like a spoon stirring in a saucepan . It stirred and stirred and [they]3154-the dancers jerked and huddled insipidly round and round . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was drawn up at the first door for a minute . [He]190-kreisler was just taking a step forward to work [his]190-kreisler way round to the next , when [he]190-kreisler caught sight of [Anastasya]216-anastasya dancing with ( [he]190-kreisler supposed ) [some Englishman]3164-some englishman . [He]190-kreisler stood like somebody surprised in a questionable act . [He]190-kreisler had not reckoned on being met by [her]3165-her before [his]190-kreisler present errand was finished . The next moment [he]190-kreisler was furious at this interference ; at [her]3165-her having the power to draw [him]190-kreisler up . This imaginary life should grow . Hell and Heaven ! [His]190-kreisler blood was flooding [him]190-kreisler , and making [him]190-kreisler expand and sink like [a Russian dancer]3170-a russian dancer . [The young man handled in this manner]3171-the young man handled in this manner , shy and unprompt , stared after [Kreisler]190-kreisler with a “[1035-you] What the devil ! ” [People]430-people are seldom so rude in [England]25-england . [Kreisler]190-kreisler also , without apology , but as if waiting for more vigorous expostulation , was also looking back , while [he]190-kreisler stepped slowly along the wall towards a door beyond , the one leading to [the refreshment - room]3174-the refreshment - room . [Anastasya]216-anastasya freed [herself]216-anastasya at once from [[her]3175-she partner]3166-her partner and pale and frowning ( but as though waiting ) was looking after [Kreisler]190-kreisler curiously . [She]3175-she would have liked [him]190-kreisler to stop . [He]190-kreisler had done something strange and was as suddenly going away . That was unsatisfactory . [They]3177-they looked at [each other]370-each other blankly . [He]190-kreisler showed no sign of stopping : [she]3175-she just stared . Suddenly it was comic . [She]3175-she burst out laughing . But [they]3177-they had clashed , like [people in the dance]3179-people in the dance , and were both disappearing from [each other]370-each other again , the shock hardly over . The contact had been brought about . [He]190-kreisler was still as surprised at [his]190-kreisler action , which had been done “[1035-you] in a moment , ” as [she]3175-she was . [Anastasya]216-anastasya felt , too , in what way this had been contact . [This rough figure]3181-this rough figure disappeared in the doorway , as incapable of explaining anything . [She]3175-she shivered nervously as [she]3175-she grasped [[her]3175-she partner]3166-her partner ’s arm again , at this merely physical contact . “[1035-you] What ’s the matter with [that chap]1034-that chap ? ” [[her]3175-she partner]3166-her partner asked , conscious of a lameness , but of something queer going on . This question had been asked a few minutes before elsewhere . “[1034-that chap] [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler is behaving very strangely . Do [you]1035-you think [he]190-kreisler ’s been drinking ? ” [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann had asked [Eckhart]246-eckhart . [Eckhart]246-eckhart was a little drunk [himself]246-eckhart . [He]246-eckhart took a very decided view of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s case . “[1035-you] Comme toute la [Pologne]69-pologne ! As drunk as the whole of [Poland]70-poland ! ” [he]246-eckhart affirmed . But [he]246-eckhart only gave it as an opinion , adding no sign of particular indignation . [He]246-eckhart was beaming with greedy generosity at [his]246-eckhart great Amoureuse . “[190-kreisler] Ah ! here [he]190-kreisler comes again ! ” said [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann at the door . ( It was when [Kreisler]190-kreisler had started up in search of [Soltyk]206-soltyk ) . So [Kreisler]190-kreisler disappeared in the doorway . [He]190-kreisler passed through [the refreshment - room]3174-the refreshment - room . In [a small room]3185-a small room beyond [he]190-kreisler sat down by an open window . [Anastasya]216-anastasya had at last got into fine with [him]190-kreisler . [She]3186-she had been startled , awakened , and had also laughed . This was an exact and complete response to [Kreisler]190-kreisler at the present . Something difficult to understand and which should have been alarming for [a woman]2139-a woman , the feel of the first tugs of the maelstrom [he]190-kreisler was producing and conducting all on [his]190-kreisler own , and which required [her]2139-a woman for its heart : and then laughter , necessarily , once one was in that atmosphere , like laughing gas , with its gusty tickling . But this was not how [Kreisler]190-kreisler felt about it . [He]190-kreisler was boiling and raging . That laugh had driven [him]190-kreisler foaming , fugitive and confused , into the nearest chair . [He]190-kreisler could not turn round and retaliate at the time . The door being in front of [him]190-kreisler , [he]190-kreisler vanished as [Mephistopheles]247-mephistopheles might sink with suddenness into the floor , at the receipt of some affront , to [some sulphurous regions beneath]3188-some sulphurous regions beneath , in a second ; come to a stop alone , upright ; stick [his]190-kreisler fingers in [his]190-kreisler mouth , nearly biting them in two , [his]190-kreisler eyes staring : so stand stock still , breathless and haggard for some minutes : then shoot up again , head foremost , in some other direction , like some darting and skulking fish , to the face of [the earth]2188-the earth . [He]190-kreisler did not even realize that the famous contact was established , so furious was [he]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler would go and strike [her]2139-a woman across the mouth , spit in [her]2139-a woman face , kiss [her]2139-a woman in the middle of the dance , where the laugh had been ! Yet [he]190-kreisler did n’t move , but sat on staring in front of [him]190-kreisler , quite forgetful where [he]190-kreisler was and how long [he]190-kreisler had sat there , in the midst of a hot riot of thoughts . [He]190-kreisler suddenly sat up and looked round , like [a man who has been asleep and for whom work is waiting]3190-a man who has been asleep and for whom work is waiting ; got up with certain hesitation , and again made for the door . Well , life and work ( Ms business ) must be proceeded with all the same . [He]190-kreisler glanced reflectively and solemnly about , and perceived [the Widow]1022-the widow talking to [a little reddish Englishman]3192-a little reddish englishman . “[190-kreisler] May [I]0-i take [the Widow]1022-the widow away for a little ? ” [he]190-kreisler asked [[her]1022-the widow companion]925-her companion . [He]190-kreisler always addressed [her]2139-a woman as “[245-widow] [Widow]245-widow ” : [he]190-kreisler began all [his]190-kreisler discourses with a solemn “[245-widow] Widow ! ” occasionally alternating it with “[245-widow] Derelict ! ” But this , all uttered in a jumbled tongue , lost some of its significance . [The little Englishman]3194-the little englishman on being addressed gave the English equivalent of a jump — a sudden moving of [his]3194-the little englishman body and shuffling of [his]3194-the little englishman feet , still looking at the floor , where [he]3194-the little englishman had cast [his]3194-the little englishman eyes as [Kreisler]190-kreisler approached . “[245-widow] What ? [I----]1037-i---- ” “[245-widow] [Widow]245-widow ! permit me---- ” said [Kreisler]190-kreisler . Manipulating [her]2139-a woman with a leisurely gusto , [he]190-kreisler circled into the dance . [The band]3195-the band was playing [the “[245-widow] Merry Widow ” valse]3196-the “ merry widow ” valse . “[245-widow] [Merry Widow]245-widow ! ” [he]190-kreisler said smilingly to [[his]190-kreisler partner]3105-his partner . “[245-widow] Yes , [Merry Widow]245-widow ! ” shaking [his]190-kreisler head at [her]2139-a woman . The music seemed fumbling in a confused mass of memory , but finding nothing definite . All it managed to bring to fight was a small cheap photograph , taken at [a Bauern Bal]3198-a bauern bal , with [a flat German student]3199-a flat german student ’s cap . [The man]2084-the man remained just [his]2084-the man photograph . [[Their]3195-the band hostess]3201-their hostess also was dancing . [Kreisler]190-kreisler noted [her]2139-a woman with a wink of recognition . Dancing very slowly , almost mournfully , [he]190-kreisler and [[his]190-kreisler partner]3105-his partner bumped into [her]2139-a woman each time as [they]3195-the band passed . [The Widow]245-widow felt the impact , but it was only at the third round that [she]245-widow perceived the method and intention inducing these bumps . [She]245-widow realized [they]3195-the band were going to collide with [the other lady]3203-the other lady . The collision could not be avoided . But [she]245-widow shrank away , made [herself]245-widow as small and soft as possible , bumped gently and apologized over [her]245-widow shoulder , with a smile and screwing up of the eyes , full of meaning . At the fourth turn of [the room]2366-the room , however , [Kreisler]190-kreisler having increased [her]245-widow speed sensibly , [she]245-widow was on [her]245-widow guard , and in fact already suggesting that [she]245-widow should be taken back to [her]245-widow seat . [He]190-kreisler pretended to be giving [[their]3195-the band hostess]3201-their hostess a wide berth this time , but suddenly and gently swerved , and bore down upon [her]2139-a woman . [The Widow]1022-the widow veered frantically , took a false step , tripped on [her]1022-the widow dress , tearing it , and fell to the ground . [They]3195-the band caused a circular undulating commotion throughout [the neighbouring dancers]3207-the neighbouring dancers like a stone falling in [a pond]3208-a pond . [Several people]972-several people bent , down to help [Mrs. Bevelage]244-mrs. bevelage — [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s assistance was angrily rejected . [[His]190-kreisler partner]3105-his partner scrambled to [her]3105-his partner feet and went to the nearest chair , followed by [one or two people]3211-one or two people . “[245-widow] Who is [he]1038-he ? ” “[1038-he] [He]1038-he ’s drunk . ” “[1038-he] What happened ? ” “[1038-he] [He]1038-he ought to be turned out ! ” [people]430-people said who had seen the accident . [Kreisler]190-kreisler regained [the conservatory]3110-the conservatory with great dignity . But now [Fraulein Lippmann]248-fraulein lippmann , alone , appeared before [him]190-kreisler as [he]190-kreisler lay stretched in [his]190-kreisler chair , and said in a tight , breaking voice : “[0-i] [I]0-i think , [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler , [you]190-kreisler would do well now , as [you]190-kreisler have done nothing all the evening but render [yourself]190-kreisler objectionable , to relieve [us]1039-us of [your]190-kreisler company . [I]0-i do n’t know whether [you]190-kreisler ’re drunk . [I]0-i hope [you]190-kreisler are , for---- ” “[190-kreisler] [You]190-kreisler hope [I]0-i ’m drunk , [Fraulein]248-fraulein lippmann ? ” [he]0-i asked in an astonished voice . [He]0-i remained lolling at full length . “[248-fraulein lippmann] [A lady [I]0-i was dancing with]1040-a lady i was dancing with fell over , owing entirely to [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with own clumsiness and intractability — but perhaps [she]1040-a lady i was dancing with was drunk ; [I]0-i did n’t think of that . ” “[0-i] So [you]0-i ’re not going ? ” “[0-i] Certainly , [Fraulein]248-fraulein lippmann — when [you]248-fraulein lippmann go ! [We]1039-us ’ll go together . ” “[1039-us] Schensal ! ” Hurling hotly this epithet at [him]0-i — [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with breath had risen many degrees in temperature at its passage , and [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with breast heaved in dashing it out ( as though , in fact , the word “[1039-us] schensal ” had been the living thing , and [she]1040-a lady i was dancing with were emptying [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with breast of it violently ) , [she]1040-a lady i was dancing with left [the room]2366-the room . [His]0-i last exploit had been accomplished in a half disillusioned state . [He]0-i merely went on farcing because [he]0-i could think of nothing else to do . [Anastasya]216-anastasya ’s laughter had upset and ended everything of [his]0-i “[248-fraulein lippmann] imaginary life . ” [He]0-i told [himself]0-i now that [he]0-i hated [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with . “[248-fraulein lippmann] Ich hasse dich ! Ich hasse dich ! ” [he]0-i hissed over to [himself]0-i , enjoying the wind of the “[1039-us] hasse ” in [his]0-i moustaches . But ( there was no doubt about it ) the laugh had crushed [him]0-i . Ridiculous and hateful had been [his]0-i goal . But now that [he]0-i had succeeded [he]0-i thought chiefly in the latter affair , [he]0-i was overwhelmed . [His]0-i vanity was wounded terribly . In laughing at [him]0-i [she]1040-a lady i was dancing with had puffed out and transformed in an extraordinary way , also , [his]0-i infatuation . For the first time since [he]0-i had first set eyes on [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with [he]0-i realized [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with sex . [His]0-i sensuality had been directly stirred . [He]0-i wanted to kiss [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with now . [He]0-i must get [his]0-i mouth on [hers]1040-a lady i was dancing with — [he]0-i must revel in the laugh , where it grew ! [She]1040-a lady i was dancing with was néfaste . [She]1040-a lady i was dancing with was in fact evidently [the devil]2906-the devil . So [his]0-i idée fixe having suddenly taken body and acquired flesh , now allied to [his]0-i senses , the vibration became more definitely alarming . [He]0-i began thinking about [her]1040-a lady i was dancing with with a slow moistening of the lips . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall possess [her]1041-her ! ” [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i , seeing [himself]0-i in the role of [the old Berserker warrior]3216-the old berserker warrior , ravening and irresistible . The use of the word shall in that way was enough . But this infernal dance ! With the advent of the real feeling all the artificial ones flew or diminished at once . [He]0-i was no longer romantically “[0-i] desperate , ” but bored with [his]0-i useless position there . All [his]0-i attention was now concentrated on a practical issue , that of the “[0-i] possession ” of [Anastasya]216-anastasya . [He]0-i was tired as though [he]0-i had been dancing the whole evening . [He]0-i got up and threw [his]0-i cigarette away ; [he]0-i even dusted [his]0-i coat a little with [his]0-i hand . [He]0-i then , not being able to get at the white patch on the shoulder , took it off and shook it . A large grey handkerchief was used to flick [his]0-i boots with . “[1039-us] So ! ” [he]0-i grunted , smartly shooting on [his]0-i coat . [The central room]3153-the central room , when [he]0-i got into [it]3153-the central room , appeared a different place . [People]430-people were standing about and waiting for the next tune . It had been completely changed by [his]0-i novel and material feeling for [Anastasya]216-anastasya . Everything , for a second time , was quite ordinary , but not electrically ordinary , almost hushed , this time . [He]0-i had become [a practical man]3219-a practical man , surrounded by facts . But [he]0-i was much more worried ' and tired than at the beginning of the evening . To get away was [his]0-i immediate thought . But [he]0-i felt hungry . [He]0-i went into [the refreshment - room]3174-the refreshment - room . On the same side as the door , a couple of feet to the right , was a couch . The trestle - bar with the refreshments ran the length of the opposite wall . [The room]2366-the room was quiet and almost empty . Out of the tail of [his]0-i eye , as [he]0-i entered , [he]0-i became conscious of something . [He]0-i turned towards the couch . [Soltyk]206-soltyk and [Anastasya]216-anastasya were sitting there , and looking at [him]0-i with the abrupt embarrassment [people]430-people show when [an absentee under discussion]3223-an absentee under discussion suddenly appears . [He]0-i flushed and was about to turn back to the door . But [he]0-i flushed still more next moment , at thought of [his]0-i hesitation . This humiliating full - stop beneath [their]430-people eyes must be wiped out , anyhow . [He]0-i walked on steadily to [the bar]3224-the bar . A shy consciousness of [his]0-i physique beset [him]0-i . [He]0-i felt again [an outcast]3225-an outcast — of [an inferior class]3226-an inferior class , socially . [He]0-i must not show this . [He]0-i must be leisurely . [He]0-i was leisurely . [He]0-i thought when [he]0-i stretched [his]0-i hand out to take [his]0-i cup of coffee that it would never reach it . Reduced to posing nude for [Anastasya]216-anastasya and [the Russian]207-the russian was the result of the evening ! Scores of little sensations , like [troublesome imps]3227-troublesome imps , herded airily behind [him]0-i . [They]430-people tickled [him]0-i with impalpable fingers . [He]0-i munched sandwiches without the faintest sense of their taste . [Anastasya]216-anastasya ’s eyes were scourging [him]0-i . [He]0-i felt like [a martyr]3228-a martyr . Suddenly conscious of an awkwardness in [his]0-i legs , [he]0-i changed [his]0-i position . [His]0-i arms were ludicrously disabled . The sensation of standing neck deep in horrid filth beset [him]0-i . Compelled to remain in soaking wet clothes and unable to change them , [his]0-i body gradually drying them , would have been a similar discomfort . The noise of the dancing began again , filled [the room]2366-the room . This purified things somewhat . [He]0-i got red in the face as though with a gigantic effort , but went on staring in front of [him]0-i . [His]0-i anger kept rising . [He]0-i stood there deliberately longer ; in fact on and on , almost in the same position . [She]3230-her should wait [his]0-i pleasure till [he]0-i liked to turn round , and — then . [He]0-i allowed [her]3230-her laughter to accumulate on [his]0-i back , like a coat of mud . In [his]0-i illogical vision [he]0-i felt [her]3230-her there behind [him]0-i laughing and laughing interminably . Had [he]0-i gone straight up to [her]3230-her , in a moment of passion , both disembodied as it were , anything in the shape of objective observation disappearing , [he]0-i could have avoided this scrutiny . [He]0-i had preferred to plank [himself]0-i there in front of [her]3230-her , inevitably ridiculous , a mark for that laugh of [hers]3230-her . [Soltyk]206-soltyk was sharing it . More and more [his]0-i laughter became intolerable . The traditional solution again suggested itself . Laugh ! Laugh ! [He]0-i would stand there letting the debt grow , letting them gorge [themselves]3231-themselves on [his]0-i back . [The attendant behind the bar]3232-the attendant behind the bar began observing [him]0-i with severe curiosity . [He]0-i had stood in almost the same position for five minutes and kept staring darkly past [her]3230-her , very red in the face . Then suddenly a laugh burst out behind [him]0-i — a blow , full of insult , in [his]0-i ears — and [he]0-i nearly jumped off the ground . After [his]0-i long immobility the jump was of the last drollery . [His]0-i fists clenched , [his]0-i face emptied of every drop of colour , in the mere action [he]0-i had almost knocked [a man]2077-a man , standing beside [him]0-i , over . The laugh , for [him]0-i , had risen with tropic suddenness , a simoom of intolerable offence . It had carried [him]0-i off [his]0-i legs , or whirled [him]0-i round rather , in a second . [A young English girl]3234-a young english girl , already terrified at [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s appearance , and [a man , almost as much so]3235-a man , almost as much so , stood open - mouthed in front of [him]0-i . As to [Anastasya]216-anastasya and [Soltyk]206-soltyk , [they]3236-they had very completely disappeared , long before , in all probability . To find that [he]0-i had been struggling and perspiring in the grasp of a shadow was a fresh offence , merely , for [the count of [the absentees]3238-the absentees]3237-the count of the absentees . Obviously , shadow or not , there or not there , it was [they]3236-they . [He]0-i felt this a little ; but [they]3236-they had disappeared into [the Ewigkeit]71-the ewigkeit for the moment . [He]0-i had been again beating the air . This should have been a climax , of blows , words , definite things . But things remained vague . The turmoil of the evening remained [his]0-i , the solid part of it , unshared by [anybody else]3239-anybody else . [He]0-i smiled , rather hideously and menacingly , at [the two English people near [him]0-i]3240-the two english people near him , and walked away . [He]0-i was not going in search of [Anastasya]216-anastasya . [They]3236-they would be met somewhere or other , no doubt . All [he]0-i wanted now was to get away from [the English club]975-the english club as soon as possible . While [he]0-i was making towards [the vestibule]3242-the vestibule [he]0-i was confronted again with [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann . “[1039-us] [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler , [I]0-i wish to speak to [you]190-kreisler , ” [he]0-i heard [her]209-fraulein lipmann say . “[1039-us] Go to the devil ! ” [he]0-i answered without hesitation or softness . “[1042-besotted fool] [Besotted fool]1042-besotted fool ! if [you]190-kreisler do n’t go at once , [I]0-i ’ll get---- ” Turning on [her]209-fraulein lipmann like lightning , with exasperation perfectly meeting [hers]209-fraulein lipmann , [his]0-i right hand threatening , quickly raised towards [his]0-i left shoulder , [he]0-i shouted : “[1039-us] Lass mich doch — gemeine alte Sau ! ” The hissing , thunderous explosion was the last thing in vocal virulence . The muscles all seemed gathered up at [his]0-i ears like reins , and the flesh tightened and white round [his]0-i mouth . [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann took several steps back . [Kreisler]190-kreisler with equal quickness turned away , rapped on the counter , while [the attendant]3243-the attendant looked for [his]0-i hat , and left [the Club]72-the club . [Fraulein Lippmann]248-fraulein lippmann was left with the heavy , unforgettable word “[1039-us] sow ” deposited in [her]209-fraulein lipmann boiling spirit , that , boil as it might , would hardly reduce this word to tenderness or digestibility . A JEST TOO DEEP FOR LAUGHTER With a little scratching ( as [the concierge]2561-the concierge pushed it ) with the malignity of a little , quiet , sleek animal , the letter from [Germany]4-germany crept under the door the next morning , and lay there through the silence of the next hour or two , until [Kreisler]190-kreisler woke . Succeeding to [his]190-kreisler first brutal farewells to [his]190-kreisler dreams , no hopes leapt on [his]190-kreisler body , a magnificent stallion ’s , uselessly refreshed . Soon [he]190-kreisler saw the letter . It lay there quiet , unimportant , rather matter of fact and sly . [Kreisler]190-kreisler felt it an indignity to have to open it . Until [his]190-kreisler dressing was finished , it remained where it was . [He]190-kreisler might have been making some one wait . Then [he]190-kreisler took it up , and opening it , drew out between [his]190-kreisler forefinger and thumb , the cheque . This [he]190-kreisler deposited with as much contempt as possible , and a “[1039-us] phui ” on the edge of [his]190-kreisler washhand stand . Then [he]190-kreisler turned to the letter . [He]190-kreisler read the first few fines , pumping at a cigarette , reducing it mathematically to ash . Cold fury entered [his]190-kreisler mind with a bound at the first words . They were the final words giving notice of a positive stoppage of supplies . This month ’s money was sent to enable [him]190-kreisler to settle up [his]190-kreisler affairs and come to [Germany]4-germany at once . [He]190-kreisler read the first three lines over and over again , going no further , although the news begun in these first lines was developed throughout the two pages of the letter . Then [he]190-kreisler put it down beside the cheque , and crushing it under [his]190-kreisler fist , said monotonously to [himself]190-kreisler , without much more feeling than the sound of the word contained : “[1039-us] Schwein , Schwein , Schwein ! ” [He]190-kreisler got up , and pressed [his]190-kreisler hand on [his]190-kreisler forehead ; it was wet : [he]190-kreisler put [his]190-kreisler hands in [his]190-kreisler pockets and these came into contact with a cinquante centime piece . [He]190-kreisler took them out again slowly , went to [his]190-kreisler box and underneath an old dressing - gown found writing paper and envelopes . Then , referring to [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father ’s letter for the date , [he]190-kreisler wrote the following lines : “[1039-us] 1th June 19 — “ Sir , — [I]190-kreisler shall not return as [you]402-his father suggest in person , but [my]190-kreisler body will no doubt be sent to [you]402-his father about the middle of next month . If — keeping to [your]402-his father decision — no money is sent , it being impossible to five without money , [I]190-kreisler shall on the seventh of July , this day next month , shoot [myself]190-kreisler . “[190-kreisler] [Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler . ” Within half an hour this was posted . Then [he]190-kreisler went and had breakfast with more tranquillity and relish than [he]190-kreisler had known for some days . [He]190-kreisler sat up stiffly like a dilapidated but apparently in some way satisfied rooster at [his]190-kreisler café table . This life was now settled , pressure ceased . [He]190-kreisler had come to a conventional and respectable decision . [His]190-kreisler conduct the night before , for instance , had not been at all respectable . Death — like [a monastery]3246-a monastery — was before [him]190-kreisler , with equivalents of a slight shaving of the head merely , a handful of vows , some desultory farewells , very restricted space , but none the worse for that ; with something like the disagreeableness of a dive for one not used to [deep water]3247-deep water . But [he]190-kreisler had got into life , anyhow , by mistake ; il s’était trompé de porte . [His]190-kreisler life might almost have been regarded as a long and careful preparation for voluntary death . The nightmare of Death , as it haunted the imaginations of [the Egyptians]3248-the egyptians , had here been conjured in another way . Death was not to be overcome with embalmings and Pyramids , or fought within the souls of [children]453-children . It was confronted as [some other more uncompromising race ( and yet also haunted by this terrible idea]3250-some other more uncompromising race ( and yet also haunted by this terrible idea ) might have been . Instead of rearing smooth faces of immense stone against it , [you]3251-you imagine an unparalleled immobility in life , a race of statues , throwing flesh in [Death]174-death ’s path instead of basalt . [Kreisler]190-kreisler would have undoubtedly been [a high priest among [this people]3253-this people]3252-a high priest among this people . In a large fluid but nervous handwriting , the following letter lay , read , as it were : [Bertha]177-bertha still keeping [her]177-bertha eye on it from a distance : “[190-kreisler] Dear [Bertha]177-bertha , — [I]0-i am writing at [the Gare St. Lazare]1043-the gare st. lazare , on [my]0-i way to [England]25-england . [You]177-bertha have made things much easier for [me]0-i in one way of course , far more difficult in another . Parenthetically , [I]0-i may mention that the whimsical happenings between [you]177-bertha and [[your]177-bertha absurd countryman]1044-your absurd countryman in full moonlight are known to [me]0-i . They were recounted with a wealth of detail that left nothing to the imagination , happily for [my]0-i peculiar possessive sensitiveness , known to [you]177-bertha . [I]0-i do n’t know whether [that little red - headed bitch — the colour of [Iscariot]249-iscariot]1045-that little red - headed bitch — the colour of iscariot , so perhaps [she]1045-that little red - headed bitch — the colour of iscariot is — is [a friend of [yours]177-bertha]1046-a friend of yours ? [Kreisler]190-kreisler ! [I]0-i was offered an introduction to [him]190-kreisler the other day , which [I]0-i refused . It seems [he]190-kreisler has introduced [himself]190-kreisler ! “ Before , [I]251-sorbett had contemplated retiring to a little distance for the purpose of reflection . This last coup of yours necessitates a much further recul , withdrawal — a couple of hundred miles at least , [I]251-sorbett have judged . And as far as [I]251-sorbett can see [I]251-sorbett shall be some months — say ten — away . [I]251-sorbett am not wise enough to take [your]177-bertha action au pied de la lettre- , nevertheless , [you]177-bertha may consider [yourself]177-bertha free as [women]2149-women go . What [I]251-sorbett mean is [you]177-bertha need not trouble to restrain the exuberance of [your]177-bertha exploits in future . ( What rubbish ! ) Let [them]3255-them develop naturally , right up to fiançailles , or elsewhere . [I]251-sorbett have a very German idea . Why should not [girls]3256-girls have two or three fiancés ? [Not two or three husbands]3257-not two or three husbands . But fiancé , especially nowadays , is an elastic term . Why should n’t fiancé take the place of [husband]3258-husband ? It is a very respectable word : a very respectable state . But [my]251-sorbett idea was that of a club , organized around the fiancée . [You]177-bertha seem to [me]251-sorbett cut out for such a club . [A man]2077-a man might spend quite a pleasant time with [the other fiancés]3260-the other fiancés . [A fine science of [women]2149-women]3261-a fine science of women would be developed , perhaps along Oriental lines a little . Then [a man]2077-a man would remember [the different clubs [he]2077-a man had belonged to]3264-the different clubs he had belonged to . [Some very beautiful women]3265-some very beautiful women might have a sort of University settled near [them]3265-some very beautiful women . [You]177-bertha have Germanized [me]251-sorbett in a horrible way ! Anyhow , [you]177-bertha may count on [me]251-sorbett should [you]177-bertha think of starting [a little institution of that sort]3270-a little institution of that sort . [My]251-sorbett address for the next few months will be 10 [Waterford Street]73-waterford street , [London]7-london , W.C. — [Yours]177-bertha , “[251-sorbett] [SORBETT]251-sorbett . ” [He]3269-he spelt [his]3269-he name with two T ’s because [Bertha]177-bertha had never disciplined [herself]177-bertha to suppress final consonants . [Bertha]177-bertha was in [[her]177-bertha little kitchen]3271-her little kitchen . [It]3271-her little kitchen was near the front door . Next to [it]3271-her little kitchen was [[her]177-bertha studio]3272-her studio or salon , then [bedroom]3273-bedroom : along a passage at right angles [the rooms rented by [Clara Goenthner]252-clara]3274-the rooms rented by clara goenthner , [[her]177-bertha friend]2369-her friend . The letter had been laid on the table , by the side of which stood the large gas - stove , like a safe , [its]3271-her little kitchen gas stars , on top , blasting away luridly at pans and saucepans with [Bertha]177-bertha ’s breakfast . While busying [herself]177-bertha with eggs and coffee , [she]177-bertha gazed over [her]177-bertha arm reflectively at the letter . It was a couple of inches too far away for [her]177-bertha to be able to read it . [The postman]3276-the postman had come ten minutes before . [It]3277-it was now four days after the dance , and since [she]177-bertha had last seen [Tarr]122-tarr . [She]177-bertha had “[251-sorbett] felt ” [he]122-tarr would come on that particular morning . The belief in [woman]625-woman ’s intuition is not confined , of course , to [men]518-men . “[1047-he] Could [he]1047-he have heard anything of the Kreisler incident ? ” [she]177-bertha had asked [herself]177-bertha . The possibility of this was terrifying . But perhaps it would be as well if [he]1047-he had . It might at any future time crop up . And what things had happened when other older things had come to light suddenly ! [She]177-bertha would tell [him]1047-he if [he]1047-he had not already heard . [He]1047-he should hear it from [her]177-bertha . The great boulevard sacrifice of the other night had appeared folly , long ago . But peculiarly free from any form of spite — [she]177-bertha did not feel unkindly towards [Kreisler]190-kreisler . So [Sorbert]270-sorbert was expected to breakfast , on the authority of [her]177-bertha intuition . Bread was being fried in fat . What manner of [man]610-man would appear , how far renseigné — or if not informed , still all [their]610-man other difficulties were there inevitably enough ? [Experience]253-experience , however , suggested such breakfast as pleased [him]1047-he . Could fried toast and honey play a part in such troubles ? Ah , yes . Troubles often reduced themselves to fried bread and honey : [they]610-man could sow troubles , why not help to quell troubles ? But [she]177-bertha had had a second intuition that [he]1047-he knew . Not knowing how stormy [their]610-man interview might be [she]177-bertha neglected no minute precautions — and these were the touching ones — any more than [the sailor]3281-the sailor would neglect to stow away even the smallest of [his]3281-the sailor sails , [I]1047-he suppose , at the sulky approach of a simoom . [The simoom]3282-the simoom , however , had left [her]177-bertha becalmed and taken [the train]3283-the train for [Dieppe]74-dieppe instead of coming in [her]177-bertha direction . [Bertha]177-bertha went on turning the bread over in the pan , taking the butter from its paper and dropping it into its dish : rinsing and wiping a knife or two , regulating the gas . Frequent truculent exclamations spluttered out if anything went wrong . “[1047-he] Verdammtes Streichholz ! ” “[254-donnerwetter] [Donnerwetter]254-donnerwetter ! ” [She]177-bertha used the oaths of [Goethe]178-goethe . One eyebrow was raised in humorous reflective irritation . [She]177-bertha would flatten the letter out and bend down to examine a sentence , stopping [her]177-bertha cooking for a moment . “[254-donnerwetter] Sâlot ! ” [she]177-bertha exclaimed , after having read the letter all through again , putting it down . [She]177-bertha turned with coquettish contemptuousness to [her]177-bertha frying - pan . “[254-donnerwetter] Sâlot ” was , with [her]177-bertha , a favourite epithet . [Clara]252-clara ’s door opened , and [Bertha]177-bertha crumpled the letter into [her]177-bertha pocket . [Clara]252-clara entered sleepy - eyed and affecting ill - humour . [Her]252-clara fat body was a softly distributed burden , which [she]252-clara carried with the aplomb and indifference of habit . [She]252-clara had a gracefully bumpy forehead , a nice whistling mouth , soft , good and discreet orbs . [Her]252-clara days were passed in [the library of [the Place Saint Sulpice]3285-the place saint sulpice]3284-the library of the place saint sulpice . “[220-juan soler] Ach , lasse ! lass mich doch ! Get on with [your]1048-your cooking ! ” [she]252-clara exclaimed as [Bertha]177-bertha began [her]177-bertha customary sociable and playful greeting . [Bertha]177-bertha always was conscious of [her]177-bertha noise , of shallowness and worldliness , with [this shrewd , indifferent , slow , and monosyllabic bookworm]3286-this shrewd , indifferent , slow , and monosyllabic bookworm . [She]177-bertha wanted to caper round it , inviting it to cumbrous play , like a small lively dog around a heavy one . [She]177-bertha was much more femme as [she]177-bertha said , but aware that [Clara]252-clara did not regard this as an attainment . Being femme had taken up so much of [her]177-bertha energy and life that [she]177-bertha could not expect to be so complete in other ways as [Clara]252-clara . With [this other woman , who was much less “[1048-your] woman ” than [she]252-clara]3287-this other woman , who was much less “ woman ” than she , [she]252-clara always felt impelled to ultra - feminine behaviour . [She]252-clara was childish to the top of [her]252-clara bent . This was insulting to [the other]2449-the other : it showed too clearly [Bertha]177-bertha ’s way of regarding [her]252-clara as not so much femme as [herself]252-clara . [Clara]252-clara felt this and would occasionally show impatience at [Bertha]177-bertha ’s skittishness : a gruff manlike impatience entering grimly but imperturbably into [the man]2084-the man - part , but claiming at the same time its prerogatives . [Clara]252-clara had had no known love affairs . [She]252-clara regarded [Bertha]177-bertha , sometimes , with much curiosity . This “[625-woman] [woman]625-woman ’s temperament , ” so complacently displayed , soothed and tickled [her]252-clara . “[625-woman] [Clara]252-clara , [Soler]220-juan soler has told [me]0-i to send a picture to [the Salon d’Automne]1050-the salon d’automne . ” “[220-juan soler] Oh ! ” [Clara]252-clara was not impressed by “[220-juan soler] success . ” [She]252-clara was preparing [her]252-clara own breakfast and jostled [Bertha]177-bertha , usurping more than half the table . [Bertha]177-bertha , delighted , retorted with trills of shrill indignation and by recapturing the positions lost by [her]177-bertha plates . [Her]252-clara breakfast ready [she]177-bertha carried it into [[her]177-bertha room]890-her room , pretending to be offended with [Clara]252-clara . Breakfast over [she]177-bertha wrote to [Tarr]122-tarr . The letter was written quite easily and directly . [She]177-bertha was so sure in the convention of [her]177-bertha passion that there was no scratching out or hesitation . “[220-juan soler] [I]0-i feel so far away from [you]1051-you . ” There was nothing more to be said ; as it had been said often before , it came easily and promptly with the pen . All the feeling that could find expression was fluent , large and assured , like the handwriting , and went at once into these conventional forms . “[0-i] Let [Englishmen]1052-englishmen thank [[their]1052-englishmen stars]1053-their stars — [the good stars of [the Northmen]1055-the northmen and [early seamen]1056-early seamen]1054-the good stars of the northmen and early seamen — that [they]1052-englishmen have such stammering tongues and such a fierce horror of grandiloquence . [They]1052-englishmen are still primitive and true in [their]1052-englishmen passions , because [they]1052-englishmen are afraid of [them]1052-englishmen , like [children]453-children . The shocks go on underneath ; [they]1052-englishmen trust [their]1052-englishmen unconsciousness . The odious facility of [the South]75-the south , whether it be [their]1052-englishmen , at bottom , very shrewdly regulated anger ( l'art de s’engueuler ) or [their]1052-englishmen picture post card perfection of amorous expressiveness ; such things [those Island mutterers]1058-those island mutterers and [mutes]1059-mutes have escaped . But worst of all is the cult of the ‘ Temperament , ’ all the accent on that poor last syllable , whose home is [that dubious middle Empire]1060-that dubious middle empire , so incorrigibly banal . The lacerating and tireless pricking and pushing of this hapless ‘ temperament ’ is a more harrowing spectacle than the use of dogs in [Belgium]76-belgium or [women]2149-women in [England]25-england . ” This passage , from an article in the English Review , [Tarr]122-tarr had shown to [Bertha]177-bertha with great pleasure [Bertha]177-bertha had a good share of impoverished and overworked temperament , but in a very genial fashion . [It]3291-it had not , with [her]177-bertha , grown crooked and vicious with this constant ill - treatment . It was strenuous but friendly . [It]3291-it served in any case [a mistress surprisingly disinterested and gentle]3292-a mistress surprisingly disinterested and gentle . On the receipt of [Tarr]122-tarr ’s letter [she]177-bertha had felt , to begin with , very indignant and depressed at [his]122-tarr having had the strength to go away without coming to see [her]177-bertha . So [her]177-bertha letter began on that complaint . [He]122-tarr had at last , this was certain , gone away , with the first likelihood of permanence since [they]3293-they had known [each other]370-each other . Despite [her]177-bertha long preparation for this , and [her]177-bertha being even deliberately the cause of it , [she]177-bertha was mortified and at the same time unhappy at the sight of [her]177-bertha success . The Kreisler business had been more for [herself]177-bertha than anything , for [her]177-bertha own private edification . [She]177-bertha would free [Sorbert]270-sorbert by an act , in a sort of impalpable way . It was not destined as yet for publicity . The fact of [the women surprising [Kreisler]190-kreisler and [her]177-bertha on [the boulevard]426-the boulevard]3295-the women surprising kreisler and her on the boulevard had put everything at once out of perspective , damaged [her]177-bertha illusion of sacrifice . Compelled at once to be practical again , find excuses , repudiate immediately what [she]177-bertha had done before [she]177-bertha had been able to enjoy or digest it , was like [a man]2077-a man being snatched away from table , the last mouthful hardly swallowed [She]177-bertha was [the person surprised before some work doing is completed]3298-the person surprised before some work doing is completed — it still in a rudimentary unshowable state . For once [Tarr]122-tarr was not only in the right , but , to [her]177-bertha irritation , [he]122-tarr had proofs , splendid ocular proofs , a cloud of [witnesses]3299-witnesses . To end nobly , on [her]177-bertha own initiative , had been [her]177-bertha idea ; to make a last sacrifice to [Sorbert]270-sorbert in leaving [him]270-sorbert irrevocably , as [she]177-bertha had sacrificed [her]177-bertha feelings all along in allowing [their]3300-their engagement to drag suspiciously on , in making [her]177-bertha position slightly uncomfortable with [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends ( and these social things meant so much to [her]177-bertha in addition ) . And now , instead , everything had been turned into questionable meanness and ridicule ; when [she]177-bertha had intended to behave with the maximum of swagger , [she]177-bertha suddenly found [herself]177-bertha relegated to a skulking and unfortunate plane . Considerations about [Fate]172-fate beset [her]177-bertha . Everything was hopelessly unreliable . The best thing to do was to do nothing . [She]177-bertha was not [her]177-bertha usual energetic too spiritually bustling self . [She]177-bertha wrote [her]177-bertha letter quite easily and as usual , but [she]177-bertha did not ( very unusually ) believe in its efficacy . [She]177-bertha even wrote it a trifle more easily than usual for that reason . It was only a momentary rebellion against the ease with which this protest was done . Perhaps had it not been for the fascination of habit , then some more adequate words would have been written . [His]270-sorbert letter had come . Empty and futile [she]177-bertha had done [her]177-bertha task , answered as [she]177-bertha must do ; “[2149-women] As [we]1062-we all must do ! ” [she]177-bertha would have thought , with an exclamation mark after it . [She]177-bertha sealed up [her]177-bertha letter and addressed it . In the drawer where [she]177-bertha was putting [Sorbert]270-sorbert ’s latest letter away were some old ones . A letter of the year before [she]177-bertha took out and read . With its two sentences it was more cruel and had more meaning than the one [she]177-bertha had just received : “[1063-that little darmstadt woman] Put off [that little Darmstadt woman]1063-that little darmstadt woman . [Chagrin]255-chagrin and regret for [him]270-sorbert struck [her]177-bertha a series of sharp blows . [She]177-bertha started crying again suddenly , quickly , and vehemently as though surprised by some thought . The whole morning [her]177-bertha work worried [her]177-bertha , dusting and arranging . [She]177-bertha experienced a revolt against [her]177-bertha ceaseless orderliness , a very grave thing in such [an exemplary prisoner]3314-an exemplary prisoner . At four o’clock in the afternoon , as often happened , [she]177-bertha was still dawdling about in [her]177-bertha dressing - gown and had not yet had lunch . [Madame Vannier]256-madame vannier was given the letter to post at two . [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s friends]3318-bertha ’s friends looked for [her]177-bertha elsewhere , nowadays , than at [[her]177-bertha rooms]2360-her rooms . Since the dance [none of [[her]177-bertha women friends]3325-her women friends]3324-none of her women friends had come . [She]177-bertha had spent an hour or two with [them]3325-her women friends at [the restaurant]2772-the restaurant . At the dance [she]177-bertha had kept rather apart . [Dazed]258-dazed , after a shock , and needing self - collection , was the line sketched . [Her]177-bertha account of things could not , of course , be blurted out anyhow . It had to grow out of circumstances . It , of course , must be given . [She]177-bertha had not yet given it . But haste must be avoided . For its particular type , as long a time as possible must be allowed to elapse before [she]177-bertha spoke of what had happened . It must almost seem as though [she]177-bertha were going to say nothing ; sudden , perfect , and very impressive silence on [her]177-bertha part . To accustom [their]3325-her women friends minds to [her]177-bertha silence would make speech all the more imposing , when it came . This is one of the occasions for a woman---- ” So [Bertha]177-bertha ’s story had come uncomfortably and difficultly to flower . [She]177-bertha wished [she]177-bertha had not waited so long . But it was impossible now , the matter put in the light that [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann ’s intervention had caused , to delay any longer . [She]177-bertha was , there was no doubt about it , vaguely responsible for [Kreisler]190-kreisler . It was obviously [her]177-bertha duty to explain [him]190-kreisler . And now [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann had just put an embargo on explanations . There were to be no more explanations . In Kreisleriana [her]177-bertha apport was very important : much more definite than the indignation or hypothesis of any of the rest . [She]177-bertha . had been nearer to [him]190-kreisler , anyway . [She]177-bertha had waited too long , until [the sea]3339-the sea had risen too high , or rather in a direction extremely unfavourable for launching [her]177-bertha contribution . It must be in some way , too , a defence of [Kreisler]190-kreisler . This would be a very delicate matter to handle . Yet could [she]177-bertha sit on there , say nothing , and let [the others]904-the others in the course of time drop the subject 1 [They]904-the others had not turned to [her]177-bertha in any way for further information or as to one peculiarly susceptible of furnishing interesting data . Maintaining this silence was a solution . But it would be even bolder than [her]177-bertha first plan . This would be a still more vigorous , more insolent development of [her]177-bertha plan of confessing — in [her]177-bertha way . But it rather daunted [her]177-bertha . [They]904-the others might easily mistake , if [they]904-the others pleased , [her]177-bertha silence for the silence of acknowledged , very eccentric , guilt . The subject was drawing perilously near the point where it would be dropped . [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann was summing up , and doing the final offices of the law over [the condemned and already unspeakable Kreisler]3341-the condemned and already unspeakable kreisler . No time was to be lost . The breaking in now involved inevitable conflict of a sort with [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann . [She]177-bertha was going to “[190-kreisler] say a word for [Kreisler]190-kreisler ” after [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann ’s words . ( How much better it would have been before ! ) So at this point , looking up from the table , [Bertha]177-bertha ( listened to with uncomfortable unanimity and promptness ) began . [She]177-bertha was smiling with an affectedly hesitating , timid face , smiling in a flat strained way , the neighbourhood of [her]177-bertha eyes suffused slightly with blood , [her]177-bertha lips purring the words a little : “[0-i] Renée , [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i ought to say something — ” [Her]177-bertha smile was that made with a screwing up of the eyes and slow flowering of the lips , noticed on [some people]3342-some people ’s faces when some snobbery [they]3342-some people can not help has to be allowed egress from [their]3342-some people mouth . Renée [Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann turned towards [her]177-bertha composedly . This interruption would require argument ; consciousness of the peculiar nature of [Bertha]177-bertha ’s qualifications was not displayed . “[0-i] [I]0-i had not meant to say anything — about what happened to [me]0-i , that is . [I]0-i , as a matter of fact , have something particularly to complain of . But [I]0-i had nothing to say about it . Only , since [you]1083-you are all discussing it , [I]0-i thought [you]1083-you might not quite understand if [I]0-i did n’t — [I]0-i do n’t think , [Renée]263-renée lipmann , that [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler was quite in [his]190-kreisler right mind this evening . [He]190-kreisler does n’t strike [me]0-i as méchant . [I]0-i do n’t think [he]190-kreisler was really in any way accountable for [his]190-kreisler actions . [I]0-i do n’t , of course , know any more about [him]190-kreisler than [you]1083-you do . This evening was the first time [I]0-i ’ve ever exchanged more than a dozen words with [him]190-kreisler in [my]0-i life . ” This was said in the sing - song of quick parentheses , eyebrows lifted , and with little gestures of the hand . “[190-kreisler] [He]190-kreisler caught hold of [me]0-i — like this . ” [She]1083-you made a quick snatching gesture at [Fraulein Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann , who did not like this attempt at intimidation or velvety defiance . “[190-kreisler] [He]190-kreisler was hissing [me]0-i when [you]1083-you came up , ” turning to [one or two of [the others]904-the others]3343-one or two of the others . [You]177-bertha can depend on it that that , anyhow , is not the explanation . ”[266-elsa] “ [Sorbert]270-sorbert has [a rival]3120-a rival perhaps ? ”[177-bertha] This remark was met in staring silence . It was a mixing of elements , an unnecessary bringing in of something as unapropos , as unmanageable ; that deserved only no words at all . [She]177-bertha did not wish to concede the light tone required . [Elsa]266-elsa had admitted that [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek was responsible for the statement , “ [I]232-fraulein vasek was the cause of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s behaviour , ”[232-fraulein vasek] etc . That was one of those things ( there being no evidence to confirm or even suggest it ) which at once puts [a woman]2139-a woman on a peculiar pinnacle of bad taste , incomprehensibleness , and horridness . [Bertha]177-bertha ’s personal estimation of [Kreisler]190-kreisler received a complex fillip . This ridiculous version — coming after [her]177-bertha version — was a rival version , believed in by [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends . [Bertha]177-bertha took some minutes to digest [Elsa]266-elsa ’s news . [She]177-bertha flushed . The more [she]177-bertha thought of this rival version of [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek ’s , the more reprehensible it appeared . It was a startlingly novel and uncompromising version , giving proof of a perfect immodesty . It charged [hers]177-bertha full tilt . This version of [hers]177-bertha had been the great asset of existence for three days . [Some one]619-some one had coolly set up [shop next door]1131-shop next door , to sell an article in which [she]177-bertha , and [she]177-bertha alone , had specialized . Here was [an unexpected , gratuitous , new inventor of versions]1132-an unexpected , gratuitous , new inventor of versions coming along . And what a version to begin with ! [Bertha]177-bertha ’s version had been a vital matter , [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek ’s evidently was a matter of vanity . The contempt of [the workman]1133-the workman , sweating for a living , for [the amateur]1134-the amateur , possessed [her]177-bertha . But there was a graver aspect to the version of this poaching Venus . In discrediting [Bertha]177-bertha ’s suggested account of how things happened , it attacked indirectly [her]177-bertha action , proceeding , ostensibly , from these notions . [Her]177-bertha meeting [Kreisler]190-kreisler at present depended for its reasonableness and existence even on the “ hunger ”[190-kreisler] theory ; or , if that should fail , something equally touching and primitive . Were [she]177-bertha forced , as [Elsa]266-elsa readily did , to accept the snub - by - Anastasya theory , with its tale of ridiculous reprisals , further dealings with [Kreisler]190-kreisler would show in a bare and ugly light . [Her]177-bertha defiance to [Elsa]266-elsa had been delivered with great satisfaction . “ [I]177-bertha am meeting [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler tomorrow ! ”[177-bertha] The shine had soon been taken off that . All [Bertha]177-bertha ’s past management ’ of the boulevard scene had presupposed that [she]177-bertha was working in an element destined to obscurity : malleable , therefore , to any extent . [Anastasya]216-anastasya had risen up calm , contradictory , [a formidable and perplexing enemy]1135-a formidable and perplexing enemy , with [her]177-bertha cursed version . The weak point in it was the rank immodesty of the form it took . [Her]177-bertha obstinacy awoke . This new turn coming from [the other camp]1136-the other camp solidified two or three degrees more , in a twinkling , [her]177-bertha partisanship of [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [She]177-bertha had a direct interest now in [their]1137-their meeting . [People]430-people appear with a startling suddenness sometimes out of the fog of Time and Space . [Bertha]177-bertha did not visualize [Kreisler]190-kreisler very readily . [She]177-bertha was surprised when [she]177-bertha saw [him]190-kreisler below [her]177-bertha windows the next day . [She]177-bertha wished to stop [him]190-kreisler there , before [he]190-kreisler came any further . In the processes of [his]190-kreisler uncertainty [he]190-kreisler was so innocuous and distant , for the moment . [His]190-kreisler first visit . There [he]190-kreisler was : so far , [a stranger]509-a stranger . [He]190-kreisler should remain “ stranger ”[177-bertha] for [her]177-bertha , where [he]190-kreisler came from . [She]177-bertha found here , in [[her]177-bertha room]890-her room , was very different from [she]177-bertha found outside , in [restaurant]1148-restaurant or [street]820-street . The clothing of this decor was a nakedness . [She]177-bertha struggled for a moment up from the obstinate dream , made of artificial but tenacious sentiments , shaped by contretemps of all sorts that had been accumulating like a snowball ever since [her]177-bertha last interview with [Tarr]122-tarr . This invasion of Indifference and [Difference]269-difference had floated [her]177-bertha , successfully , away in some direction . The bell rang again . [She]177-bertha could see [him]190-kreisler , almost , through the wall , standing phlegmatic and erect . [They]1150-they had not spoken yet . But [they]1150-they had been some minutes “ in touch . ”[1150-they] Perhaps [he]190-kreisler was mad ! [Elsa]266-elsa , cold , matter - of - fact , but with warnings for [her]177-bertha , came into [her]177-bertha mind . However much [she]177-bertha resisted the facts , there was very little reason for this meeting . It was a now unnecessary , exploded , and objectless impulse , sapped by [Anastasya]216-anastasya . [She]177-bertha was going through with something from laziness and obstinacy mixed , that no longer meant anything . Already dressed , [she]177-bertha walked to the door as the bell rang a third time . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was serious and a little haggard ; different from the day before . [He]190-kreisler had expected to be asked in . Instead , hardly saying anything , [she]177-bertha came out on [the narrow landing]1151-the narrow landing and closed the door behind [her]177-bertha . Surprised , [he]190-kreisler felt for the first stair . It was eight in the evening , very dark on [the staircase]1152-the staircase , and [he]190-kreisler stumbled several times . [Bertha]177-bertha felt [she]177-bertha could not say a single word to [him]190-kreisler . It was just as though [[some lawyer]1153-some lawyer ’s clerk]1154-some lawyer ’s clerk had come to fetch [her]177-bertha for a tragic disagreeable interview , and [she]177-bertha , having been sitting fully dressed for unnecessary hours in advance , were now urging [him]190-kreisler silently and violently before [her]177-bertha , following . That afternoon [she]177-bertha had received a second letter from [Sorbert]270-sorbert . “ [[My]270-sorbert dear]465-my dear [Bertha]177-bertha . — Excuse [me]270-sorbert for the blague [I]270-sorbert wrote the other day . [She]1155-she was just going to take up a book and read , when , as though something had called [her]1155-she attention , [she]1155-she put it down , got up , [her]1155-she head turned over [her]1155-she shoulder , and then suddenly flung [herself]1155-she on the sofa as though it had been rocks and [she]1155-she plunging on them from [a high cliff]1158-a high cliff . [She]1155-she sobbed until [she]1155-she had tired [herself]1155-she out . [So Kreisler]190-kreisler and [she]1155-she walked up [the street]2061-the street as though compelled by some very strange circumstances , only , to be in [each other]370-each other ’s company . [He]190-kreisler appeared depressed , and to have come also under the spell of some sort of meaningless duty . [He]190-kreisler showed no interest . This meeting had been the only event of the day for [him]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler had looked forward to it a little at first . But as it approached [he]190-kreisler got fidgety , began counting the time , and from being a blessed something , it became a burden . The responsibility of this meeting even seemed too much for [him]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler began to ask [himself]190-kreisler what useless errand [he]190-kreisler was on now ? The effort of this simple affair worked lamentably on [his]190-kreisler nerves . [He]190-kreisler would not have gone , only the appointment being made and fixed in [his]190-kreisler mind , and [he]190-kreisler having felt it in the distance all day , [he]190-kreisler knew it would irk [him]190-kreisler more if [he]190-kreisler did not go . [He]190-kreisler was compelled , in short , to go , to have done with it . The worrying obsession of not having done it intimidated [him]190-kreisler . In the empty evening [he]190-kreisler would have been at the mercy of this thing - not - done , like an itch . [Bertha]177-bertha , for [her]177-bertha part , recovered . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s complete abstraction and indifference were soothing . [He]190-kreisler seemed to know as little why [he]190-kreisler was there as [she]177-bertha , or less , and be only waiting for [her]177-bertha to disappear again . No , slight was implied . [Her]177-bertha vanity stirred a little . [She]177-bertha perhaps came through this to bring [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek on the boards as [she]177-bertha had originally intended . [He]190-kreisler did not look like suggesting another . — [His]190-kreisler manner on the day before would not have warranted complete calm . When a dog or cow has passed [a trembling child without any signs M of mischief]1167-a trembling child without any signs m of mischief , [the child]1168-the child sometimes is inclined to step after it and put forth a caressing hand . By [his]190-kreisler manner and its reflection on [her]266-elsa feelings [he]190-kreisler had created a situation not unlike that of the dance night . There [they]1169-they sat , [she]266-elsa pressing a little , [he]190-kreisler civilly apathetic . [She]177-bertha was back in what would always be for [him]190-kreisler [her]177-bertha characteristic role . [She]177-bertha had discovered [her]177-bertha kissing and being kissed by [a ridiculous individual]1173-a ridiculous individual in the middle of [the street]2061-the street . [You]190-kreisler might have waited till — But that ’s [your]190-kreisler own business . On the other hand , the reason of [his]190-kreisler eccentric appearance this evening was this . [He]190-kreisler had the incredible impudence to wish to make up to [me]177-bertha . [I]177-bertha sent [him]190-kreisler about [his]190-kreisler business , and [he]190-kreisler ‘ manifested ’ in the way [you]190-kreisler know . ”[177-bertha] Reducing all the confused material of this affair to such essential situation , [Bertha]177-bertha saw clearly the essence of [her]177-bertha action . Definite withdrawal from the circle of [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends was now essential . It was accomplished with as much style as possible . [Kreisler]190-kreisler provided the style . [She]177-bertha wanted to be seen with [Kreisler]190-kreisler . The meanness , strangeness , and certain déchéance or come - down , in consorting with [this sorry bird]1177-this sorry bird , must be heightened into poetry and thick and luscious fiction . [They]1178-they had driven [her]177-bertha to this . [They]1178-they were driving [her]177-bertha ! Very well . [She]177-bertha was lasse ! [She]177-bertha would satisfy [them]1178-they . [She]177-bertha would satisfy [Sorbert]270-sorbert . It was what [he]270-sorbert wanted , was it not ? [Kreisler]190-kreisler , of course , was the central , irreducible element in this mental pie .
