[She]177-bertha tried to interest [herself]177-bertha in [Kreisler]190-kreisler and satisfy [Tarr]122-tarr , [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends , [the whole world]1180-the whole world , more thoroughly . [Destiny]271-destiny has more power over [the superstitious]1181-the superstitious . [They]1182-they attract constantly bright fortunes and disasters within [their]1182-they circle . [Destiny]271-destiny had laid its trap in [the unconscious Kreisler]190-kreisler . [It]271-destiny fixed it with powerful violent springs . Eight days later ( dating from the Observatoire meeting ) , it snapped down on [Bertha]177-bertha . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s windows had been incandescent with steady saffron rays , coming over the roofs of [the quarter]2893-the quarter . [[His]190-kreisler little shell of [a room]1185-a room]1184-his little shell of a room had breasted [them]1186-them with pretence of antique adventure . The old boundless yellow lights streamed from [their]1186-them abstract El Dorado . [They]1186-them were [a Gulf Stream]1187-a gulf stream for [[our]1188-our little patch of [a world]1190-a world]1189-our little patch of a world , making [a people as quiet as the English]1191-a people as quiet as the english . [Men]518-men once more were invited to be [the motes in the sunbeam]1193-the motes in the sunbeam , to play in the sleepy surf on the edge of remoteness . Now , from within , [his]190-kreisler windows looked as suddenly harsh and familiar . [Unreasonable]272-unreasonable limitation gave its specific colour to thin glass . The clock was striking eight . Like eight metallic glittering waves dashing discordantly together in [a cavern]1194-a cavern , its strokes rushed up and down in [Bertha]177-bertha ’s head . [She]177-bertha was leaning on the mantelshelf , head sunk forward , with the action of [a person about to be sick]1195-a person about to be sick . [She]177-bertha had struggled up from the bed a moment before — the last vigour at [her]177-bertha disposal being spent in getting away from the bed at all costs . “ Oh schwein ! schwein ! Ich hass es — ich hass dich ! Schwein ! Schensal ! schensslicher Mensch ! ”[177-bertha] All the hatred and repulsion of [her]177-bertha being , in a raw , indecent heat , seemed turned into this tearful sonority , gushing up like blood . An exasperated falling , deepening singsong in the “ schensslicher Mensch ! ”[177-bertha] something of the disgusting sound of the brutal relishing and gobbling of food . Hatred expresses itself like the satisfaction of an appetite . The outrage was spat out of [her]177-bertha body on to [him]190-kreisler . As [she]177-bertha stood there [she]177-bertha looked like [some one on whom a practical joke had been played , of the primitive and physical order , such as drenching , in some amusing manner , with dirty water]1196-some one on whom a practical joke had been played , of the primitive and physical order , such as drenching , in some amusing manner , with dirty water . [She]177-bertha had been decoyed into swallowing something disgusting . [Her]177-bertha attitude was reminiscent of the way [people]430-people are seen to stand bent awkwardly forward , neck craned out , slowly wiping the dirt off [their]430-people clothes , or spitting out the remains of [their]430-people polluted drink , cursing [the joker]1198-the joker . This had been , too , a desperate practical joke in its madness and inconsequence . But it was of the solemn and lonely order . At its consummation there had been no chorus of intelligible laughter . [An uncontrolled Satyr - like figure]1199-an uncontrolled satyr - like figure had leapt suddenly away : [Bertha]177-bertha , in a struggle that had been outrageous and extreme , fighting with the silence of [a confederate beneath the same ban of [the world]2089-the world]1200-a confederate beneath the same ban of the world . A joke too deep for laughter , parodying the phrase , alienating sorrow and tears , had been achieved . [The victim]2320-the victim had been conscious of an eeriness . A folded blouse lay on the corner of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s trunk . [Bertha]177-bertha ’s arms and shoulders were bare , [her]177-bertha hair hanging in wisps and strips , generally — a Salon picture was the result . For purposes of work ( [he]190-kreisler had asked [her]177-bertha to sit for [him]190-kreisler ) , the blouse had been put aside . A jagged tear in [her]177-bertha chemise over [her]177-bertha right breast also seemed the doing of [a Salon artist of facile and commercial invention]1203-a salon artist of facile and commercial invention . [Kreisler]190-kreisler stood at the window . [His]190-kreisler eyes had a lazy , expressionless stare , [his]190-kreisler lips were open . [Nerves]273-nerves brain and [the whole body]1204-the whole body were still spinning and stunned , [his]190-kreisler muscles teeming with actions not finished , sharp , when the actions finished . [He]190-kreisler was still swamped and strung with violence . [His]190-kreisler sudden immobility , as [he]190-kreisler stood there , made the riot of movement and will rise to [his]190-kreisler brain like wine from a weak body . [Satisfaction]274-satisfaction had , however , stilled everything except this tingling prolongation of action . The inanity of what had happened to [her]177-bertha showed as [her]177-bertha unique , intelligible feeling . [Her]177-bertha being there at all , [her]177-bertha eccentric conduct of the last week , what disgusting folly ! Ever since [she]177-bertha had known [Tarr]122-tarr , [her]177-bertha “ sentiment ”[177-bertha] had been castigating [her]177-bertha . A watchful fate appeared to be inventing morals to show [her]177-bertha the folly of [her]177-bertha perpetual romancing . And now this had happened . It was senseless . There was not a single atom of compensation anywhere . [She]177-bertha was [not one of those who , were there any solid compensation of sentiment and necessity ( such as , in the most evident degree , was the case with [Tarr]122-tarr]1205-not one of those who , were there any solid compensation of sentiment and necessity ( such as , in the most evident degree , was the case with tarr ) , would draw back from natural conclusions . Then conclusive physical matters were a culmination of [her]177-bertha romance , and not a separate and disloyal gratification . It never occurred to [her]177-bertha that [they]1206-they could be arrived at without traversing the romance . Was this to be explained as the boulevard incident had been explained by [her]177-bertha ? Was [she]177-bertha to proceed with [her]177-bertha explanations and [her]177-bertha part ? But this time it would be to [herself]177-bertha that the explanations would have to be made . That was a different audience ; a dim feeling found its way into [her]177-bertha , with a sort of sickening malice . [She]177-bertha had a glimpse too of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s Bertha — [the woman that [you]1208-you could n’t shake oft , who , for some unimaginable reason , was always hanging on to [you]1208-you]1207-the woman that you could n’t shake oft , who , for some unimaginable reason , was always hanging on to you . [She]177-bertha even had the strength to admit , distantly , the logic of this act — what had happened to [her]177-bertha — still more disgusting and hateful than its illogic . The only thing that might have been found to mitigate , in some sense , the dreary , sudden madness of it , was that [she]177-bertha felt practically nothing at all for [Kreisler]190-kreisler . It was like some violent accident of [the high road]1209-the high road , the brutality of [a tramp]1210-a tramp . And — as that too would — it partook of the unreality of nightmare . A few minutes before [he]190-kreisler had been tranquilly working away at a drawing , [she]177-bertha sitting in some pose [she]177-bertha had taken up with quick ostentatious intelligence . Startled at [his]190-kreisler request to draw [her]177-bertha shoulders [she]177-bertha had immediately condemned this feeling . [She]177-bertha had come to sit for [him]190-kreisler ; the mere idea that there was any danger was so repulsive that [she]177-bertha immediately consented . [He]190-kreisler was [an artist]2123-an artist , too , of course . While [he]190-kreisler was working [they]1212-they had not talked . Then [he]190-kreisler had put down [his]190-kreisler paper and chalk , stretched , and said : “ [Your]177-bertha arms are like bananas ! ”[190-kreisler] A shiver of warning had penetrated [her]177-bertha at this . But still [he]190-kreisler was [an artist]2123-an artist : it was natural — even inevitable — that [he]190-kreisler should compare [her]177-bertha arms to bananas . “ Oh ! [I]177-bertha hope [you]190-kreisler ’ve made a good drawing . May [I]177-bertha see ? ”[177-bertha] [She]177-bertha intended to emphasize the reason of this exposure . [He]190-kreisler had got up , and before [she]177-bertha knew what [he]190-kreisler was doing caught hold of [her]177-bertha above the elbow , chafing [her]177-bertha arm , saying : “ [You]190-kreisler have pins and needles , [Fraulein]232-fraulein vasek ? ”[190-kreisler] The “ Fraulein ”[190-kreisler] used here had some disquieting sound . [She]177-bertha drew [herself]177-bertha away , now serious and on the defence . “ No , thank [you]190-kreisler . Now [I]177-bertha will put [my]177-bertha blouse on , if [you]190-kreisler have finished . ”[177-bertha] [They]1214-they had looked at [each other]370-each other uncertainly for a moment , [he]190-kreisler with a flushed rather silly fixed smile . [She]177-bertha was afraid , somehow , to move away . “ Let [me]177-bertha rub [your]190-kreisler arm . ”[177-bertha] Then with the fury of [a man]2077-a man waking up to some insult , [he]190-kreisler had seized [her]177-bertha . [Her]177-bertha tardy words , furious struggling and all [her]177-bertha contradictory emotions disappeared in the whirlpool towards which [they]1214-they had , with a strange deliberateness and yet aimlessness , been steering . [He]190-kreisler was standing there at the window now as though wishing to pretend that [he]190-kreisler had done nothing ; [she]177-bertha “ had been dreaming things ”[177-bertha] merely . The long silence and monotony of the posing had prepared [her]177-bertha for the strangeness now . It had been the other extreme out of which [she]177-bertha had been flung and into which , at present , [she]177-bertha was again flung . [She]177-bertha saw side by side and unconnected the silent figure drawing [her]177-bertha and [the other one full of blindness and violence]1217-the other one full of blindness and violence . Then there were two other figures , one getting up from the chair , yawning , and [the present lazy one at the window]1218-the present lazy one at the window — four in all , that [she]177-bertha could not bring together somehow , each in a complete compartment of time of its own . It would be impossible to make [the present idle figure at the window]1219-the present idle figure at the window interest itself in these others . A loathsome , senseless event , of no meaning , naturally , to [that figure there]1220-that figure there . [It]1220-that figure there had quietly , indifferently , talked : it had drawn : it had suddenly flung itself upon [her]177-bertha and taken [her]177-bertha , and now it was standing idly there . [It]1220-that figure there could do all these things . [It]1220-that figure there appeared to [her]177-bertha in a series of precipitate states . [It]1220-that figure there resembled in this a switchback , rising slowly , in a steady insouciant way to the top of an incline , and then plunging suddenly down the other . Or [a mastiff]1221-a mastiff ’s head turning indolently for some seconds and then snapping at a fly , detached again the next moment . [Her]177-bertha fury and animal hostility did not last more than a few minutes . [She]177-bertha had come there , got what [she]177-bertha did not expect , and now must go away again . There was positively nothing more to be said to [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [She]177-bertha had spasmodic returns of raging . They did not pass [her]177-bertha dourly active mind . There never had been anything to say to [him]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler was a mad beast . [She]177-bertha now had to go away as though nothing had happened . It was nothing . After all what did it matter what became of [her]177-bertha now ? [Her]177-bertha body was of little importance — ghosts of romantic consolations here ! What was the good ( seeing what [she]177-bertha knew and everything ) of storming against [this man]416-this man * [She]177-bertha saw [herself]177-bertha coming [there]2057-there that afternoon , talking with amiable affectation of interest in [his]190-kreisler work , in [him]190-kreisler ( in [him]190-kreisler ! ) , sitting for [him]190-kreisler ; a long , uninterrupted stream of amiability , talk , suddenly the wild few minutes , then the present ridiculous hush . The moral , heavily , too heavily , driven in by [her]177-bertha no doubt German fate , found its mark in [her]177-bertha mind . What [Tarr]122-tarr laughed at [her]177-bertha for — that silly and vulgar mush , was the cause of all this . Well ! [She]177-bertha had done up [her]177-bertha hair ; [her]177-bertha hat was once more on [her]177-bertha head . [She]177-bertha went towards the door , [her]177-bertha face really haggard , inevitable consciousness of drama too in it . [Kreisler]190-kreisler turned round , went towards the door also , unlocked it , let [her]177-bertha pass without saying anything , and , waiting a moment , closed it indifferently again . [She]177-bertha was let out as [a workman]1224-a workman would have been , who had been there to mend a shutter or rectify a bolt . [Bertha]177-bertha made [her]177-bertha way [home]2396-home in a roundabout fashion to avoid the possibility of meeting [any one [she]177-bertha knew]1226-any one she knew . [The streets]2436-the streets were loftily ignorant of [her]177-bertha affairs . Thin walls dyked in affairs and happenings . Ha ha ! the importance of [our]1228-our actions ! Is it more than the kissing of the bricks ? [She]177-bertha came out with mixed feelings ; gratefulness for the enormous indifference and ignorance flowing all round [us]1228-our ; anger and astonishment at finding [herself]177-bertha walking away in this matter - of - fact manner ; suffering at the fact that the customary street scene would not mix with the obsession of [her]177-bertha late experience . No doubt Nature was secret enough . But not to tell this experience of [hers]177-bertha to [anybody]2075-anybody also would be shutting [her]177-bertha in with [Kreisler]190-kreisler , somehow for good . [She]177-bertha would never be able to escape the contamination of [that room of [his]190-kreisler]1230-that room of his . It was one of those things that in some form one should be able to tell . [She]177-bertha had a growing wish to make it known at once somewhere , in some shape . That is , at bottom , [she]177-bertha still was inclined to continue things — dreams , fancies , explanations , sacrifices . Would nothing cure [her]177-bertha ? The first feeling that this was finally the end of those things , that there was nothing further to be said or thought , was modified . [She]177-bertha did not definitely think of telling [any one]397-any one — the moral was wearing off more quickly than it should . But the thought of this simple , unsensational walking away and ending up of everything in connexion with [Kreisler]190-kreisler irked [her]177-bertha more and more . Anger revived spasmodically . [Kreisler]190-kreisler , by doing this , had made an absolute finishing with [Kreisler]190-kreisler perhaps impossible . There was [nobody]2080-nobody now in any sense on [her]177-bertha side , or on whose side [she]177-bertha could range [herself]177-bertha . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had added [himself]190-kreisler to the worrying list of [[her]177-bertha women friends]3325-her women friends , [Tarr]122-tarr , etc . , in a disgusting , dumbfounding way , the list of people preying on [her]177-bertha mind and pushing [her]177-bertha to perpetual fuss , all sorts of explicative , defiant , or other actions . [She]177-bertha had stuck [Kreisler]190-kreisler up as a “ cause ’ ’ against [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends . In a manner of [his]190-kreisler own , [he]190-kreisler had betrayed [her]177-bertha and placed [himself]190-kreisler beside [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends . In any case , [he]190-kreisler had carried out in the fullest fashion [their]944-her friends estimate of [him]190-kreisler . In being virtuous [a libelled man]3412-a libelled man can best attack [[his]3412-a libelled man enemies]3413-his enemies ; in being “[177-bertha] blackguardly , ” awaken a warmth of sympathy in corroborating [them]3413-his enemies . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had acted satanically for [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends . [She]177-bertha had seen [Elsa]266-elsa and [[her]266-elsa sister]2362-her sister twice that week , but [none of the others]3416-none of the others . Ungregariousness , keeping to [herself]177-bertha , was explained by indisposition . [Sorbert]270-sorbert was meant by this . [Her]177-bertha continued seeing of [Kreisler]190-kreisler was known to [all]3417-all now , and [she]177-bertha could imagine [their]944-her friends reception of that news . Now [she]177-bertha could hardly go on talking about [Kreisler]190-kreisler . This would at once be interpreted as “[177-bertha] something having happened . ” So more scandal against [her]177-bertha name . In examining likelihoods of the future [she]177-bertha concluded that [she]177-bertha would have to break still more with [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends , to make up for having to retire from [her]177-bertha Kreisler positions . To squash and counteract [their]944-her friends satisfaction [she]177-bertha must accentuate [her]177-bertha independence in [their]944-her friends direction to insult and contempt . The last half - hour of senseless outrage still took up all the canvas . Attempts to adjust [her]177-bertha mind to a situation containing such an element as this was difficult . What could be done with it ? It took up too much space . Everything must come back and be referred to that . [She]177-bertha wanted to tell this somewhere . This getting closed in with [Kreisler]190-kreisler — a survival , perhaps , of [her]177-bertha vivid fear of a little time before , when [he]190-kreisler had locked the door , and [she]177-bertha knew that resisting [him]190-kreisler would be useless — must be at all costs avoided . Who could [she]177-bertha tell ? [Clara]252-clara ? [Madame Vannier]256-madame vannier ? Once [home]2396-home , [she]177-bertha lay down and cried for some time , but without conjuring any of [her]177-bertha trouble . [Kreisler]190-kreisler seemed to have suddenly brought confusion everywhere . There was nothing that would quite fit in with that ridiculous , disgusting event . [He]190-kreisler had even , in the end , driven [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends out of [her]177-bertha mind , too . [She]177-bertha would have said nothing had [one]2062-one turned up then . Having left [Kreisler]190-kreisler so simply and undramatically worried [her]177-bertha . Something should have been done . There would have been the natural relief . But [her]177-bertha direct human feelings of revenge had been paralysed . [She]177-bertha thought of going back at once to [[his]190-kreisler room]2290-his room . [She]177-bertha could not begin life clearly again until something had been done against [him]190-kreisler , or in some way where [he]190-kreisler was . [He]190-kreisler had been treated by [her]177-bertha as [a cypher]3423-a cypher , as something vague to put up against [[her]177-bertha friends]944-her friends . All along for the last week [he]190-kreisler had been [a shadowy and actually unimportant figure]3425-a shadowy and actually unimportant figure . [He]190-kreisler had shown no consciousness of this . Rather dazed and machine - like [himself]190-kreisler , [Bertha]177-bertha had treated [him]190-kreisler as [she]177-bertha had found [him]190-kreisler . Suddenly , without any direct articulateness , [he]190-kreisler had revenged [himself]190-kreisler as a machine might do , in a nightmare . At a leap [he]190-kreisler was in the rigid foreground of [her]177-bertha life . [He]190-kreisler had absorbed all the rest in an immense clashing wink . But the moment following this “[177-bertha] desperateness ” [he]190-kreisler stood , abstracted , distant and baffling as before . It was difficult to realize [he]190-kreisler was there . [Tarr]122-tarr had been [the real central and absorbing figure]3426-the real central and absorbing figure all along , of course , but purposely veiled . [He]190-kreisler had been as really all - important , though to all appearance eliminated , as [Kreisler]190-kreisler had been of no importance , though propped up in the foreground . [Sorbert]270-sorbert at last could no longer be suppressed and kept from coming forward now in [her]177-bertha mind . But [his]190-kreisler presence , too , was perplexing . [She]177-bertha had become so used to regarding [him]190-kreisler , though seeing [him]190-kreisler daily , as [an uncertain and departing figure]3427-an uncertain and departing figure , that now [he]190-kreisler had really gone that did not make much difference . [His]190-kreisler proceedings , a carefully prepared anaesthesia for [himself]190-kreisler , had had its effect on [her]177-bertha as well , serving for both . The bell rang . [She]177-bertha stood up in one movement and stared towards the door . [She]177-bertha looked as though [she]177-bertha were waiting for the bell to ring two or three times to find resolution in that , one way or the other . It rang a second and third time . [She]177-bertha did not know how much persistence would draw [her]177-bertha to the door . But [she]177-bertha knew that any definite show of energy would overcome [her]177-bertha . Was it [Elsa]266-elsa ? [She]177-bertha had lighted [her]177-bertha lamp , and [[her]177-bertha visitor]3428-her visitor could therefore have seen that [she]177-bertha was at [home]2396-home . [Bertha]177-bertha went to the door at length with affected alacrity , in a pretence of not having heard the bell before , and opened it sharply . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was there . The opening of the door had been like the tearing of a characterless mask off a face . Had [he]190-kreisler not been looking at [her]177-bertha through it all the time ? There did not seem room for [them]3430-them where [they]3430-them were standing . [He]190-kreisler looked to [her]177-bertha like a great terrifying poster , cut out on the melodramatic stairway . [She]177-bertha remained stone - still in front of [him]190-kreisler with a pinched expression , as though about to burst out crying , and something deprecating in [her]177-bertha paralysed gesture , like [a child]499-a child . There was an analogy to a laugh struck dead on [a child]499-a child ’s face at a rebuff , souring and twisting all the features . Caricatured and enlarged to [her]177-bertha eyes , [she]177-bertha wanted to laugh for a moment . The surprise was complete . “[177-bertha] What , what---- ” [Her]177-bertha mind formed [his]190-kreisler image , rather like [a man compelled to photograph a ghost]3433-a man compelled to photograph a ghost . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ! It was as though [the world]2089-the world were made up of various animals , each of a different kind and physique even , and this were the animal [Kreisler]190-kreisler , whose name alone conjured up certain peculiar dangerous habits . [A wild world]3435-a wild world , not of [uniform men]3436-uniform men and [women]2149-women , but of very divergent and strangely living animals — [Kreisler]190-kreisler , [Lipmann]209-fraulein lipmann , [Tarr]122-tarr . [This man]416-this man , about to speak to [her]177-bertha again , on [the same square foot of ground]3439-the same square foot of ground with [her]177-bertha : [he]416-this man was not [an apparition from any remote Past]3440-an apparition from any remote past , but from a Past almost a Present , a half - hour old , much more startling . [He]416-this man had the too raw and too new colours of an image hardly digested , much less faded . When [she]177-bertha had last seen [him]416-this man [she]177-bertha had been still in the sphere of an intense agitation . [His]416-this man ominous and sudden appearance , so hardly out of that , seemed to swallow up the space and time in between . It was like the chilly return of a circling storm . [She]177-bertha had imagined that it depended on [her]177-bertha to see [him]416-this man or not , that [he]416-this man was pensive except when persistently approached . But here [he]416-this man was , this time , at last , following ! [He]416-this man took a step forward , [[her]177-bertha room]890-her room evidently [his]416-this man destination . “[177-bertha] Mistvich ! ” [Bertha]177-bertha said , at the same time retreating into the passage - way . — “[177-bertha] Go ! ” Got into [the room]2366-the room , [he]416-this man did not seem to know what next to do . So far [he]416-this man had been evidently quite clear as to [his]416-this man purpose . [He]416-this man had been feeling the same necessity as [her]177-bertha — [he]416-this man , to see [[his]416-this man victim]2476-his victim . [He]416-this man had not known what [he]416-this man wanted with [her]177-bertha , but the obvious pretext and road for the satisfaction of this impulse was the seeking of pardon . [She]177-bertha had a moment before felt that [she]177-bertha must see [him]416-this man again , at once , before going further with [her]177-bertha life . — [He]416-this man , more vague but more energetic , had come at the end of twenty minutes . [They]3444-they were now together , quite tongue - tied . Once [he]416-this man was there , the pretext appeared unnecessary . The real reason might be found . The real reason no doubt was an intuition not to lose [her]177-bertha absolutely , the wisdom of [his]416-this man appetite counselling . [He]416-this man stood leaning on [his]416-this man cane , and staring in front of [him]416-this man . — [Bertha]177-bertha stood quite still , as [she]177-bertha would sometimes do when a wasp entered [the room]2366-the room , waiting to see if it would blunder about and then fly out again . [He]416-this man was a dangerous animal , [he]416-this man had got in [there]2057-there , and might in the same manner go off again in a minute or two . Now was the chance [she]177-bertha had been fretting for to wipe out in some way what had happened ; — not to seem , anyhow , to have taken it all as a matter of course . — But it was too convenient . [She]177-bertha had never reckoned on [his]416-this man actually coming and putting [himself]416-this man at [her]177-bertha disposition in this way . [He]416-this man stood there without saying anything , just as though [he]416-this man had been sent for and it were for [her]177-bertha to speak . — [She]177-bertha would have been inclined to send [him]416-this man back to [[his]416-this man room]2290-his room , and then , perhaps , go to [him]416-this man . Constantly on the point of “[177-bertha] throwing [him]1234-him out , ” as [her]177-bertha energetic German idiom put it , it yet evidently would then , in the first place , be the same as before . Secondly , [she]177-bertha was a good deal intimidated by [his]416-this man unexplained presence . [She]177-bertha had a curiosity about [him]416-this man , — curiosity rather as to how what had happened to [her]177-bertha could be straightened out or a little sense in some way got into it . The material of this modification was in [him]416-this man and only there . — [She]177-bertha hated [him]416-this man thoroughly now . But this new and distinct feeling gave [him]416-this man at last some reality . — [Her]177-bertha way of regarding [Kreisler]190-kreisler was that of [the girl]540-the girl [a man]2077-a man “[177-bertha] has got into trouble , ” and to whom [she]177-bertha looks to get [her]177-bertha out of it . So [she]177-bertha stood , anxious as to what [he]416-this man might have . come there to do , gradually settling down into a “[177-bertha] proud and silent indignation , ” behind which [her]177-bertha curiosity might wait and see what would transpire . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had at length , having allowed [her]177-bertha to stay unexplained by [his]416-this man side for a week or so , divined some complication . [Her]177-bertha case might possibly be similar to [his]416-this man ? [She]177-bertha did not interest [him]416-this man any the more for this . But communication would not be , perhaps , absolutely useless . [His]416-this man only possibility of action at present was to act violently , in gusts . [He]416-this man did not know , when [he]416-this man began an action , whether [he]416-this man would be able to go through with it . — [He]416-this man could not now prevail upon [himself]416-this man to go through the senseless form of apology or anything else . [He]416-this man had got [there]2057-there , that would have to be sufficient . But the situation for [Bertha]177-bertha became urgent , too . The difficulty was that there was nothing adequate to be done , that [she]177-bertha could think of , in any way in proportion to the enormity of the occasion . Yet , to escape from the memory of [Kreisler]190-kreisler , what had happened must be wiped out , checkmated , by some action . [She]177-bertha was still stunned and overwhelmed with the normal feminine feelings proper to the case . But yet even here there was an irregularity . Another source of infinite discomfort was that [she]177-bertha could not even feel , as [she]177-bertha should normally , the extent of the outrage , although it was evident enough . [She]177-bertha had an hysterical inclination , in waves of astonishment , to accept its paradoxical and persistent appearance . This appearance [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s peculiar manner , [her]177-bertha own present mind and the unexampled circumstances gave it . It was nothing , — a bagatelle ! — Pooh ! it is nothing , after all ! How can it be of any importance , seeing that---- ? — This was one of those things that seem to have got into the category of waking by mistake . It had nothing to do with life ’s context . And yet it was life . [She]177-bertha must deal with it . [She]177-bertha had wished to free [Sorbert]270-sorbert . That had been the beginning of all this . It was with idea of sacrifice in [her]177-bertha mind that [she]177-bertha had committed the first folly on [the boulevard]426-the boulevard . — Well , [she]177-bertha had succeeded . What did [Kreisler]190-kreisler mean ? — At last [his]190-kreisler significance was as clear as daylight . [He]190-kreisler meant always and everywhere merely that [she]177-bertha could never see [Tarr]122-tarr again ! [She]177-bertha now faced [him]190-kreisler with fresh strength , [her]177-bertha face illuminated with happy tragic resolve . — Supposing [she]177-bertha had given [herself]177-bertha to [a man]2077-a man to compass this sacrifice ? As it was , everything , except the hatefulness and violence of the act , had been spared [her]177-bertha . And in telling [Sorbert]270-sorbert that there was something , now , between [them]3453-them , [she]177-bertha had been driven to something , [she]177-bertha would be nobly lying , and turning an involuntary act into a voluntary one . [She]177-bertha could now , too , be tragically forbearing even with [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler , [I]1235-i think [I]1235-i have waited long enough . Will [you]1236-you please leave [[my]1235-i room]3454-my room ? ”[1235-i] [He]1235-i stirred gently like a heavy flower in a light current of wind . But [he]1235-i turned towards [her]1236-you and said : “ [I]1235-i do n’t know what to say to [you]1236-you . — Is there nothing [I]1235-i can do to make up to [you]1236-you — ? [I]1235-i shall go and shoot [myself]1235-i , [Fraulein]209-fraulein lipmann ! [I]1235-i can not stand the thought of what [I]1235-i have done [I]1235-i ”[1235-i] This was perplexing and made [her]1236-you angry . [He]1235-i appeared to possess a genius for making things complicated and more difficult . “ All [I]1235-i ask [you]1236-you is to go . That will be the best thing [you]1236-you can do for [me]1235-i . ”[1235-i] ’ “ [Fraulein]209-fraulein lipmann , [I]1235-i ca n’t ! — Do listen to [me]1235-i for a moment . — [I]1235-i can not even refer to what has happened without insult in the mere direction of the words . — [I]1235-i am mad — mad — mad ! — [You]1236-you have showed [yourself]1236-you [a good friend to [me]1235-i]3455-a good friend to me . And that is the way [I]1235-i repay [you]1236-you ! Were [you]1236-you anywhere but here and unprotected , there would be [a man]2077-a man to answer to for this outrage . [I]1235-i will be [that man]1070-that man [myself]1235-i ! — [I]1235-i come to ask [your]1236-you permission ! ”[1235-i] [His]1237-his appetite , waking afresh , was the only directing thing in [Kreisler]190-kreisler at present . With hypocritical — almost palpably mock — eloquence , [he]1237-his was serving that . This talk alone would have been of little use or consequence to [Bertha]177-bertha . But coming in conjunction with [her]177-bertha new independent reinforcement , which alone would have been enough to shape things to a specious ending , it was in a way effective . — The new contradiction and struggle in [her]177-bertha mind was between [her]177-bertha natural aversion for [Kreisler]190-kreisler now and [her]177-bertha feeling of clemency towards [him]190-kreisler in [his]190-kreisler now beautiful usefulness . [She]177-bertha was very dignified , wise , and clement when [she]177-bertha answered : “ Let [us]3458-us leave all that , if [you]190-kreisler please . — It was [my]177-bertha fault . — [I]177-bertha should have known better what [I]177-bertha was doing . [You]190-kreisler must have been mad , as [you]190-kreisler say . But if [you]190-kreisler wish to show [yourself]190-kreisler [a gentleman]3388-a gentleman now , the only obvious thing is to go away , as [I]177-bertha have said , and not to molest or remind [me]177-bertha any further of what has passed . There is nothing more to say , is there ? — Go now , please ! ”[177-bertha] [Kreisler]190-kreisler flung [himself]190-kreisler on [his]190-kreisler knees , and seized [her]177-bertha hand , [she]177-bertha receiving this with astonished , questioning protestation . “ [Fraulein]209-fraulein lipmann , [you]209-fraulein lipmann are [an angel]3460-an angel ! [Bertha]177-bertha was distinctly affected by this demonstration . It put a last brilliant light of grateful confusion on all the emotions emanating from [Kreisler]190-kreisler . The sort of notion [he]190-kreisler had evoked in parting that [they]1242-they had been doing something splendid together — a lifesaving , a heroism — found a hospitable ground in [her]177-bertha spirit . Taking everything together , things had been miraculously turned round . [Her]177-bertha late blackness of depression and perplexity now merged in steadily growing relieved exaltation . [Tarr]122-tarr was gregarious in the sense that usually [he]122-tarr liked [[his]122-tarr room and [some familiar streets]3479-some familiar streets with [their]3479-some familiar streets traces of [familiar men]3480-familiar men]3478-his room and some familiar streets with their traces of familiar men . To be alone was essentially a nondescript , lowered , and unreal state for [him]122-tarr . The following morning [Tarr]122-tarr woke , [his]122-tarr legs rather cramped and tired , and not thoroughly rested . But as soon as [he]122-tarr was up , work came quite easily . [He]122-tarr got [his]122-tarr paints out , and without beginning on [his]122-tarr principal canvas , took up a new and smaller one by way of diversion . [He]122-tarr squared up [his]122-tarr canvas on the floor with a walking - stick , and fixed it on the easel . To get a threadlike edge a pencil had to be sharpened several times . By the end of the afternoon [he]122-tarr had got a witty pastiche on the way . Two colours principally had been used , mixed in piles on two palettes : a smoky , bilious saffron , and a pale transparent lead . The significance of the thing depended first on the psychology of the pulpy limbs , [strained dancers]3482-strained dancers ’ attitudes and empty faces ; secondly , the two colours and the simple yet contorted curves . [He]122-tarr sat for hours in the fatiguing evening among a score of [relief ships]3487-relief ships or [pleasure boats]3488-pleasure boats , hesitating , but finally rejecting relief or pleasure . And the next day it was the same thing . Meantime [his]122-tarr work progressed . But to escape these persecutions [he]122-tarr worked excessively . [His]122-tarr eyes began to prick , and on the sixth day [he]122-tarr woke up with a headache . [He]122-tarr was sick and unable to work . [Tarr]122-tarr decided [he]122-tarr had been mistaken in remaining in [Paris]1-paris . The fascination of the omnibuses bound for [the Rive gauche]3489-the rive gauche was almost irresistible . [Destiny]271-destiny had granted [him]122-tarr the necessary resolution to break . [He]122-tarr could have gone away — anywhere , even . [His]122-tarr will had then offered [him]122-tarr a free ticket , as it were , to [any end of [the earth]2188-the earth]3490-any end of the earth . A [MEGRIM OF HUMOUR]180-humour Some days later , in the evening , [Tarr]122-tarr was to be found in [a strange place]3502-a strange place . [He]122-tarr now had a closer explanation of [his]122-tarr attachment to stupidity than [he]122-tarr had been able to give [Lowndes]223-lowndes . It was that [[his]122-tarr artist]3527-his artist ’s asceticism could not support anything more serious than such [an elementary rival]3528-an elementary rival , and , when sex was in the ascendant , it turned [his]122-tarr eyes away from the highest beauty and dulled the extremities of [his]122-tarr senses , so that [he]122-tarr had nothing but rudimentary inclinations left . But in the interests of [his]122-tarr animalism [he]122-tarr was turning to betray [the artist in [him]122-tarr]3529-the artist in him . For [he]122-tarr had been saying to [himself]122-tarr lately that [a more suitable lady - companion]3530-a more suitable lady - companion must be found ; one , that is , [he]122-tarr need not be ashamed of . [He]122-tarr felt that the time had arrived for Life to come in for some of the benefits of Consciousness . [Anastasya]216-anastasya ’s beauty , bangles , and good sense were the very thing . Despite [himself]122-tarr , [Sorbert]270-sorbert was dragged out of [his]122-tarr luxury of reminiscence without knowing it , and began discriminating between the Bertha enjoyment felt through the pungent German medium of [[her]3527-his artist friends]944-her friends , and this novel sensation . Yet this sensation was an intruder . It was as though [a man]2077-a man having wandered sentimentally along [an abandoned route]3533-an abandoned route , [a tactless and gushing acquaintance]3534-a tactless and gushing acquaintance had been discovered in unlikely possession . [I]0-i was born in [Berlin]29-berlin and brought up in [America]3-america . [We]1289-we live in [Dresden]80-dresden , ” [she]3527-his artist answered . [He]122-tarr did this with sleepy gratification . All was well . Relations with [her]177-bertha were now , it must be clear , substantially at an end . At the gate leading to [[her]3578-her house]1162-her house [he]270-sorbert left [her]3578-her . Immediately afterwards , walking towards [the terminus of [the Montmartre omnibus]3587-the montmartre omnibus]3586-the terminus of the montmartre omnibus , [he]270-sorbert realized that [he]270-sorbert was well in the path that led away , as [he]270-sorbert had not done while still with [her]3578-her . [He]270-sorbert was glad and sorry , doing homage to [her]3578-her and the future together . [She]3578-her had a fascination as [a moribund Bertha]3588-a moribund bertha . The immobile short sunset of [their]3589-their friendship should be enjoyed . A rich throwing up and congesting of souvenirs on this threshold were all the better for the weak and silly sun . Oh what a delightful , imperturbable clockwork orb ! The next day [he]270-sorbert again made [his]270-sorbert way across [Paris]1-paris from [Montmartre]78-montmartre at a rather earlier hour . [He]270-sorbert invited [himself]270-sorbert to tea with [her]3578-her . [They]3589-their talked as though posing for [their]3589-their late personalities . [He]270-sorbert took up deliberately one or two controversial o points . In a spirit of superfluous courtesy [he]270-sorbert went back to the subject of several of [their]3589-their old typical disputes , and argued against [himself]270-sorbert . All [their]3589-their difficulties seemed swept away in a relaxed humid atmosphere , most painful and disagreeable to [her]3578-her . [He]270-sorbert agreed entirely with [her]3578-her , now agreeing no longer meant anything ! But the key was elsewhere . Enjoyment of and acquiescence in everything Berthaesque and [Teutonic]83-teutonic was where it was to be found . Just as now [he]270-sorbert went to see [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s very German friends]3590-bertha ’s very german friends , and said “[0-i] How delightful ” to [himself]270-sorbert , so [he]270-sorbert appeared to be resolved to come back for a week or two and to admire everything formerly [he]270-sorbert had found most irritating in [Bertha]177-bertha [herself]177-bertha . Before retiring definitely , like [a man who hears that the rind of the fruit [he]270-sorbert has just been eating]3591-a man who hears that the rind of the fruit he has just been eating is good , and comes back to [his]270-sorbert plate to devour the part [he]270-sorbert had discarded , [Tarr]122-tarr returned to have a last tankard of German beer . Or still nearer the figure , [his]270-sorbert claim in [the unexceptionable part of [her]3578-her]3592-the unexceptionable part of her now lapsed , [he]270-sorbert had returned demanding to be allowed to live just a little while longer on [the absurd and disagreeable section]3593-the absurd and disagreeable section . [Bertha]177-bertha suffered , on [her]177-bertha side , more than all the rest of the time [she]177-bertha had spent with [him]122-tarr put together . To tell the whole [Kreisler]190-kreisler story might lead to a fight . It was too late now . [She]177-bertha could not , [she]177-bertha felt , in honour , seek to re - entangle [Tarr]122-tarr , nor could [she]177-bertha disown [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [She]177-bertha had been found with [Kreisler]190-kreisler : [she]177-bertha had no means of keeping [him]190-kreisler away for good . An attempt at suppressing [him]190-kreisler might produce any result . Should [she]177-bertha have been able , or desired to resume [her]177-bertha relations with [Tarr]122-tarr , [Kreisler]190-kreisler would not have left [him]190-kreisler uninformed of things that had happened , shown in the most uncongenial light . If left alone , and not driven away like a dog , [he]190-kreisler might gradually quiet down and disappear . [Sorbert]270-sorbert would be gone , too , by that time ! [Their]3594-their grand , never - to - be - forgotten friendship was ending in shabby shallows . [Tarr]122-tarr had the best role , and did not deserve it . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was [the implacable remote creditor of the situation]3595-the implacable remote creditor of the situation . CHAPTER IV [Tarr]122-tarr left [Bertha]177-bertha punctually at seven . [She]177-bertha looked very ill . [He]122-tarr resolved not to go [there]2057-there any more . [He]122-tarr felt upset . [Lejeune]222-lejeune ’s , when [he]122-tarr got [there]2057-there , was full of Americans . It was like having dinner among a lot of [canny children]3598-canny children . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was not [there]2057-there . [He]122-tarr went on a hunt for [him]190-kreisler afterwards , and r n [him]190-kreisler to earth at [the Cafe de l’Aigle]3600-the cafe de l’aigle . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was not cordial . [He]190-kreisler emitted sounds of surprise , shuffled [his]190-kreisler feet and blinked . But [Tarr]122-tarr sat down in front of [him]190-kreisler on [his]122-tarr own initiative . Then [Kreisler]190-kreisler , calling [the garçon]2208-the garçon , offered [him]190-kreisler a drink . Afterwards [he]122-tarr settled down to contemplate [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s Englishman]3602-bertha ’s englishman , and await developments . [He]122-tarr was always rather softer with people with whom [he]122-tarr could converse in [his]122-tarr own harsh tongue . The causes at the root of [Tarr]122-tarr ’s present thrusting of [himself]122-tarr upon [Kreisler]190-kreisler were the same as [his]122-tarr later visits at [the Lipmann ’s]3603-the lipmann ’s . A sort of bath of [Germans]128-germans was [his]190-kreisler prescription for [himself]190-kreisler , a voluptuous immersion . To heighten the effect , [he]190-kreisler was being German [himself]190-kreisler : being [Bertha]177-bertha as well . But [he]190-kreisler was more German than [the Germans]2710-the germans . Many aspects of [his]190-kreisler conduct were so un - German that [Kreisler]190-kreisler did not recognize the portrait or hail [him]190-kreisler as [a fellow]3605-a fellow . [Successive lovers of [a certain woman fraternizing]3607-a certain woman fraternizing]3606-successive lovers of a certain woman fraternizing ; [[husbands]3608-husbands hobnobbing with [[their]3608-husbands wives]2127-their wives ’ lovers]3609-husbands hobnobbing with their wives ’ lovers or [husbands]3608-husbands of [their]3608-husbands unmarried days is a commonplace of German or Scandinavian society . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had not returned to [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s]2348-bertha ’s . [He]190-kreisler was too lazy to plan conscientiously . But [he]190-kreisler concluded that [she]177-bertha had better be given scope for anything the return of [Tarr]122-tarr might suggest . [He]190-kreisler , [Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler , might be supposed no longer to exist . [His]190-kreisler mind was working up again for some truculent action . [Tarr]122-tarr was no obstacle . [He]122-tarr would just walk through [Tarr]122-tarr like a ghost when [he]122-tarr saw fit to “[0-i] advance ” again . “[1319-you] [You]1319-you met [Lowndes]223-lowndes in [Rome]43-rome , did n’t [you]1319-you 1 ” [Tarr]122-tarr asked [him]1319-you . [Kreisler]190-kreisler nodded . “[1319-you] Have [you]1319-you seen [Fraulein Lunken]160-fraulein lunken to - day ? ” “[1319-you] No . ” As [Tarr]122-tarr was coming to the point [Kreisler]190-kreisler condescended to speak : “[1319-you] [I]0-i shall see [her]160-fraulein lunken to - morrow morning . ” A space for protest or comment seemed to be left after this sentence , in [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s still very “[0-i] speaking ” expression . [Tarr]122-tarr smiled at the tone of this piece of information . [Kreisler]190-kreisler at once grinned , mockingly , in return . “[1319-you] [You]1319-you can get out of [your]1319-you head any idea that [I]0-i have turned up to interfere with [your]1319-you proceedings , ” [Tarr]122-tarr then said . “[0-i] Affairs lie entirely between [Fraulein Lunken]160-fraulein lunken and [yourself]1319-you . ” [Kreisler]190-kreisler met this assurance truculently . “[1319-you] [You]1319-you could not interfere with [my]0-i proceedings . [I]0-i do what [I]0-i want to do in this life ! ” “[0-i] How splendid . [Wunderbar]285-wunderbar ! [I]0-i admire [you]285-wunderbar ! ” “[0-i] [Your]285-wunderbar admiration is not asked for ! ” “[285-wunderbar] It leaps up involuntarily ! Prosit ! But [I]0-i did not mean , [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler , that [my]0-i desire to interfere , had such desire existed , would have been tolerated . Oh , no ! [I]0-i meant that no such desire existing , [we]1320-we had no cause for quarrel . Prosit ! ” [Tarr]122-tarr again raised [his]122-tarr glass expectantly and coaxingly , peering steadily at the German . [He]122-tarr said , “[0-i] Prosit ” as [he]122-tarr would have said , “[0-i] Peep - oh ! ” “[0-i] Prosit ! ” [Kreisler]190-kreisler answered with alarming suddenness , and an alarming diabolical smile . “[0-i] Prosit ! ” . with finality . [He]0-i put [his]0-i glass down . “[0-i] That is all right . [I]0-i have no desire , ” [he]0-i wiped and struck up [his]0-i moustaches , “[285-wunderbar] to quarrel with [anybody]2075-anybody . [I]0-i wish to be left alone . That is all . ” “[285-wunderbar] To be left alone to enjoy [your]285-wunderbar friendship with [Bertha]177-bertha — that is [your]285-wunderbar meaning ? Am [I]0-i not right ? [I]0-i see . ” “[0-i] That is [my]0-i business . [I]0-i wish to be left alone . ” “[0-i] Of course it ’s [your]285-wunderbar business , [[my]0-i dear chap]655-my dear chap . Have another drink ! ” [He]0-i called the garçon . [Kreisler]190-kreisler agreed to another drink . Why was [this Englishman]283-the englishman sitting there and talking to [him]190-kreisler ? It was in the German style and yet it was n’t . Was [Kreisler]190-kreisler to be shifted , was [he]190-kreisler meant to go ? Had the task of doing this been put on [Bertha]177-bertha ’s shoulders ? Had [Tarr]122-tarr come there to ask [him]190-kreisler , or in the hope that [he]190-kreisler would volunteer a promise , never to see [Bertha]177-bertha again ? On the other hand , was [he]190-kreisler being approached by [Tarr]122-tarr in the capacity of [an old friend of [Bertha]177-bertha ’s]3613-an old friend of bertha ’s , or in [her]177-bertha interests or at [her]177-bertha instigation ? With frowning impatience [he]190-kreisler bent forward quickly once or twice , asking [Tarr]122-tarr to repeat some remark . [Tarr]122-tarr ’s German was not good . Several glasses of beer , and [Kreisler]190-kreisler became engagingly expansive . ‘ ‘ Have [you]190-kreisler ever been to [England]25-england ? ’ ’ [Tarr]122-tarr asked [him]190-kreisler . “[0-i] [England]25-england ? — No — [I]0-i should like to go [there]2057-there ! [They]187-the french are [all actors]1325-all actors . ” . “[0-i] [You]0-i should go to [London]7-london . ” “[0-i] Ah , to [London]7-london . Yes , [I]0-i should go to [London]7-london ! Is it expensive ? ” “[187-the french] The journey ? ” “[187-the french] Well , life [there]2057-there . Dearer than it is here , [I]0-i have been told . ” [Kreisler]190-kreisler forgot [his]190-kreisler circumstances for the moment . [The Englishman]283-the englishman seemed to have hit on a means of escape for [him]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler had never thought of [England]25-england ! A hazy notion of [its]25-england untold wealth made it easier for [him]190-kreisler to put aside momentarily the fact of [his]190-kreisler tottering finances . Perhaps [this Englishman]3614-this englishman had been sent [him]190-kreisler by [the Schicksal]287-the schicksal . [He]190-kreisler had always got on well with [Englishmen]1052-englishmen ! The peculiar notion then crossed [his]190-kreisler mind that [Tarr]122-tarr perhaps wanted to get [him]190-kreisler out of [Paris]1-paris , and had come to make [him]190-kreisler some offer of hospitality in [England]25-england . [He]190-kreisler must not appear too anxious to go [there]2057-there . “[1329-they] [They]1329-they say , though , things have changed . The last time [I]0-i was [there]2057-there [it]25-england had improved so much that [I]0-i thought of stopping . Merry [England]25-england is foutu ! There wo n’t be [a regular Pub]1331-a regular pub . in [the whole country]1332-the whole country in fifty years . Art will flourish ! There ’s not a real gipsy left in [the country]2251-the country . The sham art - ones are dwindling ! ” “[288-the zigeuner] Are [the Zigeuner]288-the zigeuner disappearing ? ” “[288-the zigeuner] Je vous crois ! [Kreisler]190-kreisler was very tickled with the idea of [England]25-england . “[1335-english women] [English women]1335-english women — what are [they]1335-english women like ? ” [Kreisler]190-kreisler then asked with a grin . [Their]3617-they relations made this subject delightfully delicate and yet , [Kreisler]190-kreisler thought , very natural . [This Englishman]3614-this englishman was evidently a description of [pander]3619-pander , and no doubt [he]3614-this englishman would be as inclined to be hospitable with [[his]3614-this englishman countrywomen]3620-his countrywomen in the abstract as with [[his]3614-this englishman late fiancee]3621-his late fiancee in material detail . “[1335-english women] [A friend of [mine]0-i who had been [there]2057-there]1336-a friend of mine who had been there told [me]0-i [they]1335-english women were very ‘ pretty ’ ” — [he]0-i pronounced the English word with mincing slowness and mischievous interrogation marks in [his]0-i distorted face . “[616-your friend] [[Your]0-i friend]616-your friend did not exaggerate . [All Germans]1348-all germans do ! ” “[128-germans] [All Germans]128-germans lie ? ” “[128-germans] ‘ Deutsches Volk — [the folk that deceives]1349-the folk that deceives ! ’ is [[your]0-i philosopher]1350-your philosopher [Nietzsche]289-nietzsche ’s account of the origin of the word Deutsch . ” ' [Kreisler]190-kreisler sulked a moment till [he]190-kreisler had recovered . “[289-nietzsche] No . [I]0-i have the proofs of it ! ” “[0-i] In what way has [she]177-bertha tricked [me]0-i ? ” “[177-bertha] In the way that [women]2149-women always trick [men]518-men ! ” With resentment partly and with hard picturesque levity [Kreisler]190-kreisler met [Tarr]122-tarr ’s discourse . [This solitary drinker]3622-this solitary drinker , particularly shabby , who could be “[177-bertha] dismissed ” so easily , whom [Bertha]177-bertha with accents of sincerity , “[177-bertha] hated , hated ! ” was so different to the sort of man that [Tarr]122-tarr expected might attract [her]177-bertha , that [he]190-kreisler began to wonder . A certain satisfaction accompanied these observations . For that week [he]122-tarr saw [Kreisler]190-kreisler nearly every day . [A partie à trois]3623-a partie à trois then began . [Bertha]177-bertha ( whom [Tarr]122-tarr saw constantly too ) did not actually refuse admittance to [Kreisler]190-kreisler ( although [he]190-kreisler usually had first to knock a good many times ) , yet [she]177-bertha prayed [him]190-kreisler repeatedly not to come any more . Standing always in a drooping and desperate condition before [him]190-kreisler , [she]177-bertha did [her]177-bertha best to avert a new outburst on [his]190-kreisler part . [She]177-bertha sought to mollify [him]190-kreisler as much as was consistent with the most absolute refusal . [Tarr]122-tarr , unaware of how things actually stood , seconded [[his]122-tarr successor]3624-his successor . [Kreisler]190-kreisler , on [his]122-tarr side , was rendered obstinate by [her]177-bertha often tearful refusal to have anything more whatever to do with [him]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler had come to regard [Tarr]122-tarr as part of [Bertha]177-bertha , a sort of masculine extension of [her]177-bertha . At the café [he]190-kreisler would look out for [him]122-tarr , and drink deeply in [his]190-kreisler presence . “[177-bertha] [I]0-i will have [her]1366-her . [I]0-i will have [her]1366-her ! ” [he]0-i once shouted towards the end of the evening , springing up and calling loudly for the garçon . It was all [Tarr]122-tarr could do to prevent [him]122-tarr from going , with assurances of intercession . ' [His]190-kreisler suspicions of [Tarr]122-tarr at last awoke once more . What was the meaning of this Englishman always there ? What was [he]122-tarr there for ? If it had not been for [him]122-tarr , several times [he]122-tarr would have rushed off and had [his]122-tarr way . But [he]122-tarr was always there between [them]3625-them . And in secret , too , probably , and away from [him]122-tarr — [Kreisler]190-kreisler — [he]122-tarr was working on [Bertha]177-bertha ’s feelings , and preventing [her]177-bertha from seeing [him]122-tarr . [Tarr]122-tarr was anyhow the obstacle . And yet there [he]122-tarr was , talking and palavering , and offering to act as [an intermediary]3626-an intermediary , and preventing [him]122-tarr from acting . [He]122-tarr alone was the obstacle , and yet [he]122-tarr talked as though [he]122-tarr were nothing to do with it , or at the most [a casually interested third party]3627-a casually interested third party . That is how [Kreisler]190-kreisler felt on [his]190-kreisler way [home]2396-home after having drunk a good deal . But so long as [Tarr]122-tarr paid for drinks [he]122-tarr staved [him]122-tarr off [[his]122-tarr prey]3629-his prey . [Tarr]122-tarr soon regretted this last anti - climax stage of [his]122-tarr adventure . [He]122-tarr would have left [Kreisler]190-kreisler alone in future , but [he]122-tarr felt that by frequenting [him]190-kreisler [he]122-tarr could save [Bertha]177-bertha from something disagreeable . With disquiet and misgiving every night now [he]122-tarr sat in front of [[his]122-tarr Prussian friend]3630-his prussian friend . [He]122-tarr watched [him]3630-his prussian friend gradually imbibing enough spirits to work [him]3630-his prussian friend up to [his]3630-his prussian friend pitch of characteristic madness . “[1366-her] After all , let [us]1367-us hear really what it all means , [your]1368-you Kreisler stunt , and [Kreisler]190-kreisler ? ” [he]122-tarr said to [her]1368-you four or five days after [his]122-tarr reappearance . “[190-kreisler] Do [you]1368-you know that [I]0-i act as a dam , or rather a dyke , to [his]190-kreisler outrageous flood of liquorous spirits every night ? Only [my]0-i insignificant form is between [you]1368-you and destruction , or [you]1368-you and [a very unpleasant Kreisler]1369-a very unpleasant kreisler , at any rate . — Have [you]1368-you seen [him]190-kreisler when [he]190-kreisler ’s drunk ? — What , after all , does [Kreisler]190-kreisler mean ? Satisfy [my]0-i curiosity . ” [Bertha]177-bertha shuddered and looked at [him]122-tarr with dramatically wide - open eyes , as though there were no answer . “[190-kreisler] It ’s nothing , [Sorbert]270-sorbert , nothing , ” [she]177-bertha said , as though [Kreisler]190-kreisler were the bubonic plague and [she]177-bertha were making light of it . Yet a protest had to be made . [He]122-tarr had rather neglected the coincidence of [his]122-tarr arrival and [Bertha]177-bertha ’s refusal to see [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [He]122-tarr must avoid finding [himself]122-tarr manoeuvred into appearing the cause . [A tranquil and sentimental revenant]3631-a tranquil and sentimental revenant was the rôle [he]122-tarr had chosen . Up to a point [he]122-tarr encouraged [Bertha]177-bertha to see [[his]122-tarr boon companion]3632-his boon companion and relax [her]177-bertha sudden exclusiveness . [He]122-tarr hesitated to carry out thoroughly [his]122-tarr part of go - between and reconciler . At length [he]122-tarr began to make inquiries . After all , to have to hold back [[his]122-tarr successor]3624-his successor to the favours of [a lady]3634-a lady , from going and seizing those rights ( presumably temporarily denied [him]122-tarr ) , was a strange situation . At any moment now it seemed likely that [Kreisler]190-kreisler would turn on [him]122-tarr . This would simplify matters . Better leave [lovers]3635-lovers to fight out [their]3635-lovers own quarrels and not take up the ungrateful rôle of [interferer]3636-interferer and [voluntary policeman]3637-voluntary policeman . All [his]122-tarr retrospective pleasure was being spoilt . But [he]122-tarr was committed to remain there for the present . To get over [his]122-tarr sensation of dupe , [he]122-tarr was more sociable with [Kreisler]190-kreisler than [he]122-tarr felt . [The German]3638-the german interpreted this as an hypocrisy . [His]122-tarr contempt and suspicion of [the peculiar revenant]3639-the peculiar revenant grew . [Bertha]177-bertha was tempted to explain , in as dramatic a manner as possible , the situation to [Tarr]122-tarr . But [she]177-bertha hesitated always because [she]177-bertha thought it would lead to a fight . It is alive , and nationality is a portion of actuality . ” “[1446-it] But is the best work always ‘ actual ’ and up to date ? ” “[1446-it] It always has that appearance . [It]1446-it ’s manners are perfect . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am not so sure that manners can not be overdone . A personal code is as good as the current code . ” “[1446-it] The point seems to [me]0-i to be , in that connexion , that manners are not very important . [You]1437-you use them as [you]1437-you use coins . ” “[1437-you] [The most effectual men]1447-the most effectual men have always been those whose notions were diametrically opposed to those of [their]1447-the most effectual men time , ” [she]3704-she said carefully . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t think that is so ; except in so far as [all effectual men]1448-all effectual men are always [the enemies of every time]1449-the enemies of every time . [They]1448-all effectual men were out of place . “[1452-you] [Your]1452-you philosophy reminds [me]0-i of [Jean - Jacques]213-jeanne , ” [she]1452-you said . “[213-jeanne] Does it ? How do [you]1452-you arrive at that conclusion ? ” “[1452-you] Well , [your]1452-you hostility to a tidy rabble , and preference for a rough and uncultivated bed to build on brings to mind ‘ wild nature ’ and the doctrine of [the natural man]1453-the natural man . [You]1452-you want a human landscape similar to [Jean - Jacques]213-jeanne ’ rocks and water falls . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i see what [you]1452-you mean . But [I]0-i also notice that the . temper of [my]0-i theories is the exact opposite of [Jean - Jacques]213-jeanne ’ . — [He]1452-you raved over and poetized [his]1452-you wild nature and naturalness generally and put it forward as an ideal . [My]0-i point of view is that it is a question of expediency only . [I]0-i do not for a moment sentimentalize crudeness . [I]0-i maintain that that crude and unformed bed , or backing , is absolutely essential to maximum fineness ; just as crudity in [an individual]435-an individual ’s composition is necessary for [him]435-an individual to be able to create . There is no more absolute value in stupidity and formlessness than there is in dung . But they are just as necessary . The conditions of creation and of life disgust [me]0-i . The birth of a work of art is as dirty as that of [a baby]1455-a baby . But [I]0-i consider that [my]0-i most irremediable follies have come from fastidiousness ; not the other thing . If [you]1452-you are going to work or perform , [you]1452-you must make up [your]1452-you mind to have dirty hands most part of the time . Similarly , [you]1452-you must praise chaos and filth . It is put there for [you]1452-you . Incense is , [I]0-i believe , camels ’ dung . When [you]1452-you praise , [you]1452-you do so with dung . When [you]1452-you see [men]518-men fighting , robbing [each other]370-each other , behaving meanly or breaking out into violent vulgarities , [you]1452-you must conventionally clap [your]1452-you hands . If [you]1452-you have not the stomach to do that , [you]1452-you can not be [a creative artist]1458-a creative artist . If [people]430-people stopped behaving in that way , [you]1452-you could not be [a creative artist]1458-a creative artist . ” “[1458-a creative artist] So [you]1452-you would discourage virtue , self - sacrifice , and graceful behaviour ? ” “[1452-you] No , praise [them]518-men very much . All [Tarr]122-tarr ’s attitude to [this man]416-this man had been made up of a sort of comic hypocrisy . Neither comedy nor hypocrisy were usable for the moment . Had [Tarr]122-tarr foreseen this possible termination of [his]122-tarr rôle of “[306-schnell] obstacle ? ” And ought [he]122-tarr , [he]122-tarr would ask [himself]122-tarr , to have gone on with this half - farce if [he]122-tarr were not prepared to meet the ultimate consequences ? [Kreisler]190-kreisler was quite unworthy to stand there , with perfect reason , and to be telling [him]122-tarr to “[306-schnell] get out . ” It was absurd to exalt [Kreisler]190-kreisler in that way ! [He]122-tarr watched with uncomfortable curiosity this new move , as one might watch [a surgeon]3738-a surgeon ’s haste at the crisis of an operation , searching for some necessary implement , mislaid for the moment . [He]122-tarr felt schoolboy - like , left waiting there at [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s disposition . It was as a reaction against this unpleasant feeling that [he]122-tarr stepped towards the door . The wish not to “[306-schnell] obey ” or to seem to turn tail either had alone kept [him]122-tarr where [he]122-tarr was . [He]122-tarr had just found the door when [Kreisler]190-kreisler , with a bound , was back from [his]190-kreisler box , flourishing an old dog - whip in [his]190-kreisler hand . “[1488-you] Ah , [you]1488-you go ? Look at this ! ” [He]0-i cracked the whip once or twice . “[1488-you] This is what [I]0-i keep for hounds like [you]1488-you ! ” Crack ! [He]0-i cracked it again in rather an inexperienced way with a certain difficulty . [He]0-i frowned and stopped in [his]0-i discourse , as though it had been some invention [he]0-i were showing off , that would not quite work at the proper moment , necessitating concentration . . “[1488-you] If [you]1488-you wish to see [me]0-i again , [you]1488-you can always find [me]0-i here . [You]1488-you wo n’t get off so easily next time ! ” [He]0-i cracked the whip smartly and then slammed the door . [Tarr]122-tarr could imagine [him]0-i throwing it down in a corner of [the room]2366-the room , and then going on with [his]0-i undressing . When [Kreisler]190-kreisler had jumped to the doorway [Tarr]122-tarr had stepped out with a half - defensive , half - threatening gesture and then gone on with strained slowness , lighting a match at the head of the stairs . [He]122-tarr felt like [a discomfited pub - loafer]3740-a discomfited pub - loafer as [he]122-tarr raised the match to an imaginary clay pipe rising in [his]122-tarr mind . There was the ostentatious coolness of [the music - hall comedian]3741-the music - hall comedian . The thing that had chiefly struck [him]122-tarr in [Kreisler]190-kreisler under this new aspect was a kind of nimbleness , a pettiness in [his]0-i behaviour and movements , where perhaps [he]0-i had expected more stiffness and heroics ; the clown - like gibing form [his]0-i anger took , a frigid disagreeable slyness and irony , a juvenile quickness and coldness . [Tarr]122-tarr was extremely dissatisfied with the part [he]122-tarr had played in this scene . First of all [he]122-tarr felt [he]122-tarr had withdrawn too quickly at the appearance of the whip , although [he]122-tarr had in fact got under way before it had appeared . Then , [he]122-tarr argued , [he]122-tarr should have stopped at the appearance of this instrument of disgrace . To stop and fight with [Kreisler]190-kreisler , what objection was there to that , [he]122-tarr asked [himself]122-tarr ? A taking [Kreisler]190-kreisler too seriously ? But what less serious than fighting ? [He]122-tarr had saved [himself]122-tarr an unpleasantness , something ridiculous , merely to find [himself]122-tarr outside [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s door , a feeling of primitive dissatisfaction in [him]122-tarr . Had [he]122-tarr definitely been guilty of a lack of pluck or pride , it would have been better . There was something mean and improper in all this that [he]122-tarr could not reason away or mistake . [He]122-tarr had undoubtedly insulted [this man]416-this man by [his]122-tarr attitude , s'en était fiché de lui ; and when [the other turned]3743-the other turned , whip in hand , [he]122-tarr had walked away . What really should [he]122-tarr have done ? [He]122-tarr should , no doubt , [he]122-tarr thought , having humorously instituted [himself]122-tarr [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s keeper]3744-kreisler ’s keeper , have humorously struggled with [him]3744-kreisler ’s keeper , when [the idiot]3745-the idiot became obstreperous . At that point [his]122-tarr humour had stopped . Then [his]122-tarr humour had limitations ? Once and for all and certainly : [he]122-tarr had no right to treat [a man]2077-a man as [he]122-tarr had treated [Kreisler]190-kreisler and yet claim , when [he]122-tarr turned and resented this treatment , immunity .from action on the score of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s idiocy . In allowing the physical struggle any importance [he]122-tarr allowed [Kreisler]190-kreisler an importance , too , that made [his]122-tarr former treatment of [him]190-kreisler unreal and unjustified . In [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s eyes [he]190-kreisler was [a blagueur , without resistance at a pinch , who walks away when turned on]3747-a blagueur , without resistance at a pinch , who walks away when turned on . This opinion was of no importance , since [he]122-tarr had not a shadow ' of respect for [Kreisler]190-kreisler . Again [he]122-tarr turned on [himself]122-tarr . If [he]122-tarr was so weak - minded as to care what trash like [Kreisler]190-kreisler thought or felt ! [He]122-tarr wandered in the direction of [the Café de l’Aigle]3551-the café de l’aigle , gripped in this ratiocination . [His]122-tarr unreadiness , [his]122-tarr dislike for action , [his]122-tarr fear of ridicule , [he]122-tarr treated severely in turn . [He]122-tarr thought of everything [he]122-tarr could against [himself]122-tarr . And [he]122-tarr laughed at [himself]122-tarr . But it was no good . At last [he]122-tarr gave way to the urgency of [his]122-tarr vanity and determined not to leave the matter where it was . At once plans for retrieving this discomfort came crowding on [him]122-tarr . [He]122-tarr would go to [the café]2708-the café as usual on the following evening , sit down smilingly at [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s table as though nothing had happened . In short , [he]122-tarr would altogether endorse the opinion that [Kreisler]190-kreisler had formed of [him]122-tarr . And yet why this meanness , even assumed , [Tarr]122-tarr asked [himself]122-tarr , even while arranging realistically [his]122-tarr to - morrow evening ’s purification ? Always in a contemptuous spirit , some belittlement or unsavoury rôle was suggesting itself . [His]122-tarr contempt for [everybody]668-everybody degraded [him]122-tarr . Still , for a final occasion and since [he]122-tarr was going this time to accept any consequences , [he]122-tarr would follow [his]122-tarr idea . [He]122-tarr would be , to [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s mind for a little , [the strange “[1488-you] slaverer and hoverer ” who had been kicked out on the previous night]3751-the strange “ slaverer and hoverer ” who had been kicked out on the previous night . [He]122-tarr would even have to “[1488-you] pile it on thick ” to be accepted at all , exaggerate in the direction of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s unflattering notion of [him]122-tarr . Then [he]122-tarr would gradually aggravate [Kreisler]190-kreisler , and with the same bonhomie attack [him]122-tarr with resolution . [He]122-tarr laughed as [he]122-tarr came to this point , as [a sensible old man]3752-a sensible old man might laugh at [himself]3752-a sensible old man on arriving at a similar decision . Soothed by the prospect of this rectification of the evening ’s blunder , [Tarr]122-tarr once more turned to reflect on it , and saw more clearly than ever the parallel morals of [his]122-tarr Bertha affair and [his]122-tarr Kreisler affair . [His]122-tarr sardonic dream of life got [him]122-tarr , as [a sort of Quixotic dreamer of inverse illusions , blows from the swift arms of windmills and attacks from indignant and perplexed mankind]3753-a sort of quixotic dreamer of inverse illusions , blows from the swift arms of windmills and attacks from indignant and perplexed mankind . [He]122-tarr , instead of having conceived [the world]2089-the world as more chivalrous and marvellous than it was , had conceived it as emptied of all dignity , sense , and generousness . [The drovers]3755-the drovers and [publicans]3756-publicans were angry at not being mistaken for legendary chivalry or [chatelaines]3757-chatelaines . [The very windmills]3758-the very windmills resented not being taken for giants ! The curse of humour was in [him]122-tarr , anchoring [him]122-tarr at one end of the see - saw whose movement and contradiction was life . Reminded of [Bertha]177-bertha , [he]122-tarr did not , however , hold [her]177-bertha responsible . But [his]122-tarr protectorate would be wound up . Acquaintance with [Anastasya]216-anastasya would be left where it was , despite the threatened aggression against [his]122-tarr nose . [Tarr]122-tarr ’s character at this time performed repeatedly the following manoeuvre : [his]122-tarr best energies would , once a farce was started , gradually take over the business from the play department and continue it as a serious line of its own . [It]3759-it was as though [it]3759-it had not the go to initiate anything of its own accord . [It]3759-it was content to exploit [the clown]432-the clown ’s discoveries . The bellicose visit to [Kreisler]190-kreisler now projected was launched to a slow blast of Humour , ready , when the time came , to turn into a storm . [His]122-tarr contempt for [the German]282-the german would not allow [him]122-tarr to enter into anything seriously against [him]122-tarr . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was a joke . Jokes , it had to be admitted ( and in that they became more effective than ever ) , were able to make [you]3761-you sweat . That [Kreisler]190-kreisler could be anywhere but at the café de l’Aigle on the following evening never entered [Tarr]122-tarr ’s head . As [he]122-tarr was on an unpleasant errand , [he]122-tarr took it for granted that [Fate]172-fate would on this occasion put everything punctually at [his]122-tarr disposal . Had it been an errand of pleasure , [he]122-tarr would have instinctively supposed the reverse . At ten , and at half - past , [[his]122-tarr rival]3720-his rival had not yet arrived . [Tarr]122-tarr set out to make rapidly a tour of [the other cafés]3763-the other cafés . But [Kreisler]190-kreisler might be turning over a new leaf . [His]122-tarr wait in [the original cafe]3772-the original cafe had made [him]122-tarr nervous and hardly capable of acting with circumspection . On the other hand , it might come at once . This was an opposite complication . [Kreisler]190-kreisler might open hostilities on the spot . This would rob [him]122-tarr of the subtle benefits to be derived from [his]122-tarr gradual strategy . This must be risked . [He]122-tarr was not very calm . [He]122-tarr crudely went up to [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s table and sat down . The feeling of the lack of aplomb in this action , and [his]122-tarr disappointment at the presence of [the other man]3773-the other man , chased the necessary good humour out of [his]122-tarr face . [He]122-tarr had carefully preserved this expression for some time , even walking lazily and quietly as if [he]122-tarr were carrying a jug of milk . Now it vanished in a moment . [She]232-fraulein vasek then stopped . “ [Mr. Soltyk]309-mr. soltyk and [I]232-fraulein vasek were just going to have the ‘ five o’clock ’ somewhere , ”[232-fraulein vasek] [she]232-fraulein vasek said . Did n’t [you]309-mr. soltyk say there was a place near here ? ”[232-fraulein vasek] “ There is one over there . But [I]190-kreisler ’m afraid , [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek , [I]190-kreisler must leave [you]309-mr. soltyk . — [I]190-kreisler have---- ”[190-kreisler] “ Oh , must [you]232-fraulein vasek ? [I]206-soltyk ’m sorry . ”[206-soltyk] [Soltyk]206-soltyk was astonished and mortified . [He]206-soltyk did not go , looking at [her]232-fraulein vasek doubtfully . At this point [Kreisler]190-kreisler had addressed [him]206-soltyk . “ [I]190-kreisler said nothing , [sir]2109-sir , when a moment ago , [you]2109-sir failed to return [my]190-kreisler salute . [I]190-kreisler understand [you]2109-sir were going to have tea with [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek . Now [you]2109-sir deprive [her]232-fraulein vasek suddenly of the pleasure of [your]2109-sir company . So there is no further doubt on a certain point . Will [you]2109-sir tell [me]190-kreisler at once and clearly what objection [you]2109-sir have to [me]190-kreisler ? ”[190-kreisler] “ [I]190-kreisler do n’t wish to discuss things of that sort before [this lady]877-this lady . ”[190-kreisler] “ Will [you]2109-sir then name a place where they may be discussed ? [I]190-kreisler will then take [my]190-kreisler leave ? ”[190-kreisler] “ [I]190-kreisler see no necessity to discuss anything with [you]2109-sir . ”[190-kreisler] “ Ah , [you]2109-sir see none . [I]190-kreisler do . And perhaps it is as well that [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek should hear .
