Since [this lady]877-this lady no doubt has heard some of [your]2109-sir lies , it would be of advantage that [you]2109-sir take them back at once , or else explain [yourself]2109-sir . ”[190-kreisler] Before [Kreisler]190-kreisler had finished , [Soltyk]206-soltyk said to [Anastasya]216-anastasya , “ [I]206-soltyk had better go at once , to save [you]216-anastasya this — ”[206-soltyk] Then [he]206-soltyk turned to [Kreisler]190-kreisler , “ [I]206-soltyk should have thought [you]216-anastasya would have had sufficient decency left---- ”[206-soltyk] “ Decency , [liar]3867-liar ? Decency , lying swine ? Decency — ! What do [you]216-anastasya mean ? ”[190-kreisler] said [Kreisler]190-kreisler , loudly , in crescendo . Then [he]190-kreisler crossed quickly over in front of [Anastasya]216-anastasya and smacked [Soltyk]206-soltyk first smartly on one cheek and [.then]310-.then on the other . “ There is liar branded on both [your]206-soltyk cheeks ! And if [you]206-soltyk should not wish to have coward added to [your]206-soltyk other epithets , [you]206-soltyk or [[your]206-soltyk friends]3090-your friends will find [me]190-kreisler at the following address before the day is out . ”[190-kreisler] [Kreisler]190-kreisler produced a card and handed it to [Soltyk]206-soltyk . [Soltyk]206-soltyk stared at [him]190-kreisler , paralysed for the moment at this outrage , [his]206-soltyk eyes burning with the sweet intensity [Tarr]122-tarr noticed that evening , taking in the incredible fact . [He]122-tarr got the fact at last . [He]122-tarr lifted [his]122-tarr cane and brought it down on [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s shoulders . [Kreisler]190-kreisler snatched it from [him]206-soltyk , broke it in three and flung it in [his]206-soltyk face , one of the splinters making a little gash in [his]206-soltyk under lip . [Anastasya]216-anastasya had turned round and begun walking away , leaving [them]1511-them alone . [Kreisler]190-kreisler also waited no longer , but marched rapidly off in the other direction . [Soltyk]206-soltyk caught [Anastasya]216-anastasya up , and apologized for what had occurred , dabbing [his]206-soltyk lip with a handkerchief . [Kreisler]190-kreisler after this felt [himself]190-kreisler fairly launched on a satisfactory little affair . [Many an old talent]1512-many an old talent would come in useful . [He]190-kreisler acted for the rest of the day with a gusto of professional interest . For an hour or two [he]190-kreisler stayed at [home]2396-home . [No one]2148-no one came , however , to call [him]190-kreisler to account . Leaving word that [he]190-kreisler would soon be back , [he]190-kreisler left in search of [a man to act for [him]190-kreisler]1515-a man to act for him . [He]190-kreisler remembered [a Russian [he]190-kreisler had had some talk with at [the Studio]2279-the studio , and whom [he]190-kreisler had once visited]1516-a russian he had had some talk with at the studio , and whom he had once visited . [He]190-kreisler was celebrated for having had a duel and blinded [[his]190-kreisler opponent]2670-his opponent . [His]190-kreisler instinct now led [him]190-kreisler to [this individual , who has already been seen in action]1519-this individual , who has already been seen in action . [His]190-kreisler qualifications for a second were quite unique . [Kreisler]190-kreisler found [him]1519-this individual , who has already been seen in action just finishing work . [He]190-kreisler had soon explained what [he]190-kreisler required of [him]1519-this individual , who has already been seen in action . With great gravity [he]190-kreisler set forth [his]190-kreisler attachment for [a “ beautiful girl]3869-a “ beautiful girl , ”[190-kreisler] the discreditable behaviour of [the Russian]3839-the russian in seeking to prejudice [her]3839-the russian against [him]190-kreisler . In fact , [he]190-kreisler gave an entirely false picture of the whole situation . [His]190-kreisler honour must now be satisfied . [He]190-kreisler would accept nothing less than reparation by arms . [Such]1521-such was [Kreisler]190-kreisler , but [he]190-kreisler was [himself]190-kreisler very cynically . [He]190-kreisler had explained this to [Volker]191-volker after the following manner : “ [I]190-kreisler am a hundred different things ; [I]190-kreisler am [as many people as the different types of people [I]190-kreisler have lived amongst]3870-as many people as the different types of people i have lived amongst . [I]190-kreisler am [a ‘ Boulevardier ’]3871-a ‘ boulevardier ’ ( [he]190-kreisler believed that on occasion [he]190-kreisler answered fully to that description ) , [I]190-kreisler am [a ‘ Rapin ’]3872-a ‘ rapin ’ ; [I]190-kreisler am also [a ‘ Korps - student]3873-a ‘ korps - student . ’ ”[190-kreisler] In [his]190-kreisler account of how things stood [he]190-kreisler had , besides , led [the Russian]207-the russian to understand that there was more in it all than it was necessary to say , and , in fact , than [he]190-kreisler could say . Whatever attitude [Soltyk]206-soltyk might take up , [this gentleman]1522-this gentleman too knew , [he]190-kreisler hinted , that [they]1523-they had come to the point in [their]1523-they respective relations towards [this “ beautiful girl]3874-this “ beautiful girl ”[190-kreisler] at which one of [them]1523-they must disappear . In addition , [he]190-kreisler , [Kreisler]190-kreisler , had been grossly insulted in the very presence of [the “ beautiful girl ”]3875-the “ beautiful girl ”[190-kreisler] that afternoon . [[The Russian]3839-the russian ’s compatriot]1525-the russian ’s compatriot had used [his]1525-the russian ’s compatriot cane . These latter were facts that would be confirmed later , for the physical facts at least could not be got round by [Soltyk]206-soltyk . [The Russian]207-the russian , [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko by name , [a solemnly excitable bourgeois of [Petrograd]92-petrograd]1526-a solemnly excitable bourgeois of petrograd , recognized a situation after [his]207-the russian own heart . So [Kreisler]190-kreisler and [[his]190-kreisler newly found henchman]1528-his newly found henchman , silently and intently engaged on [their]1529-their evening ’s business , have been accounted for . [Soltyk]206-soltyk had been discovered some quarter of an hour before [Tarr]122-tarr ’s appearance , and stared out of countenance for the whole of the time by [Kreisler]190-kreisler . CHAPTER III The indignation and flurry subsided ; but [the child of this eruption]1530-the child of this eruption remained . [The Polish party]1531-the polish party found the legacy of the uproar as cold as its cause had been hot . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko inspired respect as [he]311-bitzenko scratched [his]311-bitzenko beard , which smelt of Turkish tobacco , and wrinkled up imperturbably small grey eyes . Then , the excitement over , the red mark on [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s cheek became merely a fact . [One or two of [[his]206-soltyk friends]2310-his friends]1532-one or two of his friends found [themselves]1532-one or two of his friends examining it obliquely , as a relic , with curiosity . [He]206-soltyk had had [his]206-soltyk face smacked earlier in the day , as well . How much longer was [his]206-soltyk face going to go on being smacked ? Here was [this Russian]1534-this russian still there . There was the chance of an affair . A duel — a duel , for a change , in [our]1535-our civilized life ; c'était une idée . Who was [the girl]540-the girl [the Russian]3839-the russian kept mentioning ? Was [she]540-the girl that girl [he]206-soltyk had been telling [them]1532-one or two of his friends about who had [a man - servant]1538-a man - servant ? [Kreisler]190-kreisler was [a Frei - Herr]1539-a frei - herr ? [The Russian]207-the russian had referred to [him]190-kreisler as “ [[my]207-the russian friend]675-my friend [the Frei - Herr]3877-the frei - herr . ”[207-the russian] “ [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler does not wish to take further measures to ensure [himself]190-kreisler some form of satisfaction , ”[3839-the russian] [the Russian]3839-the russian said monotonously . “ There is always [the police]3878-the police for [drunken blackguards]3879-drunken blackguards , ”[3839-the russian] [Soltyk]206-soltyk answered . “ If [you]3839-the russian please ! That is not the way ! It is not usually so difficult to obtain satisfaction from [a gentleman]3388-a gentleman . ”[3839-the russian] “ But then [I]207-the russian am not [a gentleman]3388-a gentleman in the sense that [[your]3839-the russian friend]616-your friend [Kreisler]190-kreisler is . ”[207-the russian] “ Perhaps not , but a blow on the face---- ”[3853-the little russian] [The little Russian]3853-the little russian said “ blow on the face ”[3853-the little russian] in a soft inviting way , as though it were a titbit with powers of fascination of its own . “ But it is most improper to ask [me]3853-the little russian to stand here wrangling with [you]3839-the russian , ”[3853-the little russian] [he]3853-the little russian next said . “ [You]3839-the russian please [yourself]3839-the russian . ”[3853-the little russian] “ [I]1542-the waiter who had brought in the card am merely serving [[my]1542-the waiter who had brought in the card friend]675-my friend [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler . Will [you]3839-the russian oblige [me]1542-the waiter who had brought in the card by indicating [a friend of [yours]3839-the russian]1046-a friend of yours with whom [I]1542-the waiter who had brought in the card can discuss this matter ? ”[1542-the waiter who had brought in the card] [The waiter who had brought in the card]1542-the waiter who had brought in the card again approached [their]1543-their table . This time [he]3853-the little russian presented [Soltyk]206-soltyk with a note , written on the café paper and folded in four . [Tarr]122-tarr had been watching what was going on with as much interest as [his]122-tarr ruffled personal dignity would allow [him]122-tarr to take . [He]122-tarr did not believe in a duel . But [he]122-tarr wondered what would happen , for [he]122-tarr was certain that [Kreisler]190-kreisler would not let [this man]416-this man alone until something had happened . What would [he]122-tarr have done , [he]122-tarr asked [himself]122-tarr , in [[Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s place]1545-soltyk ’s place ? [He]122-tarr would have naturally refused to consider the idea of a duel as a possibility . If [you]1546-you had to fight a duel with [any man who liked to hit [you]1546-you on the head]1547-any man who liked to hit you on the head — [Kreisler]190-kreisler , moreover , was not [a man with whom a duel need be fought]1548-a man with whom a duel need be fought . [He]190-kreisler was in a weak position in that way , in spite of the additional blacking on [his]190-kreisler boots . [Tarr]122-tarr [himself]122-tarr , of course , could have taken refuge in the fact that [Englishmen]1052-englishmen do not duel . But what would have been the next step , this settled , had [he]190-kreisler been in [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s shoes ? [Kreisler]190-kreisler was waiting at the door of [the café]2708-the café . If [[his]190-kreisler enemy]1551-his enemy got up and went out , at the door [he]190-kreisler would once more have [his]190-kreisler face smacked . [His]122-tarr knowledge of [Kreisler]190-kreisler convinced [him]122-tarr that that face would be smacked all over [the quartier]1552-the quartier , at all hours of the day , for many days to come . [Kreisler]190-kreisler , unless physically overwhelmed , would smack it in public and in private until further notice . [He]190-kreisler would probably spit in it , after having smacked it , occasionally . So [Kreisler]190-kreisler must be henceforth fought by [[his]190-kreisler victim]2476-his victim wherever met . Would this state of things justify the use of a revolver ? No . [Kreisler]190-kreisler should be maimed . It all should be prepared with great thoroughness ; exactly the weight of stick , etc . The French laws would allow quite a bad wound . But [Tarr]122-tarr felt that [the sympathetic young Prussian - Pole]1554-the sympathetic young prussian - pole would soon have [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko on [his]1554-the sympathetic young prussian - pole hands as well . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was very alarming . [Kreisler]190-kreisler , although evicted from [the cafe]2705-the cafe , had been allowed by [the waiters]1556-the waiters to take up [his]190-kreisler position on a distant portion of [the terrace]1557-the terrace . There [he]190-kreisler sat with [his]190-kreisler legs crossed and [his]190-kreisler eye fixed on the door with a Scottish solemnity . [He]190-kreisler was an object of considerable admiration to [the garçons]3089-the garçons . [His]190-kreisler coolness and persistence appeared to [them]3089-the garçons amusing and typical . [His]190-kreisler solemnity aroused [their]3089-the garçons wonder and respect . [He]190-kreisler meant business . [He]190-kreisler was behaving correctly . [Soltyk]206-soltyk opened the note at once . On it was written in German : “ To [the cad Soltyk]206-soltyk “[206-soltyk] If [you]206-soltyk make any more trouble about appointing seconds , and delay [the gentlemen who have consented to act for [me]0-i]1559-the gentlemen who have consented to act for me , [I]0-i shall wait for [you]206-soltyk at the door and try some further means of rousing [you]206-soltyk to honourable action . ” [A little man]3885-a little man sitting next to [Soltyk]206-soltyk with [an eloquent , sleek lawyer]3886-an eloquent , sleek lawyer ’s face took the letter as though it had been a public document and read it . [He]3885-a little man bent towards [[his]3885-a little man friend]493-his friend and said : “[0-i] What is really the matter with [this gentleman]1522-this gentleman ? ” [Soltyk]206-soltyk shrugged [his]206-soltyk shoulders . “[1522-this gentleman] [He]1522-this gentleman ’s [a brute]582-a brute , and [he]1522-this gentleman is a little crazy as well . [He]1522-this gentleman wants to pick a quarrel with [me]0-i , [I]0-i do n’t know why . ” “[1522-this gentleman] [He]1522-this gentleman means trouble . [He]1522-this gentleman has annoyed [us]1566-us quite enough . ” “[206-soltyk] [Louis]206-soltyk , will [you]206-soltyk give [me]0-i permission to speak to [him]1522-this gentleman on [your]206-soltyk behalf ? ” “[206-soltyk] If that will give [you]206-soltyk any satisfaction . ” [Stephen]312-staretsky ( [Staretsky]312-staretsky ) got up and put [himself]312-staretsky at [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s disposition . [The whole party]3888-the whole party became tumultuous at this . “[206-soltyk] What the devil are [you]312-staretsky up to , [Stephen]312-staretsky ? This is the best thing to do , ” [he]312-staretsky seemed to say . “[312-staretsky] Do [you]312-staretsky want this to last the whole evening ? ” [he]312-staretsky asked [the man nearest [him]312-staretsky]3889-the man nearest him . [He]312-staretsky followed [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko out , and [Tarr]122-tarr followed [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko . [They]3890-they went over to [a small , gaudy , quiet café opposite]3891-a small , gaudy , quiet café opposite , [Kreisler]190-kreisler watching [them]3890-they , but still with [his]190-kreisler eye on the door near at hand . [Tarr]122-tarr was amused now at [his]122-tarr position of dummy . [He]122-tarr enjoyed crossing [the road]476-the road under [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s eye , in [his]122-tarr service . The evening ’s twists were very comic . [Imaginative people]3893-imaginative people are easy to convince of the naturalness of anything ; and [the Russian]3839-the russian was [the prophet of the necessity of this affair]3895-the prophet of the necessity of this affair . [Stephen]312-staretsky was not convinced ; but [he]312-staretsky soon made up [his]312-staretsky mind that [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was either [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s accomplice]3896-kreisler ’s accomplice in some scheme or at least had made up [his]312-staretsky mind that there could only be one ending to the matter . [[Your]206-soltyk German]1569-your german means to fight [you]206-soltyk or else [he]1570-him has some little game . Il a du pognon , il parait . ” [Soltyk]206-soltyk began patting [his]206-soltyk cheek gently . When [Stephen Staretsky]312-staretsky delivered [his]312-staretsky message [Soltyk]206-soltyk was losing [his]206-soltyk self - control . The opportunity of killing [this obnoxious figure]3903-this obnoxious figure offered [him]206-soltyk so obstinately by [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko — whom [he]206-soltyk disliked even more — began to recommend itself to [him]206-soltyk . [This commis voyageur sent to press the attractions of destruction]3904-this commis voyageur sent to press the attractions of destruction had won [his]206-soltyk point . [Soltyk]206-soltyk had been silent . [He]206-soltyk had been twisting up the comers of a newspaper on the table before [him]206-soltyk , and appeared struck lazy , into a kind of sullen sleepiness and detachment resembling despair . “[1570-him] Ask [him]1570-him , ” [he]206-soltyk said suddenly to [Staretsky]312-staretsky , “[1576-they] what [he]1570-him wants . ” “[1575-you] What do [you]1575-you mean ? ” [Soltyk]206-soltyk answered irritably , “[1575-you] Why , what [they]1576-they want : what sort of a duel [he]1570-him wants and when . ” “[1576-they] Duel ” was said as though it were a common object . “[1576-they] Settle it quickly and let ’s get all this nonsense over , since [you]1575-you have begun negotiations . ” [Stephen Staretsky]312-staretsky stared at [him]1575-you . “[1575-you] [You]1575-you do n’t mean — ? [I]0-i have not been negotiating . [I]0-i simply---- ” [The others]904-the others once more clamoured , after a moment of astonishment . “[1575-you] [You]1575-you do n’t mean to say , [Louis]206-soltyk , [you]206-soltyk ’re going---- ? ” “[206-soltyk] What nonsense , what utter nonsense ! What can [you]1575-you be thinking of ? ” “[1575-you] If [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko comes in again , pay no attention to [him]311-bitzenko ! What possesses [you]206-soltyk , [Louis]206-soltyk ! Whatever possesses [you]206-soltyk , [Louis]206-soltyk ! ” , [Soltyk]206-soltyk looked angrily at [[his]206-soltyk friends]2310-his friends without replying . “[312-staretsky] [Staretsky]312-staretsky , arrange that , do [you]312-staretsky mind ? ” [he]206-soltyk said when the exclamations stopped . “[312-staretsky] But for Heaven ’s sake get it finished quickly . This is becoming boring . ” [Staretsky]312-staretsky said , leaning on the back of [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s chair , with authority : “[206-soltyk] Do n’t be absurd , [Louis]206-soltyk : do n’t be absurd . [You]206-soltyk must refuse to listen to [him]311-bitzenko . All that rot about libelling and [the ‘ beautiful girl ’]1577-the ‘ beautiful girl ’ : [[my]0-i God]593-my god , [man]610-man , [you]206-soltyk ’re not going to take that seriously ? ” “[206-soltyk] Of course not . But [I]0-i shall fight [the German clown]1580-the german clown . [I]0-i want to . This is becoming ridiculous . ” [Soltyk]206-soltyk had made up [his]206-soltyk mind . [He]206-soltyk would never have armed [himself]206-soltyk and shot [Kreisler]190-kreisler in [the street]2061-the street . That would have been too ridiculous . It would have had the touch of passion and intimacy of a crime passionel . It would only have been dignified for [an inhabitant of [Nevada]95-nevada]3908-an inhabitant of nevada . [He]206-soltyk did not regard this as a duel , but a brawl , ordered by the rules of “[1581-you] affairs of honour . ” If [a drunken man]3909-a drunken man or [an apache]3910-an apache attacked [you]1581-you the best thing to do would be to fight . If [he]206-soltyk offered to “[1581-you] fight [you]1581-you fair ” — putting it in that way — then that would , be the best thing , too , no doubt . But [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko really had brought [him]206-soltyk to this . [Kreisler]190-kreisler alone could never have hoped to compass anything approaching a duel with [him]206-soltyk . [Stephen Staretsky]312-staretsky overwhelmed [him]206-soltyk with expostulation — even reproaches . [His]312-staretsky voice rose and fell in a microscopic stream of close - packed sound . [His]312-staretsky face became shiny and the veins appeared in it . [He]312-staretsky begged [Soltyk]206-soltyk to think of [[his]312-staretsky friends]2310-his friends ! [He]312-staretsky gathered [his]312-staretsky arguments up in the tips of [his]312-staretsky fingers in little nervous bunches and held them under [[his]312-staretsky friend]493-his friend ’s nose , as though asking [him]206-soltyk to smell them . And then , with a spasm of the body , a vibrating twang on some deep chord in [his]312-staretsky throat , [he]312-staretsky dashed [his]312-staretsky gathered fingers towards the floor . In face of this attack it was impossible , even had [he]312-staretsky wished to do so , for [Soltyk]206-soltyk to reconsider [his]312-staretsky decision . The others , too , sat for the most part watching [him]312-staretsky . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko appeared again . [Soltyk]206-soltyk became pale at the sight of [this sinister figure]3913-this sinister figure , so bourgeois , prepossessing , and bearded , with its legend of blindings and blood and uncanny tenacity as a second . [He]206-soltyk turned to [a good - looking , sleek , sallow companion]3914-a good - looking , sleek , sallow companion at [his]206-soltyk elbow . “[314-khudin] [Khudin]314-khudin , will [you]314-khudin act for [me]0-i , as [Stephen]312-staretsky wo n’t ? ” [Stephen Staretsky]312-staretsky rose . A superfine sweat moistened [his]0-i skin . [His]0-i extraordinary volubility was tucked away somewhere in [him]0-i in a flash , in a satisfied and polished acrobatic , and [he]0-i faced [the Russian]207-the russian . [Khudin]314-khudin rose at the same time . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko had won . [Tarr]122-tarr was astonished at the rapid tragic trend of these farcical negotiations . “[314-khudin] How angry [that man]1070-that man must be to do that , ” [he]122-tarr thought . But [he]122-tarr had not been smacked the evening before ; yet [he]122-tarr remembered [he]122-tarr had been passably angry . CHAPTER V [Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler , when [he]190-kreisler had entered [the café Souchet]3915-the café souchet , had been anxious . [His]190-kreisler eyes had picked out [Soltyk]206-soltyk in a delicate flurry . [He]190-kreisler had been afraid that [he]206-soltyk might escape [him]190-kreisler . [Soltyk]206-soltyk looked so securely bedded in life , and [he]190-kreisler wanted to wrench [him]206-soltyk out . [He]190-kreisler was not at all bad - tempered at the moment . [He]190-kreisler would have extracted [him]206-soltyk quite “[1070-that man] painlessly ” if required . But bleeding and from the roots , [he]206-soltyk must come out ! ( Br - r - rr . The Bersaker rage ! ) [He]190-kreisler was quite quiet and well - behaved ; above all things , well - behaved ! The mood [he]190-kreisler had happened on for this particular phase of [his]190-kreisler action was a virulent snobbery . [He]190-kreisler was [a painful and blushing snob]3916-a painful and blushing snob ! [He]190-kreisler had , at [his]190-kreisler last public appearance , taken the rôle of [a tramp - comedian]3917-a tramp - comedian . [He]190-kreisler had invited every description of slight and indignity . [The world]2089-the world seemed to wish to perpetuate this part for [him]190-kreisler . But [he]190-kreisler would not play ! [He]190-kreisler refused ! A hundred times , [he]190-kreisler refused ! [He]190-kreisler remembered with eagerness that [he]190-kreisler was [a German gentleman]3919-a german gentleman , with a university education ; who had never worked ; [a member of [an honourable family]3921-an honourable family]3920-a member of an honourable family ! [He]190-kreisler remembered each detail socially to [his]190-kreisler advantage , realizing methodically things [he]190-kreisler had from childhood accepted and never thought of examining . But [he]190-kreisler had gone a step further . [He]190-kreisler had arbitrarily revived the title of [Frei - Herr]190-kreisler that , it was rumoured in [[his]190-kreisler family]3470-his family , [[his]190-kreisler ancestors]407-his ancestors had borne . With [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko [he]190-kreisler had referred to [himself]190-kreisler as [the Frei - Herr Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler . Had the occasion allowed , [he]190-kreisler would have been very courteous and gentle with [Soltyk]206-soltyk , merely to prove what [a gentleman]3388-a gentleman [he]190-kreisler was ! But , alas , nothing but brutality ( against the grain — the noble grain — as this went ! ) would achieve [his]190-kreisler end . And the end was still paramount . [His]190-kreisler snobbery was the outcome of this end , of [his]190-kreisler end . It was , in this obsession of disused and disappearing life , the wild assertion of vitality , the clamour for recognition that life and the beloved self were still there , that brought out [the reeking and brand - new snob]3925-the reeking and brand - new snob . [He]190-kreisler was almost dead ( [he]190-kreisler had promised [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father [his]190-kreisler body for next month , and must be punctual ) , but [people]430-people already had begun treading on [him]190-kreisler and striking matches on [his]190-kreisler boots . As to fighting with [a man who was practically dead , to all intents and purposes , one mass of worms]3928-a man who was practically dead , to all intents and purposes , one mass of worms — a worm , in short — that was not to be expected of [anybody]2075-anybody . So [he]190-kreisler became [a violent snob]3930-a violent snob . It was [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s rude behaviour on the day before in the presence of [Anastasya]216-anastasya that had set [him]190-kreisler raving on this subject . [The Russian Pole]3931-the russian pole was up against [a raving snob whose social dignity [he]190-kreisler had wounded]3932-a raving snob whose social dignity he had wounded . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko and [Kreisler]190-kreisler came out to get [Louis Soltyk]206-soltyk like [two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity . [Their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity schemes and energies flew direct from mind to mind , without the need for words . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko with [his]311-bitzenko own hand had brushed the back of [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s coat ; on tiptoe doing this [he]311-bitzenko looked particularly childlike . [They]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity were together there in [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s room]2528-kreisler ’s room before [they]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity started like [two little boys]3935-two little boys dressing up in preparation for some mischief . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had fixed [his]190-kreisler eyes on [Soltyk]206-soltyk from [his]190-kreisler table with alert offensiveness . The prosperous appearance of [the Poles]315-the poles annoyed [him]190-kreisler deeply . [Their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity watches were all there , silk handkerchiefs slipped up [their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity sleeves ; they looked sleek and new . A gentle flame of social security and ease danced in [their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity eyes and gestures . [He]190-kreisler was out in the dark , [they]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity were in [a lighted room]3936-a lighted room ! [He]190-kreisler wished [[their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity fathers]3937-their fathers ’ affairs might deteriorate and [their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity fortunes fall to pieces ; that [their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity watches could be stolen , and [[their]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity restaurant]3938-their restaurant tick attacked by insidious reports ! And as [he]190-kreisler watched [them]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity [he]190-kreisler felt more and more [an outcast , shabbier and shabbier]3939-an outcast , shabbier and shabbier . [He]190-kreisler saw [himself]190-kreisler [the little official in [a German provincial town]3941-a german provincial town that [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father ’s letter foreshadowed]3940-the little official in a german provincial town that his father ’s letter foreshadowed . [One or two of [them]3933-two madmen , full of solemn method and with miraculous solidarity]3943-one or two of them pointed [him]190-kreisler out to [Soltyk]206-soltyk , and it was a wounding laugh of [the latter]532-the latter ’s that brought [him]190-kreisler to [his]190-kreisler feet . As [he]190-kreisler was slapping [[his]190-kreisler enemy]1551-his enemy [he]190-kreisler woke up out of [his]190-kreisler nightmare . [He]190-kreisler was like [a sleeper]3946-a sleeper having the first inkling of [his]190-kreisler solitude when [he]190-kreisler is woken by the climax of [his]190-kreisler dream , still surrounded by tenacious influences . But had [any one]397-any one struck [him]190-kreisler then , the blow would have had as little effect as a blow aimed at [a waking man]3948-a waking man by a phantom of [his]190-kreisler sleep . The noise around [him]190-kreisler was a receding accompaniment . Then [he]190-kreisler felt hypnotized by [Soltyk]206-soltyk ’s quietness . The sweet white of the face made [him]190-kreisler sick . To . overcome this [he]190-kreisler stepped forward again to strike the dummy once more , and then it moved suddenly . As [he]190-kreisler raised [his]190-kreisler hand [his]190-kreisler glasses almost slipped off , and at that point [he]190-kreisler was seized by the garçons . Hurried out on to the pavement , [he]190-kreisler could still see , at the bottom of a huge placid mirror just inside [the cafe]2705-the cafe , the wriggling backs of the band of Poles . Drawing out [his]190-kreisler card - case , [he]190-kreisler had handed [the waiter]3003-the waiter a visiting - card . [The waiter]3003-the waiter at first refused it . [He]190-kreisler turned [his]190-kreisler head aside vaguely , as a dog does when doubtful about some morsel offered [him]190-kreisler ; then [he]190-kreisler took it . [Kreisler]190-kreisler saw in the mirror ' the tearing up of [his]190-kreisler card . Fury once more — not so much because it was a new slight as that [he]190-kreisler feared [his]190-kreisler only hope , [Soltyk]206-soltyk , might escape [him]190-kreisler . The worry of this hour or so in which [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was negotiating told on [him]190-kreisler so much that when at last [[his]311-bitzenko emissary]3952-his emissary announced that an arrangement , had been come to in the sense [he]190-kreisler wished , [he]190-kreisler questioned [him]190-kreisler incredulously . [He]190-kreisler felt hardly any satisfaction , reaction setting in immediately . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko went back to [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s door with [him]311-bitzenko and , promising to return within half an hour , left [him]190-kreisler . [Tarr]122-tarr having , as [he]190-kreisler had stipulated , left when the talking was over , [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko first went in search of [a friend]2156-a friend to serve as [second]3954-second . [The man [he]311-bitzenko decided on]3955-the man he decided on was already in bed , and at once , half asleep , without preparation of any sort , consented to do what was asked of [him]3955-the man he decided on . “[314-khudin] Will [you]1583-you be a second in a duel to - morrow morning at half - past six ? ” “[1583-you] Yes . ” “[1583-you] At half - past six ? ” “[1583-you] Yes . ” And after a minute or two , “[1583-you] Is it [you]1583-you ? ” “[1583-you] No , [a German friend of mine]1584-a german friend of mine . ” “[1584-a german friend of mine] All right . ” “[1584-a german friend of mine] [You]1583-you will have to get up at five . ” [[Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s friend]3956-bitzenko ’s friend was [a tall , powerfully built young Russian painter , who , with [his]3956-bitzenko ’s friend great bow - legs , would take up some straggling and extravagantly twisted pose of the body and remain immobile for minutes together , with an air of ridiculous detachment]3957-a tall , powerfully built young russian painter , who , with his great bow - legs , would take up some straggling and extravagantly twisted pose of the body and remain immobile for minutes together , with an air of ridiculous detachment . This combination of a tortured , restless attitude , and at the same time statuesque tendency , suggested something like [a contemplative acrobat]3958-a contemplative acrobat or contortionist . A mouth of almost anguished attention and little calm indifferent eyes , produced similar results in the face . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s next move was to go to [[his]311-bitzenko rooms]2756-his rooms , put a gently ticking little clock , with an enormous alarum on the top , under [his]311-bitzenko arm , and then walk round once more to [[Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s]3960-otto kreisler ’s . [He]311-bitzenko informed [[his]311-bitzenko friend]493-his friend of these last arrangements made in [[his]311-bitzenko interests]3962-his interests . [He]311-bitzenko suggested that it would be better for [him]311-bitzenko to sleep [there]2057-there that night , to save time in the morning . In short , [he]311-bitzenko attached [himself]311-bitzenko to [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s person]3964-kreisler ’s person . Until it were deposited in [the large cemetery near by]3965-the large cemetery near by , or else departed from [the Gare du Nord]96-the gare du nord in a deal box for burial in [Germany]4-germany , it should not leave [him]311-bitzenko . In the event of victory , and [he]311-bitzenko being no longer responsible for it , it should disappear as best it could . The possible subsequent conflict with [the police]3878-the police was not without charm for [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko . [He]311-bitzenko regarded [the police force]3967-the police force , its functions and existence , as a pretext for adventure . The light was blown out . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko curled [himself]311-bitzenko up on the floor . [He]311-bitzenko insisted on this . [Kreisler]190-kreisler must be fresh in the morning and do [him]311-bitzenko justice . [The Russian]3839-the russian could hear the bed shaking for some time . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was trembling violently . A sort of exultation at the thought of [his]311-bitzenko success caused this nervous attack . [He]311-bitzenko had been quite passive since [he]311-bitzenko had heard that all was well . At about half - past four in the morning [Kreisler]190-kreisler was dreaming of [Volker]191-volker and a pact [he]190-kreisler had made with [him]191-volker in [his]190-kreisler sleep never to divulge some secret , which there was never any possibility of [his]190-kreisler doing in any case , as [he]190-kreisler had completely forgotten what it was . [He]190-kreisler was almost annihilated by a terrific explosion . With [his]190-kreisler eyes suddenly wide open , [he]190-kreisler saw the little clock quivering in the mantelpiece beneath its large alarum . When it had stopped [Kreisler]190-kreisler could hardly believe [his]190-kreisler ears , as though this sound had been going to accompany life , for that day at least , as a destructive and terrifying feature . Then [he]190-kreisler saw [the Russian]3839-the russian , already on [his]3839-the russian feet . [His]3839-the russian white and hairy little body had apparently risen energetically out of the scratch bedclothes simultaneously with the “[1584-a german friend of mine] going off ” of [his]3839-the russian clock , as though it were a mechanism set for the same hour . [They]3970-they both dressed without a word . [Kreisler]190-kreisler wrote a short letter to [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father , entrusting it to [[his]190-kreisler second]3972-his second . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s last few francs were to be spent on [a taxi]3973-a taxi to take [them]3970-they to [the place arranged on , outside [the fortifications]3975-the fortifications]3974-the place arranged on , outside the fortifications . [They]3970-they found the other second sound asleep . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko more or less dressed [him]3839-the russian . [They]3970-they set out in [[their]3970-they taxi]3976-their taxi to [the rendezvous]3977-the rendezvous by way of [the Bois]97-the bois . The chilly and unusual air of the early morning , [the empty streets]3978-the empty streets and [shuttered houses]3979-shuttered houses , destroyed all feeling of reality of what was happening for [Kreisler]190-kreisler . Had the duel been a thing to fear it would have had an opposite effect . [His]190-kreisler errand did not appear as an inflexible reality , either , following upon events that there was no taking back . It was a whim , a caprice , [they]3970-they were pursuing , as though , for instance , [they]3970-they had woken up in the early morning and decided to go fishing . [They]3970-they were carrying it out with a dogged persistency , with which [our]3980-our whims are often served . [He]190-kreisler kept [his]190-kreisler thought away from [Soltyk]206-soltyk . [He]190-kreisler seemed a very long way off ; it would be fatiguing for the mind to go in search of [him]190-kreisler . When [the scientist]3981-the scientist ’s nature , with immense fugue , has induced [a man]2077-a man to marry [some handsome young lady]3983-some handsome young lady — this feat accomplished , [Nature]177-bertha leaves [him]190-kreisler practically alone , only coming back to give [him]190-kreisler a prod from time to time — assured that , like a little trickling stream , [his]190-kreisler life will go steadily on in the bed gauged for it by this upheaval . [Nature]177-bertha , in [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s case , had done its work of another description . But [she]177-bertha had left [the Russian]207-the russian with [him]190-kreisler to see that all was carried out according to [her]177-bertha wishes . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s German nature that craved discipline , a course marked out , had got more even than it asked for . It had been presented with a mimic Fate . But [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko evidently took [his]190-kreisler pleasure morosely . The calm and assurance of the evening before had given place to a brooding humour . [He]190-kreisler was only restored to a silent and intense animation on hearing [his]190-kreisler “[1584-a german friend of mine] Browning ” speak . [He]190-kreisler produced this somewhere in [the Bois]97-the bois , and insisted on [[his]190-kreisler principal]3984-his principal having a little practice as [they]3984-his principal had plenty of time to ' spare . This was a very imprudent step . It might draw attention to [their]3984-his principal movements . [Kreisler]190-kreisler proved an excellent shot . Then [the Russian]3839-the russian [himself]3839-the russian , with impassible face , emptied a couple of chambers into a tree - trunk . [He]3839-the russian put [his]3839-the russian “[1584-a german friend of mine] Browning ” back into [his]3839-the russian pocket hastily after this , as though startled at [his]3839-the russian own self - indulgence . [A piece of waste land]3986-a piece of waste land , on the edge of a wood , well hidden on all sides , had been chosen for the duel . [The enemy]1144-the enemy was not on the ground . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s passivity still subsisted . So far [he]190-kreisler had felt that [Accident]316-accident had been dealt a shrewd blow and brought to its knees . [He]190-kreisler was in good hands . Until this was all over [he]190-kreisler had nothing to worry about . Fresh compartment . The duel became for [him]190-kreisler , as [he]190-kreisler stood on the damp grass , conventional . It was a duel like another . [He]190-kreisler was seeking reparation by arms . [He]190-kreisler had been libelled and outraged . “[3649-a beautiful woman] [A beautiful woman]3649-a beautiful woman ” was at the bottom of it . Life had no value for [him]190-kreisler ! Tant pis for [the other man who had been foolhardy enough to cross [his]190-kreisler path]3988-the other man who had been foolhardy enough to cross his path . [His]3839-the russian coat - collar turned up , [he]3839-the russian looked sternly towards [the road]476-the road , [his]3839-the russian moustaches blowing a little in the wind . [He]190-kreisler asked [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko for a cigarette . [That gentleman]3990-that gentleman did not smoke , but [the other Russian]3991-the other russian produced a khaki cigarette with a long mouthpiece . [He]190-kreisler struck a light . As [Kreisler]190-kreisler lit [his]190-kreisler cigarette at it , [his]190-kreisler hand resting against the other ’s , a strange feeling shot through [him]190-kreisler at the contact of this flesh . [He]190-kreisler moistened [his]190-kreisler lips and spat out a piece of the mouthpiece [he]190-kreisler had bitten through . The hour arranged came round and there was still no sign of [anybody]2075-anybody . The possibility of a hitch in the proceedings dawned on [Kreisler]190-kreisler . Personal animosity for [Soltyk]206-soltyk revived . That idea of obstinacy in a caprice , instead of merely carrying out something prearranged and unavoidable , despite [his]206-soltyk passivity , had proved really the wakefulness of [his]206-soltyk will . [He]190-kreisler looked towards [[his]190-kreisler companions]2707-his companions , alone there on the ground of the encounter . [They]2707-his companions were [an unsatisfactory pair]3994-an unsatisfactory pair , after all . [They]2707-his companions did not look [a winning team]3995-a winning team . [He]190-kreisler reproached [himself]190-kreisler for having hit just on [this Russian]1534-this russian for assistance . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko , on the other hand , was deep in thought . [He]311-bitzenko was rehearsing [his]311-bitzenko part of second . The duel in which [he]311-bitzenko had blinded [[his]311-bitzenko adversary]3997-his adversary was a figment of [his]311-bitzenko boyish brain , confided with tears in [his]311-bitzenko voice one evening to [a friend]2156-a friend . [His]311-bitzenko only genuine claim to activity was that , in a perfect disguise , [he]311-bitzenko had assisted [the peasants of [[his]311-bitzenko estate]4000-his estate]3999-the peasants of his estate to set fire to [his]311-bitzenko . [little Manor House]99-little manor house during the revolution of 1906 for the fun of the thing and in an access of revolutionary sentiment . Afterwards [he]311-bitzenko had assisted [the police]3878-the police with information in the investigation of the affair , also anonymously . All this [he]311-bitzenko kept to [himself]311-bitzenko . [He]311-bitzenko referred to [his]311-bitzenko past in [Russia]100-russia in a way that conjured up more luridness than the flames of [[his]311-bitzenko little chateau]4002-his little chateau ( which did not burn at all well ) warranted . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was quite in [his]311-bitzenko element climatically ; whereas [Kreisler]190-kreisler felt [his]190-kreisler hands getting so cold that [he]190-kreisler thought they might fail [him]190-kreisler in the duel . But [a car]4003-a car was heard beyond the trees on [the Paris road]4004-the paris road . This sound in the listless blur of nature was masterful in its significance . [It]4003-a car struck steadily and at once into brutish apathy . [It]4003-a car so plainly knew what it wanted . [It]4003-a car had perhaps outstripped [men]518-men in that . [Men]518-men in [their]518-men soft bodies still contained the apathy of [the fields]4007-the fields . [Their]518-men mind had burst out of [them]518-men and taken these crawling pulps up on its rigid back . [It]4003-a car was [[Staretsky]312-staretsky ’s car]4008-staretsky ’s car . With its load of hats [it]4003-a car drew up . [The four members of the other party]4009-the four members of the other party came on to [the field]4010-the field , [the fourth]4011-the fourth [a young Polish doctor]4012-a young polish doctor . [They]4009-the four members of the other party walked quickly . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko went to meet [them]4009-the four members of the other party . [Staretsky]312-staretsky protested energetically that the duel must not proceed . “[1584-a german friend of mine] It must — not — go — on ! Should anything happen — [you]1586-your must allow [me]0-i to say , should anything happen — the blood of [whoever falls]1587-whoever falls will be at [your]1586-your door ! ” But [he]312-staretsky felt all the same that the prospect of having a little pond of blood at [his]312-staretsky door was an alluring one for [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko . “[1588-your principal] Has not [[your]1586-your principal]1588-your principal seen that in accepting this duel , [M. Soltyk]317-soltyk had proved [his]1588-your principal respect for [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s claim ? [Soltyk]317-soltyk ’s eyes steadily avoided [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s person]3964-kreisler ’s person . [He]190-kreisler hoped [this ridiculous figure]4014-this ridiculous figure might make some move enabling [them]4015-them to abandon the duel . But the idea of a favour coming from such a quarter was repellent . [His]190-kreisler stomach had been out of order the day before — [he]190-kreisler wondered if it would surge up , disgrace [him]190-kreisler . [He]190-kreisler might be sick at any moment . [He]190-kreisler saw [himself]190-kreisler on tiptoe , in an ignominious spasm , the proceedings held up , [friends]2170-friends and [enemies]4017-enemies watching . [He]190-kreisler kept [his]190-kreisler eyes off [Kreisler]190-kreisler as [a man on [board ship]4019-board ship]4018-a man on board ship keeps [his]4018-a man on board ship eyes off a dish of banana fritters or a poached egg . Obediently , erect and still , [he]190-kreisler appeared rather amazed at what was occurring . [Soltyk]317-soltyk , in rear of [the others]904-the others , struggled with [his]317-soltyk bile . [He]317-soltyk slipped into [his]317-soltyk mouth a sedative tablet , oxide of bromium and heroin . This made [him]317-soltyk feel more sick . For a few moments [he]317-soltyk stood still in horror , expecting to vomit at every moment . The blood rushed to [his]317-soltyk head and covered the back of [his]317-soltyk neck with a warm liquid sheet . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s look of surprise deepened . [He]190-kreisler had seen [Soltyk]317-soltyk slipping something into [his]317-soltyk mouth , and was puzzled and annoyed , like [a child]499-a child . What was [he]317-soltyk up to ? Poison was the only guess [he]190-kreisler could give . What on earth---- ? Having taken part in many mensurs [he]190-kreisler knew that for this very serious duel [his]190-kreisler emotions were hardly adequate . [His]190-kreisler nervous system was as quiescent as a corpse ’s . [He]190-kreisler became offended with [his]190-kreisler phlegm . All this instinctive resistance to the idea of Death , the indignity of being nothing , was rendered empty by [his]190-kreisler premature insensitiveness . [He]190-kreisler tried to visualize and feel . In a few minutes [he]190-kreisler might be dead ! That had so little effect that [he]190-kreisler almost laughed . Then [he]190-kreisler reflected that [that man over there]4024-that man over there might in a few minutes be wiped out . [He]190-kreisler would become a disintegrating mess , uglier than any vitriol or syphilis could make [him]190-kreisler . All that organism [he]190-kreisler , [Kreisler]190-kreisler , would be turning into dung , as though by magic . [He]190-kreisler , [Kreisler]190-kreisler , is insulted . The sensations and energies of [that man]1070-that man deny [him]190-kreisler equality of existence . [He]190-kreisler , [Kreisler]190-kreisler , lifts [his]190-kreisler hand , presses a little bar of steel , and the other is swept away into [the earth]2188-the earth . Heaven knows where the insulting spirit goes to . But the physical disfigurement at least is complete . [He]190-kreisler went through it laboriously . But it fell flat as well . [He]190-kreisler was too near the event to benefit by [his]190-kreisler fancy . [Possibilities]318-possibilities were weakened by the nearness of [Certainty]319-certainty . [His]190-kreisler momentary resentment with [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko survived , and [he]190-kreisler next became annoyed at being treated like an object , as [he]190-kreisler felt it . [He]190-kreisler was not deliberately conscious of much . But , try as [he]190-kreisler would to elude the disgraces and besmirchings of death , [people]430-people refused to treat [him]190-kreisler as anything but a sack of potatoes . There [four or five men]4028-four or five men had been arguing about [him]190-kreisler for the last five minutes , and [they]4028-four or five men had not once looked [his]190-kreisler way . But clearly [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was defending Ms duel . Why should [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko go on disposing of [him]190-kreisler in this fashion ? [He]311-bitzenko took everything for granted ; [he]311-bitzenko never so much as appealed to [him]311-bitzenko , even once . Had [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko been commissioned to hustle [him]190-kreisler out of existence ? But [Soltyk]317-soltyk . There was [that fellow]4029-that fellow again slipping something into [his]317-soltyk mouth ! A cruel and fierce sensation of mixed real and romantic origin rose hotly round [his]190-kreisler heart . [He]190-kreisler loved [that man]1070-that man ! But because [he]190-kreisler loved [him]1070-that man [he]190-kreisler wished to plunge a sword into [him]1070-that man , to plunge it in and out and up and down 1 Why had [pistols]4031-pistols been chosen ? [He]190-kreisler would let [him]1070-that man off for two pins ! [He]190-kreisler would let [him]1070-that man off if---- Yes ! [He]190-kreisler began pretending to [himself]190-kreisler that the duel might after all not take place . That was the only way [he]190-kreisler could get anything out of it . [He]190-kreisler laughed ; then shouted out in German : “[1588-your principal] Give [me]0-i one ! ” [They]4032-they all looked round . [Soltyk]317-soltyk did not turn , but the side of [his]317-soltyk face became crimson . [Kreisler]190-kreisler felt a surge of active passion at the sight of the blood in [his]317-soltyk face . “[1588-your principal] Give [me]0-i one , ” [Kreisler]190-kreisler shouted again , putting out the palm of [his]0-i hand , and laughing in a thick , insulting , hearty way . [He]317-soltyk was now [a Knabe]4033-a knabe . [He]317-soltyk was young and cheeky . [His]317-soltyk last words had been said with quick cleverness . The heavy coquetting was double - edged . “[1588-your principal] What do [you]0-i mean ? ” [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko called back . “[0-i] [I]0-i want a jujube . Ask [Herr Soltyk]205-soltyk ! ” [They]4032-they all turned towards [the other principal]4034-the other principal to the duel , standing some yards on the other side of [them]4032-they . Head thrown back and eyes burning , [Soltyk]205-soltyk gazed at [Kreisler]190-kreisler . It was genuine , but not very strong . If killing could be embodied in the organ that sees — a new function of expression — a perfect weapon would exist . Only the intensest expression being effective , such spiritual blasting powers would be a solution of the arbitrary decisions of force . Words , glances , music are at present as indirect as hands and cannons . Such music might be written , however , that [no fool]4035-no fool , hearing it , could survive . Whether it throttled [him]317-soltyk in a spasm of disgust or of shame is immaterial . [Soltyk]205-soltyk ’s battery was too conventional to pierce the layers of putrifying tragedy , [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s bulwark]4036-kreisler ’s bulwark . It played to the limit of its power . [His]317-soltyk cheeks were a dull red : [his]317-soltyk upper lip was stretched tightly over the gums . The white line of teeth made [his]317-soltyk face look as though [he]317-soltyk were laughing . [He]317-soltyk stamped [his]317-soltyk foot on the ground with the impetuous grace of [a Russian dancer]3170-a russian dancer , and started walking hurriedly up and down . [Kreisler]190-kreisler stepped forward so quickly that [he]190-kreisler was beside [him]312-staretsky before [Soltyk]205-soltyk could move . With one hand coaxingly extended towards [his]205-soltyk arm , [he]205-soltyk was saying something , too softly for [the others]904-the others to hear . [He]205-soltyk had immobilized [everybody]668-everybody by [his]205-soltyk rapid action . [Surprise]321-surprise had shot [their]668-everybody heads all one way . [They]668-everybody stood , watching and listening , screwed into astonishment as though by deft Angers . [His]205-soltyk soft words , too , must have carried sleep . [Their]668-everybody , insults and [their]668-everybody honey clogged up [[his]205-soltyk enemy]1551-his enemy . A hand had been going up to strike . But at the words it stopped dead . So much new matter for anger had been poured into the ear that it wiped out all the earlier impulse . Action must be again begun right down from the root . [Kreisler]190-kreisler thrust [his]190-kreisler mouth forward amorously , [his]190-kreisler body in the attitude of [the eighteenth - century gallant]4044-the eighteenth - century gallant , as though [Soltyk]205-soltyk had been [a woman]2139-a woman . The will broke out frantically from the midst of bandages and a bulk of suddenly accruing fury . [Soltyk]205-soltyk tore at [himself]205-soltyk first , writhing upright , a statue ’s bronze softening , suddenly , with blood . [He]205-soltyk became white and red by turns . [His]205-soltyk blood , one heavy mass , hurtled about in [him]205-soltyk , up and down , like a sturgeon in a narrow tank . All the pilules [he]205-soltyk had taken seemed acting sedatively against the wildness of [his]205-soltyk muscles . [The bromium]4046-the bromium fought the blood . [His]205-soltyk hands were electrified . [Will]125-buffalo bill was at last dashed all over [him]205-soltyk , [an Arctic douche]4047-an arctic douche . The hands flew at [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s throat . [His]205-soltyk nails made six holes in the flesh and cut into the tendons beneath . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was hurled about . Then [they]4049-they gripped along the coat - sleeves , connecting [him]190-kreisler with the engine [he]190-kreisler had just overcharged with fuel . [Staretsky]312-staretsky had said : “[323-tchun] That crapule is beneath contempt ! Pouah ! — [I]0-i refuse to act . Actual fighting appeared a contingency outside the calculations or functioning of [his]190-kreisler spirit . Brutal by rote and in the imagination , if action came too quickly before [he]190-kreisler could inject it with [his]190-kreisler dream , [his]190-kreisler forces were disconnected . [He]190-kreisler stooped down to take up one of the pistols . [Staretsky]312-staretsky aimed a blow at [his]190-kreisler head .
