[Soltyk]205-soltyk threw [his]205-soltyk arms up : [Kreisler]190-kreisler was struggling towards [his]190-kreisler feet : [he]190-kreisler fell face forwards on top of [him]205-soltyk . , [Kreisler]190-kreisler thought this was a new attack . [He]190-kreisler seized [Soltyk]205-soltyk ’s body round the middle , rolling over on top of [it]1601-it . [It]1601-it was quite limp . [He]190-kreisler then thought [the other man]3773-the other man had fainted ; ruptured himself---- ? [He]190-kreisler drew back quickly . Two hands grasped [him]190-kreisler and flung [him]190-kreisler down on [his]190-kreisler stomach . This time [his]190-kreisler glasses went . Scrambling after [them]1603-them , [he]190-kreisler remembered [his]190-kreisler Browning , which [he]190-kreisler had dropped . [He]190-kreisler shot [his]190-kreisler hands out to left and right — forgetting [his]190-kreisler glasses — to recover the Browning . [He]190-kreisler felt that a blow was a long time in coming . “ [He]190-kreisler ’s dead ! [He]190-kreisler ’s dead ! [He]190-kreisler ’s dead ! ”[312-staretsky] [Staretsky]312-staretsky ’s voice , announcing that in French , [he]190-kreisler heard at the same time as [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s saying : “ What are [you]190-kreisler looking for ? Come quickly ! ”[312-staretsky] “ Where is the Browning ? ”[190-kreisler] [he]190-kreisler asked . At that moment [his]190-kreisler hand struck [his]190-kreisler glasses . [He]190-kreisler put them on and got to [his]190-kreisler feet . At [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s words [he]190-kreisler had a feeling of a new order of things having set in , that [he]190-kreisler remembered having experienced once or twice before in life . They came in a fresh surprising tone . It was as though they were the first words [he]190-kreisler had heard that day . They seemed to imply a sudden removal , a journey , novel conditions . “ Come along , [I]207-the russian ’ve got [the Browning]326-browning . There ’s no time to lose . ”[207-the russian] It was all over ; [he]190-kreisler must embrace practical affairs . [The Russian]207-the russian ’s voice was businesslike . Something had finished for [him]190-kreisler , too . [Kreisler]190-kreisler saw [the others]904-the others standing in [a peaceful group]1605-a peaceful group ; [the doctor]4052-the doctor was getting up from beside [Soltyk]205-soltyk . [Staretsky]312-staretsky rushed over to [Kreisler]190-kreisler , and shook [his]312-staretsky fist in [his]312-staretsky face and tried to speak . But [his]312-staretsky mouth was twisted down at the corners , and [he]312-staretsky could hardly see . The palms of [his]312-staretsky hands pressed into each of [his]312-staretsky eyes , the next moment [he]312-staretsky was sobbing , walking back to [[his]312-staretsky friends]2310-his friends . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s bolt was shot . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had been unsatisfactory . All had ended in a silly accident , which might have awkward consequences for [his]190-kreisler second . It was hardly a real corpse at all . But something was sent to console [him]190-kreisler . [The police]3878-the police had got wind of the duel . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko , [[his]311-bitzenko compatriot]1609-his compatriot and [Kreisler]190-kreisler were walking down [the field]4010-the field , intending to get into [the road]476-the road at [the . farther end]1612-the . farther end , and walk to [the nearest station]1613-the nearest station . [The taxi]1614-the taxi had been sent away , [Kreisler]190-kreisler having no more money , and [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s feeling in the matter being that should [Kreisler]190-kreisler fall , [a corpse]1615-a corpse can always find [some sentimental soul]1616-some sentimental soul to look after it . And there was always [the Morgue]1617-the morgue , dramatic and satisfactory . [They]1618-they were already half - way along [the field]4010-the field when [a car]4003-a car passed [them]1618-they on the other side of the hedge at full tilt . [The Russian]207-the russian was once more in [his]207-the russian element . [His]207-the russian face cleared . [He]207-the russian looked ten years younger . In the occupants of [the car]490-the car [he]207-the russian had recognized [members of [the police force]3967-the police force]1622-members of the police force ! Calling “ Run ! ”[190-kreisler] to [Kreisler]190-kreisler [he]190-kreisler took to [his]190-kreisler heels , followed by [[his]190-kreisler young fellow - second]1624-his young fellow - second , whose neck shot in and out , and whose great bow - legs could almost be heard twanging as [he]1624-his young fellow - second ran . [They]1618-they reached a hedge , ran along the farther side of [it]1625-it . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was bent double as though to escape a rain of bullets . Eventually [he]311-bitzenko was seen careering across an open space quite near [the river]2270-the river , which lay a couple of hundred yards beyond [the lower end of [the field]4010-the field]1627-the lower end of the field . There [he]311-bitzenko lay ambushed for a moment , behind a shrub . Then [he]311-bitzenko darted forward again , and eventually disappeared along [the high road]1209-the high road in a cloud of dust . [[His]190-kreisler athletic young friend]1630-his athletic young friend made straight for [the railway station]1631-the railway station , which [he]311-bitzenko reached without incident and returned at once to [Paris]1-paris . [Kreisler]190-kreisler conformed to [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko ’s programme of flight . [He]190-kreisler scrambled through the hedge , crossed [the road]476-the road and escaped almost unnoticed . The truth was that [the Russian]207-the russian had attracted the attention of [the police]3878-the police to such an extent by [his]207-the russian striking flight , that without a moment ’s hesitation [they]3878-the police had bolted helter - skelter after [him]207-the russian . [They]3878-the police contented [themselves]3878-the police with a parting shout or two at [Kreisler]190-kreisler . Duelling was a very venial offence ; capture in these cases was not a matter of the least moment . But [they]3878-the police were so impressed by [the Russian]207-the russian ’s businesslike way of disappearing that [they]3878-the police imagined ' this must have been a curiously immoral sort of duel . That [he]190-kreisler was [the principal]4038-the principal [they]3878-the police did not doubt for a moment . So [they]3878-the police went after [him]190-kreisler in full cry , rousing [two or three villagers]1635-two or three villagers in [their]3878-the police passage , who followed at [their]3878-the police heels , pouring with frantic hullabaloo in [the direction of [Paris]1-paris]1636-the direction of paris . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko , however , with great resourcefulness , easily outwitted [them]3878-the police . [He]311-bitzenko crossed [the Seine]90-the seine near [St. Cloud]101-st. cloud , and got back to [Paris]1-paris in time to read the afternoon newspaper account of the duel and flight with infantile solemnity and calm . Five days after this , in the morning , [Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler mounted the steps of [the police - station of [a small town near the German frontier]1638-a small town near the german frontier]1637-the police - station of a small town near the german frontier . [He]190-kreisler was going to give [himself]190-kreisler up . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko had pictured [[his]311-bitzenko principal]3984-his principal , in the event of [his]3984-his principal succeeding against [Soltyk]205-soltyk , seeking rapidly by [train]1640-train [the German frontier]1641-the german frontier , disguised in some extraordinary manner . Had the case been suggested to [him]190-kreisler of [a man in this position without sufficient money in [his]1642-a man in this position without sufficient money in his pocket pocket]1642-a man in this position without sufficient money in his pocket to buy a ticket , [he]190-kreisler would then have imagined [a melodramatic figure hurrying through [France]67-france , dodging and dogged by [the police]3878-the police]1643-a melodramatic figure hurrying through france , dodging and dogged by the police , defying a thousand perils . Whether [Kreisler]190-kreisler were still under the spell of [the Russian]3839-the russian or not , this was the course , more or less , [he]190-kreisler took . [He]190-kreisler could be trusted not to go near [Paris]1-paris . [That city]1646-that city dominated all [his]190-kreisler maledictions . [The police]3878-the police disturbing the last act of [his]190-kreisler sanguinary farce was a similar contretemps to [Soltyk]205-soltyk ’s fingers in [his]190-kreisler throat . At the last moment everything had begun to go wrong . [He]190-kreisler had not prepared for it , because , as though from cunning , [the world]2089-the world had shown no tendency up till then to interfere . [Soltyk]205-soltyk had died when [his]205-soltyk back was turned , so to speak . [He]190-kreisler got the contrary of comfort out of the thought that [he]190-kreisler could claim to have done the deed .. [The police]3878-the police had rushed in and broken things off short , swept everything away , ended the banquet in a brutal raid . A deep sore , a shocked and dislocated feeling remained in [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s mind . [He]190-kreisler had been hurried so much ! [He]190-kreisler had never needed leisure , breathing space , so much . The disaster of [Soltyk]205-soltyk ’s death was raw on [him]190-kreisler ! Had [he]190-kreisler been given time — only a little time — [he]190-kreisler might have put that to rights . ( This sinister regret could only imply a possible mutilation of the corpse . ) [A dead man]1650-a dead man has no feeling . [He]1650-a dead man can be treated as an object and hustled away . But [a living man]1651-a living man needs time ! — time ! Does not [a living man]1651-a living man need so much time to develop [his]1651-a living man movements , to lord it with [his]1651-a living man thoughtful body , to unroll [his]1651-a living man will ? Time is what [he]1651-a living man needs ! As [a tramp being]1653-a tramp being hustled away from [a cafe]3572-a cafe protests , at each jerk [the waiter]3003-the waiter gives [him]1653-a tramp being , that [he]1653-a tramp being is [a human being]1656-a human being , probably [a free human being]1657-a free human being — yes , probably free ; so [Kreisler]190-kreisler complained to [his]190-kreisler fate that [he]190-kreisler was [a living man]1651-a living man , that [he]190-kreisler required time — that above all it was time [he]190-kreisler needed — to settle [his]190-kreisler affairs and withdraw from life . But [his]190-kreisler fate was [a harsh Prussian gendarme]1659-a harsh prussian gendarme . [He]190-kreisler whined and blustered to no effect . [He]190-kreisler was superstitious as well in the usual way about this decease . In [his]190-kreisler spiritless and brooding tramp [he]190-kreisler questioned if it were not [he]190-kreisler that had died and not [Soltyk]205-soltyk , and if it were not [his]190-kreisler ghost that was now wandering off nowhere in particular . [One franc and a great many coppers]1660-one franc and a great many coppers remained to [him]190-kreisler . As [he]190-kreisler jumped from [field]1661-field to [road]1662-road and [road]1662-road to [field]1661-field again , in [his]190-kreisler flight , [they]1660-one franc and a great many coppers rose and fell in a little leaden wave in [his]190-kreisler pocket , breaking dully on [his]190-kreisler thigh . This little wave rose and fell many times , till [he]190-kreisler began to wait for it , and its monotonous grace . It was like a sigh . It heaved and clashed down in a foiled way . [He]190-kreisler spent the money that evening on a meal in [a village]1665-a village . The night was dry and was passed in an empty barge . Next day , at four in the afternoon , [he]190-kreisler arrived at [Meaux]102-meaux . Here [he]190-kreisler exchanged [his]190-kreisler entire wardrobe for [a very shabby workman]1666-a very shabby workman ’s outfit , gaining seven francs and fifty centimes on the exchange . [He]190-kreisler caught [the early train]1667-the early train for [Rheims]103-rheims , travelling thirty - five kilometres of [his]190-kreisler journey at a sou a kilometre , got a meal near [the station]1668-the station , and took another ticket to [Verdun]104-verdun . Believing [himself]190-kreisler nearer [the frontier]2833-the frontier than [he]190-kreisler actually was , [he]190-kreisler set out on foot . At [the next large town]1670-the next large town , [Pontlieux]105-pontlieux , [he]190-kreisler had too hearty a meal . [He]190-kreisler had exhausted [his]190-kreisler stock of money long before the frontier was reached . For two days [he]190-kreisler had eaten hardly anything ; and tramped on in a dogged and careless spirit . The nearness of [the German frontier]1641-the german frontier began to rise like a wall in front of [him]190-kreisler . This question had to be answered : Did [he]190-kreisler want to cross [it]1641-the german frontier after all ? [His]190-kreisler answer was to mount the steps of [the local gendarmerie]1672-the local gendarmerie . [His]190-kreisler Prussian severity of countenance , now that [he]190-kreisler was dressed in every point like [a vagabond , without hat]1673-a vagabond , without hat and [his]190-kreisler hair disordered , five days ’ beard on [his]190-kreisler chin — this sternness of [the German warrior]1674-the german warrior gave [him]190-kreisler the appearance of [a scowling ruffian]1675-a scowling ruffian . [The agent on duty]1676-the agent on duty , who barred [his]190-kreisler passage brutally before the door of [the inner office]1677-the inner office , scowling too , classed [him]190-kreisler as [a depraved cut - throat vagabond]1678-a depraved cut - throat vagabond , and considered [his]190-kreisler voluntary entrance into [the police - station]1679-the police - station as an act not only highly suspicious and unaccountable in itself , but of the last insolence . “ Qu’est - ce qu’il te faut ? ”[1680-the agent] “ Foir le Commissaire , ”[190-kreisler] returned [Kreisler]190-kreisler . “ Tu ne peux pas le voir . Il n’y est pas . ”[190-kreisler] A few more laconic sentences followed , [the agent]1680-the agent reiterating sulkily that [the magistrate]1681-the magistrate was not [there]2057-there . But [he]1680-the agent was eyeing [Kreisler]190-kreisler doubtfully and turning something over in [his]1680-the agent mind . The day before , [two Germans]1683-two germans had been arrested in [the neighbourhood]461-the neighbourhood as [spies]2194-spies , and were now locked up in [this building]1686-this building until further evidence should be collected on the affair . It is extremely imprudent for [a German]2064-a german to loiter on [the frontier]2833-the frontier on entering [France]67-france . It is much wiser for [him]2064-a german to push on at once — neither looking to right nor left — pretending especially not to notice [hills]1689-hills , unnatural military looking protuberances , [ramparts]1690-ramparts , etc . — to hurry on as rapidly as possible to the interior . But [the two men in question]1691-the two men in question were [carpenters]1692-carpenters by profession , and [both]1693-both carried huge foot - rules in [their]1693-both pockets . [The local authorities on this discovery]1694-the local authorities on this discovery were in a state of the deepest consternation . [They]1694-the local authorities on this discovery shut [them]1694-the local authorities on this discovery up , with [their]1694-the local authorities on this discovery implements , in [the most inaccessible depths of [the local police - station]1696-the local police - station]1695-the most inaccessible depths of the local police - station . And it was in the doorway of [this building]1686-this building — [all the intermittent inhabitants of which]1698-all the intermittent inhabitants of which were in a state of hysterical speculation , that [Kreisler]190-kreisler had presented [himself]190-kreisler . [The agent]1680-the agent , who had recognized [a German]2064-a german by [his]1680-the agent accent and manner , at last turned and disappeared through the door , telling [him]190-kreisler to wait . [He]190-kreisler reappeared with [several superiors]1701-several superiors . [All of [them]1701-several superiors]1095-all of them crowded in the doorway and surveyed [Kreisler]190-kreisler blankly . [One]2062-one asked in a voice of triumphant suspicion : “ And what are [you]190-kreisler doing [there]2057-there , [[my]2062-one good fellow]4069-my good fellow ? ”[2062-one] “ [I]1701-several superiors had [tuel]328-tuel , and killed [the man]2084-the man ; [I]1701-several superiors have walked for more days--- ”[1701-several superiors] “ Yes , [we]1701-several superiors know all about that ! ”[1701-several superiors] “ So [you]190-kreisler had a duel , eh ? ”[3900-another] asked [another]3900-another , and [they]1701-several superiors all laughed with nervous suddenness at the picture of [this vagabond]1705-this vagabond defending [his]1705-this vagabond honour at twenty paces . “ Well , is that all [you]190-kreisler have to say ? ”[1701-several superiors] “ [I]3900-another would eat . ”[3900-another] “ Yes ! [[your]190-kreisler two friends]4071-your two friends inside also have big appetites . But come to the point . Have [you]190-kreisler anything to tell [us]1701-several superiors about [[your]190-kreisler compatriots]4072-your compatriots inside there ? ”[1701-several superiors] Since [his]1705-this vagabond throttling by [Soltyk]205-soltyk , [Kreisler]190-kreisler had changed . [He]190-kreisler knew [he]190-kreisler was beaten . There was nothing to do but to die . [His]190-kreisler body ran to the German frontier as a chicken ’s does down [a yard]1706-a yard , headless , from [the block]1707-the block . [Kreisler]190-kreisler did not understand [the official]1708-the official . [He]190-kreisler muttered that [he]190-kreisler was hungry . [He]190-kreisler could hardly stand . Leaning [his]190-kreisler shoulder against the wall , [he]190-kreisler stood with [his]190-kreisler eyes on the ground . [He]190-kreisler was making [himself]190-kreisler at [home]2396-home ! “ What a nerve ! ”[190-kreisler] “ Va t’en ! If [you]190-kreisler do n’t want to tell [us]1710-us anything , clear out . Be quick about it ! A pretty lot of trouble [you]190-kreisler cursed Germans are giving [us]1710-us . [You]190-kreisler ’ll none of [you]190-kreisler speak when it comes to the point . [You]190-kreisler all stand staring like boobies . But that wo n’t pay here . Off [you]190-kreisler go ! ”[1710-us] [They]1710-us all turned back into [the office]1711-the office , and slammed the door . [The agent]1680-the agent stood before it again , looking truculently at [Kreisler]190-kreisler , [He]1680-the agent said : “ Passez votre chemin ! Do n’t stand gaping there ! ”[1680-the agent] . Then , giving [him]190-kreisler a shake , [he]1680-the agent hustled [him]190-kreisler to the top of the steps . A parting shove sent [him]190-kreisler staggering down into [the road]476-the road . [Kreisler]190-kreisler walked on for a little . Eventually , in [a quiet square]1714-a quiet square , near [the entrance to [the town]424-the town]1715-the entrance to the town , [he]190-kreisler fell on a bench , drew [his]190-kreisler legs up and went to sleep . At ten o’clock , [the town]424-the town lethargically retiring , all [its]424-the town legs moving slowly , like a spent insect , heavily boarding itself in , [an agent]474-an agent came gradually along [the square]1719-the square . [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s visit to [the police - station]1679-the police - station was not known to [this one]1721-this one . [He]1680-the agent stopped opposite [the sleeping Kreisler]1722-the sleeping kreisler , surveying [him]190-kreisler with lawful indignation . “ En voila un joli gigolo ! ”[1680-the agent] [He]1680-the agent swayed energetically up to [him]190-kreisler . “ Eh ! le copain ! Tu voudrais coucher a la belle étoile ? ”[1680-the agent] [He]1680-the agent shook [him]190-kreisler . “ Oh , la ! Tu ne peux pas dormir ici ! Houp ! Dépêches - toi . Mets - toi debout ! ”[1680-the agent] [Kreisler]190-kreisler responded only by a tired movement as though to bury [his]190-kreisler skull in the bench . [A more violent jerk]1723-a more violent jerk rolled [him]190-kreisler on the ground . [He]190-kreisler woke up and protested in German , with a sort of dull asperity . [He]190-kreisler got on to [his]190-kreisler feet . At the sound of the familiar gutturals of [the neighbouring Empire]1724-the neighbouring empire , [the agent]1680-the agent became differently angry . [Kreisler]190-kreisler stood there , muttering partly in German and partly in French ; [he]190-kreisler was very tired . [He]190-kreisler was telling bitterly of [his]190-kreisler attempt to get into [the police - station]1679-the police - station , and of [his]190-kreisler inhospitable reception . [The agent]1680-the agent understood several words of German — notably “ ja ”[1680-the agent] and “ lager beer ”[1680-the agent] and “ essen . ”[1680-the agent] The consequence was that [he]190-kreisler always thought [he]190-kreisler understood more than was really said in that language . However much might be actually intended on any given occasion by the words of that profound and teeming tongue , it could never equal in scope , intensity , and meaning what [he]190-kreisler heard . So [he]190-kreisler was convinced that [Kreisler]190-kreisler was threatening an invasion , and scoffed loudly in reply . [He]190-kreisler understood [Kreisler]190-kreisler to assert that [the town in which [they]1729-they stood]1728-the town in which they stood would soon belong to [Germany]4-germany , and that [he]190-kreisler would then sleep , not on a bench , but in the best bed [[their]1729-they dirty little hole of [a village]1665-a village]1730-their dirty little hole of a village could offer . [He]190-kreisler approached [him]190-kreisler threateningly . And eventually [the functionary]1732-the functionary distinctly heard [himself]190-kreisler apostrophized as [a “ sneaking ‘ flic ’ , ”[190-kreisler] a “ dirty peeler]4073-a “ sneaking ‘ flic ’ , ” a “ dirty peeler . ”[190-kreisler] At that [he]190-kreisler laid [his]190-kreisler hand on [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s collar , and threw [him]190-kreisler in the direction of [the police - station]1679-the police - station . [He]190-kreisler had miscalculated the distance . [Kreisler]190-kreisler , weak for want of food , fell at [his]190-kreisler feet ; but , getting up , scuffled a short time . Then , it occurring to [him]190-kreisler that here was an unhoped for way of getting a dinner , and being lodged after all in [the bureau de police]1734-the bureau de police , [he]190-kreisler suddenly became passive and complaisant . Arrived at [the police - station]1679-the police - station — with several revolts against the brutal handling to which [he]190-kreisler was subjected — [he]190-kreisler was met at the door by [the same inhospitable man]1736-the same inhospitable man . Exasperated beyond measure at [this unwelcome guest]1737-this unwelcome guest turning up again , [the man]2084-the man sent [[his]2084-the man comrade]1739-his comrade into [the office]1711-the office to report , while [he]2084-the man held [Kreisler]190-kreisler . [He]2084-the man held [him]190-kreisler as a restive horse is held , and jerked [him]190-kreisler several times against the wall , as if [he]190-kreisler had been showing signs of resistance . [Two men]2718-two men , one that [he]190-kreisler had formerly seen , came and looked at [him]190-kreisler . No effort was made to discover if [he]190-kreisler were really at fault or not . By this time [they]2718-two men were quite convinced that [he]190-kreisler was [a desperate character]1742-a desperate character , and if not [a spy]1743-a spy , then anyway [a murderer]1744-a murderer , although [they]2718-two men were inclined to regard [him]190-kreisler as a criminal mystery . At all events [they]2718-two men no longer could question [his]190-kreisler right to a night ’s lodging . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was led to [a cell]1745-a cell , given some bread and water at [his]190-kreisler urgent request , and left alone . On the following morning [he]190-kreisler was taken up before [the commissaire de police]1746-the commissaire de police . When [Kreisler]190-kreisler was brought in , [this gentleman]1522-this gentleman had just finished cross - examining for the fifteenth time [the two German carpenters who were retained as [spies]2194-spies]1748-the two german carpenters who were retained as spies . [They]2718-two men were not let alone for an instant . [They]2718-two men would be dragged out of [[their]2718-two men cells]1750-their cells three times in the course of an afternoon , as often as a new and brilliant idea should strike one of [the numerous staff of [the police - station]1679-the police - station]1751-the numerous staff of the police - station . [They]2718-two men would be confronted with [their]2718-two men foot - rules , and watched in breathless silence ; or be keenly cross - questioned , confused and contradicted as to the exact hour at which [they]2718-two men had lunched the day before [their]2718-two men arrest . [The commissaire]1753-the commissaire was perspiring all over with the intensity of [his]1753-the commissaire last effort to detect something . [Kreisler]190-kreisler was led in , and prevented from finishing any sentence or of becoming in any way intelligible during a quarter of an hour by the furious interruptions of [the enraged officer]1754-the enraged officer . At last [he]190-kreisler succeeded in asserting that [he]190-kreisler was quite unacquainted with [the two carpenters]1755-the two carpenters ; moreover , that all [he]190-kreisler needed was food ; that [he]190-kreisler had decided to give [himself]190-kreisler up and await the decision of [the [Paris]1-paris authorities]1756-the paris authorities as regards the deed . If [they]1756-the paris authorities were not going to take any action , [he]190-kreisler would return to [Paris]1-paris — at least , as soon as [he]190-kreisler had received a certain letter ; and [he]190-kreisler gave [his]190-kreisler address . [The commissaire]1753-the commissaire considered [him]190-kreisler with exhausted animosity and [he]190-kreisler was sent back to [[his]190-kreisler cell]1758-his cell . [He]190-kreisler slept the greater part of the day , but the next [he]190-kreisler spent nervous and awake . In the afternoon a full confirmation of [his]190-kreisler story reached [the authorities]1759-the authorities . It was likely that the following morning [he]190-kreisler would be sent to [Paris]1-paris . It meant , then , that [he]190-kreisler was going to be tried as [a kind of murderer]1760-a kind of murderer . [He]190-kreisler could not allege complete accident . The thought of [Paris]1-paris , [the vociferous courts]1761-the vociferous courts , the ennuis of a criminal case about this affair , so thoroughly ended and boringly out of date , disturbed [him]190-kreisler extremely . Then [the Russian]207-the russian — [he]190-kreisler would have to see [him]190-kreisler again . [Kreisler]190-kreisler felt that [he]190-kreisler was being terribly worried once more . Sorrow for [himself]190-kreisler bowed [him]190-kreisler down . This journey to [Paris]1-paris resembled [his]190-kreisler crossing of [the German frontier]1641-the german frontier . [He]190-kreisler had felt that it was impossible to see [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father . That represented an effort [he]190-kreisler would do anything to avoid . Resentment against [[his]190-kreisler parent]781-his parent had vanished . It was this that made a meeting so difficult . It was [a stranger]509-a stranger , with an ill will that had survived [his]190-kreisler own , awaiting [him]190-kreisler . Noise , piercing noise , effort , awaited [him]190-kreisler revengefully . [He]190-kreisler knew exactly what [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father would do and say . If there had been a single item that [he]190-kreisler could not forecast ! — But there was not the least item . [Paris]1-paris was the same . The energy and obstinacy of [the rest of [the world]2089-the world]1389-the rest of the world , the world that would question [him]190-kreisler and drag [him]190-kreisler about , these frightened [him]190-kreisler as something mad . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko appealed most to [this new - born timidity]1769-this new - born timidity . [Bitzenko]311-bitzenko was like some favourite dish [a man]2077-a man has one day eaten too much of , and will never be able again to enjoy , or even support . On the other hand , [he]190-kreisler became quite used to [[his]190-kreisler cell]1758-his cell . [His]190-kreisler mind was sick , and [this room]2507-this room had a clinical severity . [It]2507-this room had all the economical elements of a place in which a human operation might be performed . [He]190-kreisler became fond of it as [patients]1773-patients get an appetite for the leanness of convalescent life . [He]190-kreisler lay on [his]190-kreisler bed . [He]190-kreisler turned over the shell of many empty and depressing hours [he]190-kreisler had lived . [He]190-kreisler took particular pleasure in these listless concave shapes . [His]190-kreisler “ good times ”[190-kreisler] were avoided . Days spent with [[his]190-kreisler present stepmother]2852-his present stepmother , before [[his]190-kreisler father]402-his father knew [her]2852-his present stepmother , gave [him]190-kreisler a particularly numbing and nondescript feeling . [He]190-kreisler sat up , listening to the noises from [the neighbouring rooms]1776-the neighbouring rooms and [corridors]1777-corridors . It began to sound to [him]190-kreisler like one steady preparation for [his]190-kreisler removal . [Steps]330-steps bustled about getting this ready and getting that ready . [The police - station]1679-the police - station had cost [him]190-kreisler some trouble to enter . But [they]1779-they had been attracted to [each other]370-each other from the start . Something in the form of an illicit attachment now existed between [them]1779-they . [Buildings]1781-buildings are [female]1782-female . There is no such thing as [a male building]1783-a male building . [This practical and pretentious small modern edifice]1784-this practical and pretentious small modern edifice was having its romance . [Otto Kreisler]190-kreisler was its romance . [It]190-kreisler was now warning [him]190-kreisler . It echoed sharply and insistently the feet of [its policemen]1785-its policemen . After [his]190-kreisler evening meal [he]190-kreisler took up [his]190-kreisler bed in [his]190-kreisler arms and placed it on the opposite side of [the cell]1786-the cell , under the window . [He]190-kreisler sat there for some time as though resting after this effort . The muttering of [two children]1787-two children on a doorstep in [the street below]1788-the street below came to [him]190-kreisler on the evening light with melodramatic stops and emptiness . [It]190-kreisler bore with it an image , like an old picture , bituminous and with a graceful , queer formality . It fixed itself before [him]190-kreisler like a mirage . [He]190-kreisler watched it muttering . [He]190-kreisler began slowly drawing off [his]190-kreisler boots . [He]190-kreisler took out the laces , and tied them together for greater strength . Then [he]190-kreisler tore several strips off [his]190-kreisler shirt , and made a short cord of them . [He]190-kreisler went through these actions deliberately and deftly , as though it were a routine and daily happening . [He]190-kreisler measured the drop from the bar of the ventilator , calculating the necessary length of cord , like [a boy preparing the accessories of some game]1789-a boy preparing the accessories of some game . It was only a game , too . [He]190-kreisler realized what these proceedings meant , but shunned the idea that it was serious . Just as [an unmoral man with a disinclination to write a necessary letter]1790-an unmoral man with a disinclination to write a necessary letter takes up the pen , resolving to begin it merely and writes more and more until it is , in fact , completed , so [Kreisler]190-kreisler proceeded with [his]190-kreisler task . Standing on [his]190-kreisler bed , [he]190-kreisler attached the cord to the ventilator . [He]190-kreisler tested its strength by holding it some inches from the top , and then , [his]190-kreisler shoulders hunched , swaying [his]190-kreisler whole weight languidly on it for a moment . Adjusting the noose , [he]190-kreisler smoothed [his]190-kreisler hair back after [he]190-kreisler had slipped it over [his]190-kreisler head . [He]190-kreisler made as though to kick the bed away , playfully , then stood still , staring in front of [him]190-kreisler . The last moment must be one of realization . [He]190-kreisler was not [a coward]795-a coward . [His]190-kreisler caution was due to [his]190-kreisler mistrust of some streaks of [him]190-kreisler , the sex streak the powerfullest . A sort of heavy confusion burst up as [he]190-kreisler withdrew the restraint . It reminded [him]190-kreisler of [Soltyk]205-soltyk ’s hands on this throat . The same throttling feeling returned . The blood bulged in [his]190-kreisler head . [He]190-kreisler felt dizzy ; it was the [Soltyk]205-soltyk struggle over again . But , as with [Soltyk]205-soltyk , [he]190-kreisler did not resist . [He]190-kreisler gently worked the bed outwards from under [him]190-kreisler , giving it a last steady shove . [He]190-kreisler hung , gradually choking , the last thing [he]190-kreisler was conscious of , [his]190-kreisler tongue . [Herr Kreisler]190-kreisler paid without comment what was claimed by the landlord in [Paris]1-paris for [[[his]190-kreisler son]2574-his son ’s room]1800-his son ’s room ; and writing to [the authorities at [the frontier town]1802-the frontier town]1801-the authorities at the frontier town about the burial , paid exactly the sum demanded by [this town]1803-this town for disposing of the body . [Bertha]177-bertha ’s white face was close up against one of the narrow panes , above the lace curtain . There were four and a half feet of window on either side of the door . [Her]177-bertha eyes were round , vacant , and dark , the features very white and heavy , the mouth steadily open in painful lines . As [he]190-kreisler looked the face drew gradually away , and then disappeared into the melodramatic night . It was a large trapped fly on the pane . It withdrew with a glutinous , sweet slowness . The . heavy white jowl seemed pulling itself out of some fluid trap where it had been caught like a weighty body . [Tarr]122-tarr knew how the pasty flesh would nestle against the furs , the shoulders swing , the legs move just as much as was necessary for progress , with no movement of the hips . Everything about [her]177-bertha in the chilly night would give an impression of warmth and system . The sleek cloth fitting the square shoulders tightly , the underclothes carefully tight as well , the breath from [her]177-bertha nostrils the slight steam from a contented machine . [Bertha]177-bertha was still being taken in carefully prepared doses of an hour a day : from half - past four to a quarter to six . [Any one else]1828-any one else would have found this much of [Bertha]177-bertha insupportable under any conditions . But [Tarr]122-tarr ’s eccentric soul had been used to such far greater doses that this was the minimum [he]122-tarr considered necessary for a cure . [Tarr]122-tarr came to [her]177-bertha every day with the regularity of [an old gentleman]1829-an old gentleman at a German “ Bad ”[1829-an old gentleman] taking [his]1829-an old gentleman spring water at the regulation hour . [His]122-tarr daily visits , with [their]1830-their brutal regularity , did [her]177-bertha as much harm as they did [him]122-tarr good . [Death]174-death had made [himself]122-tarr de la partie . [Kreisler]190-kreisler had left [her]177-bertha alone for a few days . This is what had occupied [him]190-kreisler . [He]122-tarr was annoyed at the backwardness of [his]122-tarr senses . [His]122-tarr mind stepped in , determined to do [their]1839-their business for [them]1839-their . [He]122-tarr put [his]122-tarr arm round [her]177-bertha waist , and planting [his]122-tarr lips fully on [hers]177-bertha , began kissing [her]177-bertha . [He]122-tarr slipped [his]122-tarr hands sideways beneath [her]177-bertha coat , and pressed an athletic , sinuous hulk against [him]122-tarr . The various bulging and retreating contact of [her]177-bertha body brought monotonous German reminders . It was the first time [he]122-tarr had kissed [her]177-bertha . [She]177-bertha showed no bashfulness or disinclination , but no return . Was [she]177-bertha in the unfortunate position of an unawakened mass ; and had [she]177-bertha so rationalized [her]177-bertha intimate possessions that there was no precocious fancy left until mature animal ardour was set up ? [He]122-tarr felt as though [he]122-tarr were embracing a tiger , who was not unsympathetic , but rather surprised . Perhaps [he]122-tarr had been too sudden . [He]122-tarr ran [his]122-tarr hand upwards along [her]177-bertha body . All was statuesquely genuine . However , [we]4110-we can go further . Consider the content of what [we]4110-we call art . A statue is art , as [you]610-man said ; [you]1878-you are life . There is bad art and bad life . [We]4110-we will only consider the good . A statue , then , is a dead thing ; a lump of wood or stone . Its lines and masses are its soul . Anything living , quick and changing , is bad art , always ; [naked men]4121-naked men and [women]2149-women are the worst art of all , because there are fewer semi - dead things about [them]4121-naked men . The shell of the tortoise , the plumage of a bird , makes these animals approach nearer to art . Soft , quivering and quick flesh is as far from art as an object can be . ”[1867-her] “ Art is merely the dead , then ? ”[1867-her] “ No , but deadness is the first condition of art . A hippopotamus ’s armoured hide , a turtle ’s shell , feathers or machinery on the one hand ; that opposed to naked pulsing and moving of the soft inside of life , along with infinite elasticity and consciousness of movement , on the other . “[1867-her] Deadness , then , ” [Tarr]122-tarr went on , “[1867-her] in the limited sense in which [we]1876-we use that word is the first condition of art . The second is absence of soul , in the sentimental human sense . The lines and masses of the statue are [its]1877-it soul . No restless , quick , flame - like ego is imagined for the inside of [it]1877-it . [It]1877-it has no inside . This is another condition of art ; to have no inside , nothing [you]1878-you can not see . Instead , then , of being something impelled like a machine by a little egoistic fire inside , it lives soullessly and deadly by its frontal lines and masses . ” [Tarr]122-tarr was developing , from [her]4123-she point of view , too much shop . [He]190-kreisler was trying to get back into sex again out of a little puddle of Art where [he]190-kreisler felt [he]190-kreisler was gradually expiring . What [I]0-i mean is this . [He]190-kreisler was [an art student]1890-an art student without any talent , and was leading a dull , slovenly existence like thousands of others in the same case . [He]190-kreisler was very hard up . Things were grim that way too . The sex - instinct of [the average man]2453-the average man , then , had become perverted into a silly false channel . Or it might be better to say that [his]190-kreisler elementary art - instinct had been rooted out of sex and one or two other things , where it was both useful and ornamental , and naturally flourished , and had been exalted into a department by itself , where it bungled and wrecked everything . It is a measure the need of which hits the eye in these days to keep the art - instinct of the run of [men]518-men in its place . These art - spirits should be kept firmly embedded in sex , in fighting , and in affairs . The nearest the general run of [men]518-men can get to Art is Action . Real , bustling , bloody action is what [they]518-men want ! Sex is [their]518-men form of art : the battle of existence in enterprise , [Commerce]111-commerce , is [their]518-men picture . The moment [they]518-men think or dream [you]1894-you get an immense weight of cheap stagnating passion that becomes a menace to the health of [the world]2089-the world . [A “ cultured ”[1897-a “ free ” one] nation]1896-a “ cultured ” nation is as great a menace as [a “ free ”[1897-a “ free ” one] one]1897-a “ free ” one . The answer to [the men who object to this as high - handed]1898-the men who object to this as high - handed is plain enough . Then [he]122-tarr suddenly dropped that occupation , pushed the door open and went into [[his]122-tarr studio]1943-his studio . The moonlight came heavily through the windows . Kiss [me]122-tarr ! ”[122-tarr] [Tarr]122-tarr crawled towards [Bertha]177-bertha that day on the back of [a Place St. Michel bus]1954-a place st. michel bus . [He]122-tarr did not like [his]122-tarr job . The secret of [his]122-tarr visits to [Bertha]177-bertha and interminable liaison was that [he]122-tarr really never had meant to leave [her]177-bertha at all , [he]122-tarr reflected . [He]122-tarr had not meant to leave [her]177-bertha altogether . [He]122-tarr was just playing . Or rather , a long debt of disgraceful behaviour was accumulating , that [he]122-tarr knew would have to be met . It was deliberately increased by [him]122-tarr , because [he]122-tarr knew [he]122-tarr would not repudiate it . But it would have been absurd not to try to escape . To - day [he]122-tarr must break the fact to [Bertha]177-bertha that [he]122-tarr could no longer regard [himself]122-tarr as responsible . [He]122-tarr ' was faced with the necessity , for the first time , of seriously bargaining . The debt was not to be repudiated , but [he]122-tarr must tell [her]177-bertha that [he]122-tarr only had [himself]122-tarr to pay with , and that [he]122-tarr had been seized by [somebody else]586-somebody else . [He]122-tarr passed through [her]177-bertha iron gateway with a final stealth , although making [his]122-tarr boots sound loudly on the gravel . It was like entering [a vault]1956-a vault , the trees looked like weeds ; the meaning or taste of everything , of course , had died . [The concierge]2561-the concierge looked like a new one . [He]122-tarr had bought a flower for [his]122-tarr buttonhole . [He]122-tarr kept smelling it as [he]122-tarr approached [the house]2588-the house . During the last week or so [he]122-tarr had got into the habit of writing [his]122-tarr letters at [Bertha]177-bertha ’s , to fill up the time . Occasionally [he]122-tarr would do a drawing of [her]177-bertha ( a thing [he]122-tarr had never done formerly ) to vary the monotony . This time there would be no letter - writing . This visit would be more like the old ones . “ Come in , [Sorbert]270-sorbert , ”[177-bertha] [she]177-bertha said , on opening the door . It was emphasizing the fact of the formality of the terms on which [they]1959-they at present met . Any prerogative of past and more familiar times was proudly rejected . There was the same depressed atmosphere as the day before , and the days preceding that . [She]177-bertha appeared stale , somehow deteriorated and shabby , [her]177-bertha worth decreased , and extremely pitiable . [Her]177-bertha “ reserve ”[177-bertha] ( a natural result of the new equivocal circumstances ) removed [her]177-bertha to a distance , as it seemed ; it also shut [her]177-bertha up in [herself]177-bertha , in an unhealthy , dreary , and faded atmosphere . [She]177-bertha was shut up with a mass of reserves and secrets , new and old . [She]177-bertha seemed sitting on them in rather dismal hen - like fashion , waiting to be asked to come out of [herself]177-bertha and reveal something . It was a corpse among other things that [she]177-bertha was sitting on , as [Kreisler]190-kreisler was one of [her]177-bertha secrets . Mournfully reproachful , [she]177-bertha kept guard over [her]177-bertha secrets , a store of bric - a - brac that had gone out of fashion and were getting musty in [a neglected shop]1960-a neglected shop . [Their]1959-they meetings sometimes were made painful by activity on [Bertha]177-bertha ’s part . An attempt at penetration to an intimacy once possessed can be more indecent than the same action on the part of [a stranger]509-a stranger . This time [he]1962-he was greeted with long mournful glances . [He]1962-he felt [she]177-bertha had thought of what [she]177-bertha should say . This interview meant a great deal to [her]177-bertha . [His]1962-he friendship meant more to [her]177-bertha now than ever . [The abject little room]1963-the abject little room seemed to be thrust forward to awaken [his]1962-he memories and ask for pity . An intense atmosphere of Teutonic suicide permeated everything . [He]1962-he could not move an eyelid or a muscle without wounding or slighting something . It was like being in [a dark kitchen]1964-a dark kitchen at night , where [you]1965-you know at every step [you]1965-you will put [your]1965-you foot on a beetle . It had a still closer analogy to this in the disgust [he]1962-he felt for these too naked and familiar things [he]1962-he was treading on . [He]1962-he scowled at [Beethoven]166-beethoven , who scowled back at [him]1962-he like [a reflection in a mirror]1966-a reflection in a mirror . It was the fate of both of [them]1967-them to haunt [this room]2507-this room . [The Mona Lisa]167-the mona lisa was there , and [the Breton sabots]346-the breton sabots and jars . [She]177-bertha might have a change of scenery sometimes ! [He]1962-he felt unreasonably that [she]177-bertha must have left things in the same place to reproduce a former mood in [him]1962-he . [His]1962-he photograph was prominent on [her]177-bertha writing - table ; [she]177-bertha seemed to say ( with a sort of sickly idiocy ) , “ [You]1962-he see , [he]1962-he is faithful to [me]177-bertha ! ”[177-bertha] [She]177-bertha preceded [him]1962-he to [[her]177-bertha sitting - room]1969-her sitting - room . From a typical and similar enervation of the will to that which was at the bottom of [his]1962-he troubles , [he]1962-he could hardly stop [himself]1962-he from putting [his]1962-he arm round [her]177-bertha waist while [they]1970-they stood for a moment close to [each other]370-each other . [He]1962-he did not wish to do this as a response to any resuscitating desire . It was only because it was the one thing [he]1962-he must not do . To throw [himself]1962-he into the abyss of perplexity [he]1962-he had just escaped from tempted [him]1962-he . The dykes and simulations of conduct were perpetually threatened by [his]1962-he neurasthenia in this way . [He]1962-he kept [his]1962-he hands in [his]1962-he pockets , however . When [they]1970-they had reached [the room]2366-the room , [she]177-bertha turned round , as [he]1962-he had half imagined , and caught hold of [his]1962-he hands . “ [Sorbert]270-sorbert , [Sorbert]270-sorbert ! ”[177-bertha] The words were said separately , each emphatic in significance . Yesterday [I]177-bertha met [a woman]2139-a woman . [I]177-bertha love [her]2139-a woman too . [I]177-bertha ca n’t help that . What must [I]177-bertha do ? ”[177-bertha] [Bertha]177-bertha turned a slightly stormier white . “ Who is [she]2139-a woman ? ”[177-bertha] “ [You]177-bertha know [her]2139-a woman . [She]2139-a woman is [Anastasya Vasek]216-anastasya . ”[1962-he] The news struck through something else , and , inside , [her]177-bertha ego shrank to an almost wizened being . [It]1974-it seemed glad of the protection the cocoon , the something , afforded [her]177-bertha . “ [You]177-bertha did not — find out what [my]1974-it news was . ”[1974-it] “ [I]1974-it did n’t . Have [you]1975-he anything---- ? ”[1974-it] “ Yes . [I]1975-he am enceinte . ”[1975-he] [He]1975-he thought about this in a clumsy , incredulous way . It was a [Roland]347-roland for [[his]1975-he [Oliver]348-oliver]1976-his oliver ! [She]1976-his oliver was going to have [a baby]1455-a baby ! With what regularity [he]1975-he was countered ! This event rose up in opposition to the night [he]1975-he had just spent , [his]1975-he new promises and hopes of swagger sex in the future . [He]1975-he was beaten . “ [Whose child]4169-whose child is [it]1455-a baby ? ”[1975-he] “ [Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s . ”[1975-he] “ There [you]1976-his oliver are ! ”[1975-he] [he]1975-he thought . [He]1975-he got up and stepped over to [her]1976-his oliver with a bright relieved look in [his]1975-he face . “ [Poor little girl]4170-poor little girl ! That ’s a bad business . But do n’t worry about it . [We]4171-we can get married and it can always pass as [mine]190-kreisler — if [we]4171-we do it quickly enough . ”[1975-he] [She]1976-his oliver looked up at [him]1975-he obliquely and sharply , with suspicion grown a habit . When [she]1976-his oliver saw the pleasant , assured expression , [she]1976-his oliver saw that at last things had turned . [Sorbert]270-sorbert was denying reality ! [He]270-sorbert was ending with miracles , against [himself]270-sorbert . [Her]1976-his oliver instinct had always told [her]1976-his oliver that generosity would not be wasted ! [She]1976-his oliver did not tell [him]1975-he of the actual circumstances under which [the child]1168-the child had come . That would have weakened [her]1976-his oliver happiness and [her]1976-his oliver case . CHAPTER V When [he]1975-he got outside [[Bertha]177-bertha ’s house]1979-bertha ’s house , [Bertha]177-bertha waving to [him]1975-he from the window with tears in [her]177-bertha eyes , [he]1975-he came in for the counter - attack . One after [the other the protesting masses of good sense]1980-the other the protesting masses of good sense rolled up . [He]1975-he picked [his]1975-he way out of [the avenue]2489-the avenue with a reasoning gesticulation of the body ; a chicken - like motion of sensible fastidious defence in front of buffonic violence . At the gate [he]1975-he exploded in harsh laughter , looking bravely and railingly out into [the world]2089-the world through [his]1975-he glasses . Then [he]1975-he walked slowly away in [his]1975-he short jacket , [his]1975-he buttocks moving methodically just beneath its rim . “ Ha ha ! Ha ha ! [Kreisleriana]349-kreisleriana ! ”[1975-he] [he]1975-he shouted without [his]1975-he voice . The indignant plebs of [his]1975-he glorious organism rioted around [his]1975-he mind . “ Ha ha ! Ha ha ! Sacré farceur , where are [you]1975-he leading [us]4172-us ? ”[1983-they] [They]1983-they were vociferous . “ [You]1975-he have kept [us]4172-us fooling in [this neighbourhood]659-this neighbourhood so long , and now [you]1975-he are pledging [us]4172-us to [your]1975-he idiotic fancy for ever . Ha ha ! Ha ha ! ”[1983-they] “ Be reasonable ! What are [you]1975-he doing , master of [our]4172-us destiny ? [We]4172-us shall all be lost ! ”[1984-a faction] [A faction]1984-a faction clamoured , “ [Anastasya]216-anastasya ! ”[1984-a faction] Certain sense - sections attacked [him]1975-he in vulnerable spots with [Anastasya]216-anastasya ’s voluptuous banner unfurled and fragrant . [He]1975-he buffeted [his]1975-he way along , as though spray were dashing in [his]1975-he face , watchful behind [his]1975-he glasses . [He]1975-he met [his]1975-he thoughts with a contemptuous stiff veteran smile . [This capricious and dangerous master]1985-this capricious and dangerous master had an offensive stylistic coolness , similar to [Wellington]350-wellington breakfasting at [Salamanca]117-salamanca while [Marmont]351-marmont hurried exultingly into traps ; although [he]1975-he resembled [[his]1975-he great countryman]1986-his great countryman in no other way . Those thoughts that bellowed , “ [Anastasya]216-anastasya ! ”[1975-he] however , worried [him]1975-he . [He]1975-he answered them . “ [Anastasya]216-anastasya ! [Anastasya]216-anastasya ! ! [I]1987-he know all about that ! What do [you]4174-you take [me]1987-he for ? [You]4174-you will still have [your]4174-you Anastasya . [I]1987-he am not selling [myself]1987-he or [you]4174-you . [A man such as [I]1987-he]4175-a man such as i does not dispose of [himself]4175-a man such as i in a case like this . [I]1987-he am going to marry [Bertha Lunken]177-bertha . Well ? Shall [I]1987-he be any the less [[my]1987-he own master]4176-my own master for that reason ? If [I]1987-he want to sleep with [Anastasya]216-anastasya , [I]1987-he shall do so . Why marry [Bertha Lunken]177-bertha , and shoulder all that semi - contagious muck ? Because it is only the points or movements in life that matter , and one of those points indicates that course , namely , to keep faith with [another person]2498-another person : and secretly to show [my]1987-he contempt for [the world]2089-the world by choosing [the premier venu]4179-the premier venu to be [my]1987-he body - servant and [body companion]4180-body companion ; [my]1987-he contempt for [my]1987-he body too . ”[1987-he] [He]1987-he sought to overcome [his]1987-he reasons by appeals to [their]1988-their corporate vanity [He]1987-he had experienced rather a wrench as regards [Anastasya]216-anastasya . The swanky sex with which [he]1987-he had ornamented [his]1987-he future could not be dismissed so easily . [He]1987-he was astonished that it could be dismissed at all , and asked [himself]1987-he the reason . [He]1987-he sacrificed [Anastasya]216-anastasya with a comparatively light heart . It was chiefly [his]1987-he vanity that gave trouble . [He]1987-he came back to [his]1987-he earlier conclusions . [Such successful people as [Anastasya]216-anastasya and [himself]1987-he]1989-such successful people as anastasya and himself were by [themselves]1989-such successful people as anastasya and himself . It was as impossible to combine or [we]1990-we d [them]1989-such successful people as anastasya and himself as to compound the genius of [two great artists]1991-two great artists . If [you]1992-you mixed together into [one whole Gainsborough]1993-one whole gainsborough and [Goya]118-goya [you]1992-you would get nothing , for [they]1991-two great artists would be mutually destructive . Beyond a certain point of perfection individual instinct was its own law . A subtle lyrical wail would gain nothing from living with a rough and powerful talent , or vice versa . Success is always personal . Co - operation , group - genius was , [he]1987-he was convinced , a slavish pretence and absurdity . Only when [the group]1994-the group was so big that it became [a person]2451-a person again , as with [a nation]1996-a nation , did [you]1992-you get mob - talent or popular art . [This big , diffuse , vehement giant]1997-this big , diffuse , vehement giant was the next best thing to [the great artist]1998-the great artist ; [Patchin Tcherana]352-patchin tcherana coming just below . [He]1987-he saw this quite clearly . [He]1987-he and [Anastasya]216-anastasya were a superfluity , and destructive conflict . It was like [a mother]1394-a mother being given [a child]499-a child to bear the same size already as [herself]1394-a mother . [Anastasya]216-anastasya was in every way too big ; [she]1394-a mother was too big physically . But did not sex change the whole question , when it was [a woman]2139-a woman ? [He]1987-he did not agree to this . [Woman]353-woman and the sexual sphere seemed , to [him]1987-he to be an average from which everything came : from it everything rose , or attempted to rise . There was no mysterious opposition extending up into [Heaven]113-heaven , and dividing [Heavenly Beings]354-heavenly beings into [Gods]2002-gods and [Goddesses]2003-goddesses . There was only [one God]2004-one god , and [he]2004-one god was [a man]2077-a man . [A woman]2139-a woman was a lower form of life . Everything was female to begin with . A jellyish diffuseness spread itself and gaped on the beds and in the bas - fonds of everything . Above a certain level of life sex disappeared , just as in highly organized sensualism sex vanishes . And , on the other hand , everything beneath that line was [female]1782-female . [Bard]355-bard , [Simpson]356-simpson , [Mackenzie]357-mackenzie , [Townsend]358-townsend , [Annandale]359-annandale — [he]1987-he enumerated [acquaintances evidently below the absolute line]2008-acquaintances evidently below the absolute line , and who displayed a lack of energy , permanently mesmeric state , and almost purely emotional reactions . [He]1987-he knew that everything on the superior side of that line was not purged of jellyish attributes ; also that [Anastasya]216-anastasya ’s flaccid and fundamental charms were formidable , although the line had been crossed by [her]2139-a woman . One thing was impressive , however . The loss of [Anastasya]216-anastasya did not worry [him]1987-he , except magnified through the legal acquisition of [Bertha]177-bertha . What did [he]1987-he want ? Well , [he]1987-he did not want [Anastasya]216-anastasya as much as [he]1987-he should . [He]1987-he was incorrigible , [he]1987-he concluded . [He]1987-he regarded the Anastasya evening as a sort of personal defeat even . The call of duty was nevertheless very strong . [He]1987-he ought to love [Anastasya]216-anastasya ; and [his]1987-he present intentions as regards [his]1987-he despicable fiancée were a disgraceful betrayal , etc . etc . The mutterings of reason continued . That evening [he]1987-he met [Anastasya]216-anastasya . The moment [he]1987-he saw [her]2139-a woman [he]1987-he realized the abysses of indignity and poorness [he]1987-he was flinging [himself]1987-he into -with [Bertha Lunken]177-bertha . A sudden humbleness entered [him]1987-he and put [him]1987-he out of conceit with [his]1987-he judgment , formed away from bright objects like [Anastasya]216-anastasya . The selfishness that caused [his]1987-he sentimentality when alone -with [Bertha]177-bertha was dissipated or not used in presence of more or less successful objects and [people]430-people . None of [his]1987-he ego was required by [[his]1987-he new woman]2010-his new woman . [She]2139-a woman possessed plenty of [her]2139-a woman own . This , [he]1987-he realized later , was the cause of [his]1987-he lack of attachment . [He]1987-he needed [an empty vessel]2011-an empty vessel to flood with [his]1987-he vitality , and not an equal and foreign vitality to exist side by side with coldly . [He]1987-he had taken into sex the procédés and selfish arrangements of life in general . [He]1987-he had humanized sex too much . [He]1987-he frequently admitted this , but with [his]1987-he defence lost sight of the flagrancy of the permanent fact . [He]1987-he felt in [Anastasya]216-anastasya for the first time now an element of protection and safety . [She]2139-a woman was a touch- wood and harbour from [his]1987-he perplexed interior life . [She]2139-a woman had a sort of ovation from [him]1987-he . All [his]1987-he obstinacy in favour of [[his]1987-he fiancee]2738-his fiancee had vanished . With [Anastasya]216-anastasya ’s appearance an entirely different world was revealed that demanded completely new arguments . [They]2013-they went to [the same restaurant]2014-the same restaurant as the night before . [He]1987-he talked quietly , until [they]2013-they had drunk too much , and [Bertha]177-bertha was not mentioned . “ And what of [Bertha]177-bertha ? ”[2139-a woman] [she]2139-a woman asked finally . “ Never mind about [Bertha]177-bertha . ”[2139-a woman] “ Is [she]177-bertha extinct ? ”[1987-he] “ No . [She]177-bertha threatens an entirely new sort of eruption . ”[2139-a woman] “ Oh . In what way new--- ? ”[2139-a woman] “ It does n’t matter . It wo n’t come [our]2013-they way . ”[1987-he] “ Are [you]1987-he going there to - morrow ? ”[2139-a woman] “ [I]2139-a woman suppose [I]2139-a woman must . But [I]2139-a woman shall not make many more visits of---- ”[2139-a woman] “ What ’s that ? ”[1987-he] “ [I]1987-he shall give up going , [I]1987-he say . ”[1987-he] [He]1987-he shifted restlessly in [his]1987-he chair . After breakfast next morning [they]2013-they parted , [Tarr]122-tarr going back to work . [Butcher]150-butcher , whom [he]122-tarr had not seen for some days , came in . [He]150-butcher agreed to go down into [town]2015-town and have lunch with [him]150-butcher . [Tarr]122-tarr put on a clean shirt . Talking to [Butcher]150-butcher while [he]122-tarr was changing , [he]122-tarr stood behind [[his]122-tarr bedroom]1951-his bedroom door . Men of ambitious physique , like [himself]122-tarr , [he]122-tarr had always noticed , were inclined to puff [themselves]2017-their out or let [their]2017-their arms hang in a position favourable to [their]2017-their muscles while changing before [another man]2151-another man . To avoid this embarrassment or absurdity , [he]122-tarr made a point of never exhibiting [himself]122-tarr unclothed . [His]122-tarr conversation with [Butcher]150-butcher did not fall on matters in hand . As with [Anastasya]216-anastasya , [he]122-tarr was unusually reticent . [He]122-tarr had turned over a new leaf . [He]122-tarr became rather alarmed at this [himself]122-tarr when [he]122-tarr realized it . After lunch [he]122-tarr left [Butcher]150-butcher and went to [the Mairie of [the Quartier du Paradis]3492-the quartier du paradis]2019-the mairie of the quartier du paradis and made inquiries about civil marriages . [He]122-tarr did it like a sleep - walker . [He]122-tarr was particularly amiable with [Bertha]177-bertha that day , and told [her]177-bertha of [his]122-tarr activities at [the Mairie]2021-the mairie and made an appointment with [her]177-bertha [there]2057-there for the next day . Daily , then , [he]122-tarr proceeded with [his]122-tarr marriage arrangements in the afternoons , saw [Bertha]177-bertha regularly , but without modifying the changed “ correctness ”[216-anastasya] of [his]122-tarr attitude . The evenings [he]122-tarr spent with [Anastasya]216-anastasya . By the time the marriage preliminaries had been gone through , and [Bertha]177-bertha and [he]122-tarr could Anally be united , [his]122-tarr relations with [Anastasya]216-anastasya had become as close as formerly [his]122-tarr friendship with [Bertha]177-bertha had been . [Anastasya]216-anastasya knew nothing about these things . Neither [Bertha]177-bertha nor [she]177-bertha were seeing [[their]2024-we German women friends]2025-their german women friends for the moment . After the marriage at the [Mairie Bertha]360-mairie bertha and [Tarr]122-tarr walked back to [the Luxembourg Gardens]3663-the luxembourg gardens and sat down . [She]177-bertha had not during the three intervening weeks mentioned [Anastasya]216-anastasya . It was no time for generosity ; [she]177-bertha had done too much of that . [Fraulein Vasek]232-fraulein vasek was [the last person for whom [she]177-bertha felt inclined to revive chivalry]2027-the last person for whom she felt inclined to revive chivalry . [He]2030-i got up . “ It ’s rather chilly . Let ’s get back . ”[2030-i] [They]2029-they walked for some time without speaking . So much unsaid had to be got rid of , without necessarily being said . [He]2031-you was telling [her]2032-she what [he]2031-you had been doing . [They]2033-they both immediately retired into [themselves]2033-they , [she]2032-she to distance and stow away [their]2033-they former dialogue and consider the meaning of this new fact ; [he]2031-you to wait , [his]2031-you hand near [his]2031-you mouth holding a pipe , until [she]2032-she should have collected [herself]2032-she . But [he]2031-you began speaking first : “ Things are exactly the same as before . [I]2031-you was bound to do that . [I]2031-you had allowed [her]177-bertha to consider [herself]177-bertha engaged a year ago , and had to keep to that . [I]2031-you have merely gone back a year into the past and fulfilled a pledge , and now return to [you]2032-she . All is in perfect order . ”[2031-you] “ All is not in perfect order . It is [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s child]4191-kreisler ’s child to begin with , [you]2031-you say---- ”[2031-you] “ Yes , but it would be very mean to use that fact to justify one in escaping from an obligation . ”[2031-you] “ That is sentimentality . ”[2031-you] “ Sentimentality ! Sentimentality ! Can not [we]2033-they , [you]2031-you and [I]2031-you , afford to give [Bertha]177-bertha that‘I Sentimentality ! What an absurd word that is with its fierce use in [our]2033-they poor modern hands ! What does it mean ? Has life become such an affair of economic calculation that [men]518-men are too timid to allow [themselves]518-men any complicated pleasures ? Where there is abundance [you]2031-you can afford waste . Sentimentality is a cry on a level with the Simple Life ! The ideal of perfect success is an ideal belonging to [the same sort of individual]4193-the same sort of individual as [the inventor of Equal Rights of Man]4194-the inventor of equal rights of man and [Perfectibility]362-perfectibility . Sentimentality is a privilege . It is a luxury that [the crowd]1403-the crowd does not feel itself equal to , once [it]1403-the crowd begins to think about it . Besides , it is different in different hands . ”[2031-you] “ That may be true as regards sentimentality in general . But in this case [you]2031-you have been guilty of a popular softness---- ”[2031-you] “ No . Listen . [I]2031-you will explain something to [you]2031-you . [You]2031-you said a moment ago that it was [[Kreisler]190-kreisler ’s child]4191-kreisler ’s child . Well , that is [my]2031-you security ! That enables [me]2031-you to commit this folly , without too great danger . It is an earnest of the altruistic origin of the action not being forgotten ! ”[2031-you] “ But that — to return to [your]2031-you words — is surely a very mean calculation ? ”[2031-you] “ Therefore it takes the softness out of the generous action it is allied to----- ”[2031-you] “ No . [It]4197-it takes its raison d’etre away altogether . It leaves it merely a stupid and unnecessary fact . [It]4197-it cancels the generosity , but leaves the fact — [your]2031-you marriage . ”[2031-you] “ But the fact itself is altered by that ! ”[2031-you] “ In what way ? [You]2031-you are now married to [Bertha----]264-bertha---- ”[2031-you] “ Yes , but what does that mean ? [I]2031-you married [Bertha]177-bertha this afternoon , and here [I]2031-you am punctually and as usual with [you]2031-you this evening---- ”[2031-you] “ But the fact of [your]2031-you having married [Bertha]177-bertha this afternoon will prevent [your]2031-you making any one else [[your]2031-you wife]4198-your wife in the future . Supposing [I]2031-you had [a child]499-a child by [you]2031-you — not by [Kreisler]190-kreisler — it would be impossible to legitimatize [him]190-kreisler . The thing is of no importance in itself . [Tarr]122-tarr , however , had [three children]2048-three children by [a lady of the name of [Rose Fawcett]363-rose fawcett]2049-a lady of the name of rose fawcett , who consoled [him]122-tarr eventually for the splendours of [[his]122-tarr “ perfect woman]4202-his “ perfect woman . ”[363-rose fawcett] But yet beyond the dim though solid figure of [Rose Fawcett]363-rose fawcett , another rises .
